27 import sys
28 
29 
30 
31 
32 import os.path
33 
34 
35 
36 import sys
37 import codecs
38 
39 
40 
41 import sys
42 
43 class Trace(object):
44  "A tracing class"
45 
46  debugmode = False
47  quietmode = False
48  showlinesmode = False
49 
50  prefix = None
51 
52  def debug(cls, message):
53  "Show a debug message"
54  if not Trace.debugmode or Trace.quietmode:
55  return
56  Trace.show(message, sys.stdout)
57 
58  def message(cls, message):
59  "Show a trace message"
60  if Trace.quietmode:
61  return
62  if Trace.prefix and Trace.showlinesmode:
63  message = Trace.prefix + message
64  Trace.show(message, sys.stdout)
65 
66  def error(cls, message):
67  "Show an error message"
68  message = '* ' + message
69  if Trace.prefix and Trace.showlinesmode:
70  message = Trace.prefix + message
71  Trace.show(message, sys.stderr)
72 
73  def fatal(cls, message):
74  "Show an error message and terminate"
75  Trace.error('FATAL: ' + message)
76  exit(-1)
77 
78  def show(cls, message, channel):
79  "Show a message out of a channel"
80  if sys.version_info < (3,0):
81  message = message.encode('utf-8')
82  channel.write(message + '\n')
83 
84  debug = classmethod(debug)
85  message = classmethod(message)
86  error = classmethod(error)
87  fatal = classmethod(fatal)
88  show = classmethod(show)
89 
90 
91 
92 class LineReader(object):
93  "Reads a file line by line"
94 
95  def __init__(self, filename):
96  if isinstance(filename, file):
97  self.file = filename
98  else:
99  self.file = codecs.open(filename, 'rU', 'utf-8')
100  self.linenumber = 1
101  self.lastline = None
102  self.current = None
103  self.mustread = True
104  self.depleted = False
105  try:
106  self.readline()
107  except UnicodeDecodeError:
108  # try compressed file
109  import gzip
110  self.file = gzip.open(filename, 'rb')
111  self.readline()
112 
113  def setstart(self, firstline):
114  "Set the first line to read."
115  for i in range(firstline):
116  self.file.readline()
117  self.linenumber = firstline
118 
119  def setend(self, lastline):
120  "Set the last line to read."
121  self.lastline = lastline
122 
123  def currentline(self):
124  "Get the current line"
125  if self.mustread:
126  self.readline()
127  return self.current
128 
129  def nextline(self):
130  "Go to next line"
131  if self.depleted:
132  Trace.fatal('Read beyond file end')
133  self.mustread = True
134 
135  def readline(self):
136  "Read a line from elyxer.file"
137  self.current = self.file.readline()
138  if not isinstance(self.file, codecs.StreamReaderWriter):
139  self.current = self.current.decode('utf-8')
140  if len(self.current) == 0:
141  self.depleted = True
142  self.current = self.current.rstrip('\n\r')
143  self.linenumber += 1
144  self.mustread = False
145  Trace.prefix = 'Line ' + unicode(self.linenumber) + ': '
146  if self.linenumber % 1000 == 0:
147  Trace.message('Parsing')
148 
149  def finished(self):
150  "Find out if the file is finished"
151  if self.lastline and self.linenumber == self.lastline:
152  return True
153  if self.mustread:
154  self.readline()
155  return self.depleted
156 
157  def close(self):
158  self.file.close()
159 
160 class LineWriter(object):
161  "Writes a file as a series of lists"
162 
163  file = False
164 
165  def __init__(self, filename):
166  if isinstance(filename, file):
167  self.file = filename
168  self.filename = None
169  else:
170  self.filename = filename
171 
172  def write(self, strings):
173  "Write a list of strings"
174  for string in strings:
175  if not isinstance(string, basestring):
176  Trace.error('Not a string: ' + unicode(string) + ' in ' + unicode(strings))
177  return
178  self.writestring(string)
179 
180  def writestring(self, string):
181  "Write a string"
182  if not self.file:
183  self.file = codecs.open(self.filename, 'w', "utf-8")
184  if self.file == sys.stdout and sys.version_info < (3,0):
185  string = string.encode('utf-8')
186  self.file.write(string)
187 
188  def writeline(self, line):
189  "Write a line to file"
190  self.writestring(line + '\n')
191 
192  def close(self):
193  self.file.close()
194 
195 
196 
197 
198 import os.path
199 import sys
200 
201 
202 class BibStylesConfig(object):
203  "Configuration class from elyxer.config file"
204 
205  abbrvnat = {
206 
207  u'@article':u'$authors. $title. <i>$journal</i>,{ {$volume:}$pages,} $month $year.{ doi: $doi.}{ URL <a href="$url">$url</a>.}{ $note.}',
208  u'cite':u'$surname($year)',
209  u'default':u'$authors. <i>$title</i>. $publisher, $year.{ URL <a href="$url">$url</a>.}{ $note.}',
210  }
211 
212  alpha = {
213 
214  u'@article':u'$authors. $title.{ <i>$journal</i>{, {$volume}{($number)}}{: $pages}{, $year}.}{ <a href="$url">$url</a>.}{ <a href="$filename">$filename</a>.}{ $note.}',
215  u'cite':u'$Sur$YY',
216  u'default':u'$authors. $title.{ <i>$journal</i>,} $year.{ <a href="$url">$url</a>.}{ <a href="$filename">$filename</a>.}{ $note.}',
217  }
218

220

222  u'@book':u'$authors. $year. <i>$title</i>. $publisher.{ URL <a href="$url">$url</a>.}{ $note.}',
223  u'cite':u'$surname, $year',
224  u'default':u'$authors. $year. <i>$title</i>. $publisher.{ URL <a href="$url">$url</a>.}{ $note.}',
225  }
226

443 class FormulaConfig(object):
444  "Configuration class from elyxer.config file"
445 
446  alphacommands = {
447  u'\\AA':u'Å', u'\\AE':u'Æ',
448  u'\\AmS':u'<span class="versalitas">AmS</span>', u'\\Angstroem':u'Å',

460  u'\\theta':u'θ', u'\\upsilon':u'υ', u'\\varDelta':u'∆',
461  u'\\varGamma':u'Γ', u'\\varLambda':u'Λ', u'\\varOmega':u'Ω',
462  u'\\varPhi':u'Φ', u'\\varPi':u'Π', u'\\varPsi':u'Ψ', u'\\varSigma':u'Σ',
463  u'\\varTheta':u'Θ', u'\\varUpsilon':u'Υ', u'\\varXi':u'Ξ',
464  u'\\varbeta':u'ϐ', u'\\varepsilon':u'ε', u'\\varkappa':u'ϰ',
465  u'\\varphi':u'φ', u'\\varpi':u'ϖ', u'\\varrho':u'ϱ', u'\\varsigma':u'ς',
466  u'\\vartheta':u'ϑ', u'\\xi':u'ξ', u'\\zeta':u'ζ',
467  }
468 
469  array = {
470  u'begin':u'\\begin', u'cellseparator':u'&', u'end':u'\\end',
471  u'rowseparator':u'\\\\',
472  }
473 
474  bigbrackets = {
475  u'(':[u'⎛',u'⎜',u'⎝',], u')':[u'⎞',u'⎟',u'⎠',], u'[':[u'⎡',u'⎢',u'⎣',],

972 class NumberingConfig(object):
973  "Configuration class from elyxer.config file"

976

980 
981  sequence = {
982  u'symbols':[u'*',u'**',u'†',u'‡',u'§',u'§§',u'¶',u'¶¶',u'#',u'##',],
983  }
984 
985 class StyleConfig(object):
986  "Configuration class from elyxer.config file"
987 
988  hspaces = {
989  u'\\enskip{}':u' ', u'\\hfill{}':u'<span class="hfill"> </span>',
990  u'\\hspace*{\\fill}':u' ', u'\\hspace*{}':u'', u'\\hspace{}':u' ',
991  u'\\negthinspace{}':u'', u'\\qquad{}':u'  ', u'\\quad{}':u' ',
992  u'\\space{}':u' ', u'\\thinspace{}':u' ', u'~':u' ',
993  }
994 
995  quotes = {
996  u'ald':u'»', u'als':u'›', u'ard':u'«', u'ars':u'‹', u'eld':u'&ldquo;',
997  u'els':u'&lsquo;', u'erd':u'&rdquo;', u'ers':u'&rsquo;', u'fld':u'«',
998  u'fls':u'‹', u'frd':u'»', u'frs':u'›', u'gld':u'„', u'gls':u'‚',

1001  }

1005  u'ref':u'@↕', u'vpageref':u'on-page#↕', u'vref':u'@on-page#↕',
1006  }
1007

1009  u'ignoredtexts':[u'col',u'text',u'line',u'page',u'theight',u'pheight',],
1010  }

1013  u'bigskip':u'<div class="bigskip"> </div>',

1018  }

1079 class TranslationConfig(object):
1080  "Configuration class from elyxer.config file"
1081 
1082  constants = {
1083  u'Appendix':u'Appendix', u'Book':u'Book', u'Chapter':u'Chapter',
1084  u'Paragraph':u'Paragraph', u'Part':u'Part', u'Section':u'Section',
1085  u'Subsection':u'Subsection', u'Subsubsection':u'Subsubsection',
1086  u'abstract':u'Abstract', u'bibliography':u'Bibliography',
1087  u'figure':u'figure', u'float-algorithm':u'Algorithm ',
1088  u'float-figure':u'Figure ', u'float-listing':u'Listing ',
1089  u'float-table':u'Table ', u'float-tableau':u'Tableau ',
1090  u'footnotes':u'Footnotes', u'generated-by':u'Document generated by ',
1091  u'generated-on':u' on ', u'index':u'Index',
1092  u'jsmath-enable':u'Please enable JavaScript on your browser.',
1093  u'jsmath-requires':u' requires JavaScript to correctly process the mathematics on this page. ',
1094  u'jsmath-warning':u'Warning: ', u'list-algorithm':u'List of Algorithms',
1095  u'list-figure':u'List of Figures', u'list-table':u'List of Tables',
1096  u'list-tableau':u'List of Tableaux', u'main-page':u'Main page',
1097  u'next':u'Next', u'nomenclature':u'Nomenclature',
1098  u'on-page':u' on page ', u'prev':u'Prev', u'references':u'References',
1099  u'toc':u'Table of Contents', u'toc-for':u'Contents for ', u'up':u'Up',
1100  }
1101 
1102  languages = {
1103  u'american':u'en', u'british':u'en', u'deutsch':u'de', u'dutch':u'nl',
1104  u'english':u'en', u'french':u'fr', u'ngerman':u'de', u'russian':u'ru',
1105  u'spanish':u'es',
1106  }

1110 
1111 
1112 
1113 class CommandLineParser(object):
1114  "A parser for runtime options"
1115 
1116  def __init__(self, options):
1117  self.options = options
1118 
1119  def parseoptions(self, args):
1120  "Parse command line options"
1121  if len(args) == 0:
1122  return None
1123  while len(args) > 0 and args[0].startswith('--'):
1124  key, value = self.readoption(args)
1125  if not key:
1126  return 'Option ' + value + ' not recognized'
1127  if not value:
1128  return 'Option ' + key + ' needs a value'
1129  setattr(self.options, key, value)
1130  return None
1131 
1132  def readoption(self, args):
1133  "Read the key and value for an option"
1134  arg = args[0][2:]
1135  del args[0]
1136  if '=' in arg:
1137  key = self.readequalskey(arg, args)
1138  else:
1139  key = arg.replace('-', '')
1140  if not hasattr(self.options, key):
1141  return None, key
1142  current = getattr(self.options, key)
1143  if isinstance(current, bool):
1144  return key, True
1145  # read value
1146  if len(args) == 0:
1147  return key, None
1148  if args[0].startswith('"'):
1149  initial = args[0]
1150  del args[0]
1151  return key, self.readquoted(args, initial)
1152  value = args[0].decode('utf-8')
1153  del args[0]
1154  if isinstance(current, list):
1155  current.append(value)
1156  return key, current
1157  return key, value
1158 
1159  def readquoted(self, args, initial):
1160  "Read a value between quotes"
1161  Trace.error('Oops')
1162  value = initial[1:]
1163  while len(args) > 0 and not args[0].endswith('"') and not args[0].startswith('--'):
1164  Trace.error('Appending ' + args[0])
1165  value += ' ' + args[0]
1166  del args[0]
1167  if len(args) == 0 or args[0].startswith('--'):
1168  return None
1169  value += ' ' + args[0:-1]
1170  return value
1171 
1172  def readequalskey(self, arg, args):
1173  "Read a key using equals"
1174  split = arg.split('=', 1)
1175  key = split[0]
1176  value = split[1]
1177  args.insert(0, value)
1178  return key
1179 
1180 
1181 
1182 class Options(object):
1183  "A set of runtime options"
1184 
1185  instance = None
1186 
1187  location = None
1188  nocopy = False
1189  copyright = False
1190  debug = False
1191  quiet = False
1192  version = False
1193  hardversion = False
1194  versiondate = False
1195  html = False
1196  help = False
1197  showlines = True
1198  unicode = False
1199  iso885915 = False
1200  css = []
1201  title = None
1202  directory = None
1203  destdirectory = None
1204  toc = False
1205  toctarget = ''
1206  tocfor = None
1207  forceformat = None
1208  lyxformat = False
1209  target = None
1210  splitpart = None
1211  memory = True
1212  lowmem = False
1213  nobib = False
1214  converter = 'imagemagick'
1215  raw = False
1216  jsmath = None
1217  mathjax = None
1218  nofooter = False
1219  simplemath = False
1220  template = None
1221  noconvert = False
1222  notoclabels = False
1223  letterfoot = True
1224  numberfoot = False
1225  symbolfoot = False
1226  hoverfoot = True
1227  marginfoot = False
1228  endfoot = False
1229  supfoot = True
1230  alignfoot = False
1231  footnotes = None
1232  imageformat = None
1233  copyimages = False
1234  googlecharts = False
1235  embedcss = []
1236 
1237  branches = dict()
1238 
1239  def parseoptions(self, args):
1240  "Parse command line options"
1241  Options.location = args[0]
1242  del args[0]
1243  parser = CommandLineParser(Options)
1244  result = parser.parseoptions(args)
1245  if result:
1246  Trace.error(result)
1247  self.usage()
1248  self.processoptions()
1249 
1250  def processoptions(self):
1251  "Process all options parsed."
1252  if Options.help:
1253  self.usage()
1254  if Options.version:
1255  self.showversion()
1256  if Options.hardversion:
1257  self.showhardversion()
1258  if Options.versiondate:
1259  self.showversiondate()
1260  if Options.lyxformat:
1261  self.showlyxformat()
1262  if Options.splitpart:
1263  try:
1264  Options.splitpart = int(Options.splitpart)
1265  if Options.splitpart <= 0:
1266  Trace.error('--splitpart requires a number bigger than zero')
1267  self.usage()
1268  except:
1269  Trace.error('--splitpart needs a numeric argument, not ' + Options.splitpart)
1270  self.usage()
1271  if Options.lowmem or Options.toc or Options.tocfor:
1272  Options.memory = False
1273  self.parsefootnotes()
1274  if Options.forceformat and not Options.imageformat:
1275  Options.imageformat = Options.forceformat
1276  if Options.imageformat == 'copy':
1277  Options.copyimages = True
1278  if Options.css == []:
1279  Options.css = ['http://elyxer.nongnu.org/lyx.css']
1280  if Options.html:
1281  Options.simplemath = True
1282  if Options.toc and not Options.tocfor:
1283  Trace.error('Option --toc is deprecated; use --tocfor "page" instead')
1284  Options.tocfor = Options.toctarget
1285  if Options.nocopy:
1286  Trace.error('Option --nocopy is deprecated; it is no longer needed')
1287  if Options.jsmath:
1288  Trace.error('Option --jsmath is deprecated; use --mathjax instead')
1289  # set in Trace if necessary
1290  for param in dir(Trace):
1291  if param.endswith('mode'):
1292  setattr(Trace, param, getattr(self, param[:-4]))
1293 
1294  def usage(self):
1295  "Show correct usage"
1296  Trace.error('Usage: ' + os.path.basename(Options.location) + ' [options] [filein] [fileout]')
1297  Trace.error('Convert LyX input file "filein" to HTML file "fileout".')
1298  Trace.error('If filein (or fileout) is not given use standard input (or output).')
1299  Trace.error('Main program of the eLyXer package (http://elyxer.nongnu.org/).')
1300  self.showoptions()
1301 
1302  def parsefootnotes(self):
1303  "Parse footnotes options."
1304  if not Options.footnotes:
1305  return
1306  Options.marginfoot = False
1307  Options.letterfoot = False
1308  Options.hoverfoot = False
1309  options = Options.footnotes.split(',')
1310  for option in options:
1311  footoption = option + 'foot'
1312  if hasattr(Options, footoption):
1313  setattr(Options, footoption, True)
1314  else:
1315  Trace.error('Unknown footnotes option: ' + option)
1316  if not Options.endfoot and not Options.marginfoot and not Options.hoverfoot:
1317  Options.hoverfoot = True
1318  if not Options.numberfoot and not Options.symbolfoot:
1319  Options.letterfoot = True
1320 
1321  def showoptions(self):
1322  "Show all possible options"
1323  Trace.error(' Common options:')
1324  Trace.error(' --help: show this online help')
1325  Trace.error(' --quiet: disables all runtime messages')
1326  Trace.error('')
1327  Trace.error(' Advanced options:')
1328  Trace.error(' --debug: enable debugging messages (for developers)')
1329  Trace.error(' --version: show version number and release date')
1330  Trace.error(' --lyxformat: return the highest LyX version supported')
1331  Trace.error(' Options for HTML output:')
1332  Trace.error(' --title "title": set the generated page title')
1333  Trace.error(' --css "file.css": use a custom CSS file')
1334  Trace.error(' --embedcss "file.css": embed styles from a CSS file into the output')
1335  Trace.error(' --html: output HTML 4.0 instead of the default XHTML')
1336  Trace.error(' --unicode: full Unicode output')
1337  Trace.error(' --iso885915: output a document with ISO-8859-15 encoding')
1338  Trace.error(' --nofooter: remove the footer "generated by eLyXer"')
1339  Trace.error(' --simplemath: do not generate fancy math constructions')
1340  Trace.error(' Options for image output:')
1341  Trace.error(' --directory "img_dir": look for images in the specified directory')
1342  Trace.error(' --destdirectory "dest": put converted images into this directory')
1343  Trace.error(' --imageformat ".ext": image output format, or "copy" to copy images')
1344  Trace.error(' --noconvert: do not convert images, use in original locations')
1345  Trace.error(' --converter "inkscape": use an alternative program to convert images')
1346  Trace.error(' Options for footnote display:')
1347  Trace.error(' --numberfoot: mark footnotes with numbers instead of letters')
1348  Trace.error(' --symbolfoot: mark footnotes with symbols (*, **...)')
1349  Trace.error(' --hoverfoot: show footnotes as hovering text (default)')
1350  Trace.error(' --marginfoot: show footnotes on the page margin')
1351  Trace.error(' --endfoot: show footnotes at the end of the page')
1352  Trace.error(' --supfoot: use superscript for footnote markers (default)')
1353  Trace.error(' --alignfoot: use aligned text for footnote markers')
1354  Trace.error(' --footnotes "options": specify several comma-separated footnotes options')
1355  Trace.error(' Available options are: "number", "symbol", "hover", "margin", "end",')
1356  Trace.error(' "sup", "align"')
1357  Trace.error(' Advanced output options:')
1358  Trace.error(' --splitpart "depth": split the resulting webpage at the given depth')
1359  Trace.error(' --tocfor "page": generate a TOC that points to the given page')
1360  Trace.error(' --target "frame": make all links point to the given frame')
1361  Trace.error(' --notoclabels: omit the part labels in the TOC, such as Chapter')
1362  Trace.error(' --lowmem: do the conversion on the fly (conserve memory)')
1363  Trace.error(' --raw: generate HTML without header or footer.')
1364  Trace.error(' --mathjax remote: use MathJax remotely to display equations')
1365  Trace.error(' --mathjax "URL": use MathJax from the given URL to display equations')
1366  Trace.error(' --googlecharts: use Google Charts to generate formula images')
1367  Trace.error(' --template "file": use a template, put everything in <!--$content-->')
1368  Trace.error(' --copyright: add a copyright notice at the bottom')
1369  Trace.error(' Deprecated options:')
1370  Trace.error(' --toc: (deprecated) create a table of contents')
1371  Trace.error(' --toctarget "page": (deprecated) generate a TOC for the given page')
1372  Trace.error(' --nocopy: (deprecated) maintained for backwards compatibility')
1373  Trace.error(' --jsmath "URL": use jsMath from the given URL to display equations')
1374  sys.exit()
1375 
1376  def showversion(self):
1377  "Return the current eLyXer version string"
1378  string = 'eLyXer version ' + GeneralConfig.version['number']
1379  string += ' (' + GeneralConfig.version['date'] + ')'
1380  Trace.error(string)
1381  sys.exit()
1382 
1383  def showhardversion(self):
1384  "Return just the version string"
1385  Trace.message(GeneralConfig.version['number'])
1386  sys.exit()
1387 
1388  def showversiondate(self):
1389  "Return just the version dte"
1390  Trace.message(GeneralConfig.version['date'])
1391  sys.exit()
1392 
1393  def showlyxformat(self):
1394  "Return just the lyxformat parameter"
1395  Trace.message(GeneralConfig.version['lyxformat'])
1396  sys.exit()
1397 
1398 class BranchOptions(object):
1399  "A set of options for a branch"
1400 
1401  def __init__(self, name):
1402  self.name = name
1403  self.options = {'color':'#ffffff'}
1404 
1405  def set(self, key, value):
1406  "Set a branch option"
1407  if not key.startswith(ContainerConfig.string['startcommand']):
1408  Trace.error('Invalid branch option ' + key)
1409  return
1410  key = key.replace(ContainerConfig.string['startcommand'], '')
1411  self.options[key] = value
1412 
1413  def isselected(self):
1414  "Return if the branch is selected"
1415  if not 'selected' in self.options:
1416  return False
1417  return self.options['selected'] == '1'
1418 
1419  def __unicode__(self):
1420  "String representation"
1421  return 'options for ' + self.name + ': ' + unicode(self.options)
1422 
1423 
1424 
1425 
1426 
1427 
1428 
1429 
1430 
1431 
1432 
1433 
1434 
1435 import gettext
1436 
1437 
1438 
1439 
1440 
1441 class DocumentParameters(object):
1442  "Global parameters for the document."
1443 
1444  pdftitle = None
1445  indentstandard = False
1446  tocdepth = 10
1447  startinglevel = 0
1448  maxdepth = 10
1449  language = None
1450  bibliography = None
1451  outputchanges = False
1452  displaymode = False
1453 
1454 
1455 
1456 class Translator(object):
1457  "Reads the configuration file and tries to find a translation."
1458  "Otherwise falls back to the messages in the config file."
1459 
1460  instance = None
1461 
1462  def translate(cls, key):
1463  "Get the translated message for a key."
1464  return cls.instance.getmessage(key)
1465 
1466  translate = classmethod(translate)
1467 
1468  def __init__(self):
1469  self.translation = None
1470  self.first = True
1471 
1472  def findtranslation(self):
1473  "Find the translation for the document language."
1474  self.langcodes = None
1475  if not DocumentParameters.language:
1476  Trace.error('No language in document')
1477  return
1478  if not DocumentParameters.language in TranslationConfig.languages:
1479  Trace.error('Unknown language ' + DocumentParameters.language)
1480  return
1481  if TranslationConfig.languages[DocumentParameters.language] == 'en':
1482  return
1483  langcodes = [TranslationConfig.languages[DocumentParameters.language]]
1484  try:
1485  self.translation = gettext.translation('elyxer', None, langcodes)
1486  except IOError:
1487  Trace.error('No translation for ' + unicode(langcodes))
1488 
1489  def getmessage(self, key):
1490  "Get the translated message for the given key."
1491  if self.first:
1492  self.findtranslation()
1493  self.first = False
1494  message = self.getuntranslated(key)
1495  if not self.translation:
1496  return message
1497  try:
1498  message = self.translation.ugettext(message)
1499  except IOError:
1500  pass
1501  return message
1502 
1503  def getuntranslated(self, key):
1504  "Get the untranslated message."
1505  if not key in TranslationConfig.constants:
1506  Trace.error('Cannot translate ' + key)
1507  return key
1508  return TranslationConfig.constants[key]
1509 
1510 Translator.instance = Translator()
1511 
1512 
1513 
1514 class NumberCounter(object):
1515  "A counter for numbers (by default)."
1516  "The type can be changed to return letters, roman numbers..."
1517 
1518  name = None
1519  value = None
1520  mode = None
1521  master = None
1522 
1523  letters = 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ'
1524  symbols = NumberingConfig.sequence['symbols']
1525  romannumerals = [
1526  ('M', 1000), ('CM', 900), ('D', 500), ('CD', 400), ('C', 100),
1527  ('XC', 90), ('L', 50), ('XL', 40), ('X', 10), ('IX', 9), ('V', 5),
1528  ('IV', 4), ('I', 1)
1529  ]
1530 
1531  def __init__(self, name):
1532  "Give a name to the counter."
1533  self.name = name
1534 
1535  def setmode(self, mode):
1536  "Set the counter mode. Can be changed at runtime."
1537  self.mode = mode
1538  return self
1539 
1540  def init(self, value):
1541  "Set an initial value."
1542  self.value = value
1543 
1544  def gettext(self):
1545  "Get the next value as a text string."
1546  return unicode(self.value)
1547 
1548  def getletter(self):
1549  "Get the next value as a letter."
1550  return self.getsequence(self.letters)
1551 
1552  def getsymbol(self):
1553  "Get the next value as a symbol."
1554  return self.getsequence(self.symbols)
1555 
1556  def getsequence(self, sequence):
1557  "Get the next value from elyxer.a sequence."
1558  return sequence[(self.value - 1) % len(sequence)]
1559 
1560  def getroman(self):
1561  "Get the next value as a roman number."
1562  result = ''
1563  number = self.value
1564  for numeral, value in self.romannumerals:
1565  if number >= value:
1566  result += numeral * (number / value)
1567  number = number % value
1568  return result
1569 
1570  def getvalue(self):
1571  "Get the current value as configured in the current mode."
1572  if not self.mode or self.mode in ['text', '1']:
1573  return self.gettext()
1574  if self.mode == 'A':
1575  return self.getletter()
1576  if self.mode == 'a':
1577  return self.getletter().lower()
1578  if self.mode == 'I':
1579  return self.getroman()
1580  if self.mode == '*':
1581  return self.getsymbol()
1582  Trace.error('Unknown counter mode ' + self.mode)
1583  return self.gettext()
1584 
1585  def getnext(self):
1586  "Increase the current value and get the next value as configured."
1587  if not self.value:
1588  self.value = 0
1589  self.value += 1
1590  return self.getvalue()
1591 
1592  def reset(self):
1593  "Reset the counter."
1594  self.value = 0
1595 
1596  def __unicode__(self):
1597  "Return a printable representation."
1598  result = 'Counter ' + self.name
1599  if self.mode:
1600  result += ' in mode ' + self.mode
1601  return result
1602 
1603 class DependentCounter(NumberCounter):
1604  "A counter which depends on another one (the master)."
1605 
1606  def setmaster(self, master):
1607  "Set the master counter."
1608  self.master = master
1609  self.last = self.master.getvalue()
1610  return self
1611 
1612  def getnext(self):
1613  "Increase or, if the master counter has changed, restart."
1614  if self.last != self.master.getvalue():
1615  self.reset()
1616  value = NumberCounter.getnext(self)
1617  self.last = self.master.getvalue()
1618  return value
1619 
1620  def getvalue(self):
1621  "Get the value of the combined counter: master.dependent."
1622  return self.master.getvalue() + '.' + NumberCounter.getvalue(self)
1623 
1624 class NumberGenerator(object):
1625  "A number generator for unique sequences and hierarchical structures. Used in:"
1626  " * ordered part numbers: Chapter 3, Section 5.3."
1627  " * unique part numbers: Footnote 15, Bibliography cite [15]."
1628  " * chaptered part numbers: Figure 3.15, Equation (8.3)."
1629  " * unique roman part numbers: Part I, Book IV."
1630 
1631  chaptered = None
1632  generator = None
1633 
1634  romanlayouts = [x.lower() for x in NumberingConfig.layouts['roman']]
1635  orderedlayouts = [x.lower() for x in NumberingConfig.layouts['ordered']]
1636 
1637  counters = dict()
1638  appendix = None
1639 
1640  def deasterisk(self, type):
1641  "Remove the possible asterisk in a layout type."
1642  return type.replace('*', '')
1643 
1644  def isunique(self, type):
1645  "Find out if the layout type corresponds to a unique part."
1646  return self.isroman(type)
1647 
1648  def isroman(self, type):
1649  "Find out if the layout type should have roman numeration."
1650  return self.deasterisk(type).lower() in self.romanlayouts
1651 
1652  def isinordered(self, type):
1653  "Find out if the layout type corresponds to an (un)ordered part."
1654  return self.deasterisk(type).lower() in self.orderedlayouts
1655 
1656  def isnumbered(self, type):
1657  "Find out if the type for a layout corresponds to a numbered layout."
1658  if '*' in type:
1659  return False
1660  if self.isroman(type):
1661  return True
1662  if not self.isinordered(type):
1663  return False
1664  if self.getlevel(type) > DocumentParameters.maxdepth:
1665  return False
1666  return True
1667 
1668  def isunordered(self, type):
1669  "Find out if the type contains an asterisk, basically."
1670  return '*' in type
1671 
1672  def getlevel(self, type):
1673  "Get the level that corresponds to a layout type."
1674  if self.isunique(type):
1675  return 0
1676  if not self.isinordered(type):
1677  Trace.error('Unknown layout type ' + type)
1678  return 0
1679  type = self.deasterisk(type).lower()
1680  level = self.orderedlayouts.index(type) + 1
1681  return level - DocumentParameters.startinglevel
1682 
1683  def getparttype(self, type):
1684  "Obtain the type for the part: without the asterisk, "
1685  "and switched to Appendix if necessary."
1686  if NumberGenerator.appendix and self.getlevel(type) == 1:
1687  return 'Appendix'
1688  return self.deasterisk(type)
1689 
1690  def generate(self, type):
1691  "Generate a number for a layout type."
1692  "Unique part types such as Part or Book generate roman numbers: Part I."
1693  "Ordered part types return dot-separated tuples: Chapter 5, Subsection 2.3.5."
1694  "Everything else generates unique numbers: Bibliography [1]."
1695  "Each invocation results in a new number."
1696  return self.getcounter(type).getnext()
1697 
1698  def getcounter(self, type):
1699  "Get the counter for the given type."
1700  type = type.lower()
1701  if not type in self.counters:
1702  self.counters[type] = self.create(type)
1703  return self.counters[type]
1704 
1705  def create(self, type):
1706  "Create a counter for the given type."
1707  if self.isnumbered(type) and self.getlevel(type) > 1:
1708  index = self.orderedlayouts.index(type)
1709  above = self.orderedlayouts[index - 1]
1710  master = self.getcounter(above)
1711  return self.createdependent(type, master)
1712  counter = NumberCounter(type)
1713  if self.isroman(type):
1714  counter.setmode('I')
1715  return counter
1716 
1717  def getdependentcounter(self, type, master):
1718  "Get (or create) a counter of the given type that depends on another."
1719  if not type in self.counters or not self.counters[type].master:
1720  self.counters[type] = self.createdependent(type, master)
1721  return self.counters[type]
1722 
1723  def createdependent(self, type, master):
1724  "Create a dependent counter given the master."
1725  return DependentCounter(type).setmaster(master)
1726 
1727  def startappendix(self):
1728  "Start appendices here."
1729  firsttype = self.orderedlayouts[DocumentParameters.startinglevel]
1730  counter = self.getcounter(firsttype)
1731  counter.setmode('A').reset()
1732  NumberGenerator.appendix = True
1733 
1734 class ChapteredGenerator(NumberGenerator):
1735  "Generate chaptered numbers, as in Chapter.Number."
1736  "Used in equations, figures: Equation (5.3), figure 8.15."
1737 
1738  def generate(self, type):
1739  "Generate a number which goes with first-level numbers (chapters). "
1740  "For the article classes a unique number is generated."
1741  if DocumentParameters.startinglevel > 0:
1742  return NumberGenerator.generator.generate(type)
1743  chapter = self.getcounter('Chapter')
1744  return self.getdependentcounter(type, chapter).getnext()
1745 
1746 
1747 NumberGenerator.chaptered = ChapteredGenerator()
1748 NumberGenerator.generator = NumberGenerator()
1749 
1750 
1751 
1752 
1753 
1754 
1755 class Parser(object):
1756  "A generic parser"
1757 
1758  def __init__(self):
1759  self.begin = 0
1760  self.parameters = dict()
1761 
1762  def parseheader(self, reader):
1763  "Parse the header"
1764  header = reader.currentline().split()
1765  reader.nextline()
1766  self.begin = reader.linenumber
1767  return header
1768 
1769  def parseparameter(self, reader):
1770  "Parse a parameter"
1771  if reader.currentline().strip().startswith('<'):
1772  key, value = self.parsexml(reader)
1773  self.parameters[key] = value
1774  return
1775  split = reader.currentline().strip().split(' ', 1)
1776  reader.nextline()
1777  if len(split) == 0:
1778  return
1779  key = split[0]
1780  if len(split) == 1:
1781  self.parameters[key] = True
1782  return
1783  if not '"' in split[1]:
1784  self.parameters[key] = split[1].strip()
1785  return
1786  doublesplit = split[1].split('"')
1787  self.parameters[key] = doublesplit[1]
1788 
1789  def parsexml(self, reader):
1790  "Parse a parameter in xml form: <param attr1=value...>"
1791  strip = reader.currentline().strip()
1792  reader.nextline()
1793  if not strip.endswith('>'):
1794  Trace.error('XML parameter ' + strip + ' should be <...>')
1795  split = strip[1:-1].split()
1796  if len(split) == 0:
1797  Trace.error('Empty XML parameter <>')
1798  return None, None
1799  key = split[0]
1800  del split[0]
1801  if len(split) == 0:
1802  return key, dict()
1803  attrs = dict()
1804  for attr in split:
1805  if not '=' in attr:
1806  Trace.error('Erroneous attribute for ' + key + ': ' + attr)
1807  attr += '="0"'
1808  parts = attr.split('=')
1809  attrkey = parts[0]
1810  value = parts[1].split('"')[1]
1811  attrs[attrkey] = value
1812  return key, attrs
1813 
1814  def parseending(self, reader, process):
1815  "Parse until the current ending is found"
1816  if not self.ending:
1817  Trace.error('No ending for ' + unicode(self))
1818  return
1819  while not reader.currentline().startswith(self.ending):
1820  process()
1821 
1822  def parsecontainer(self, reader, contents):
1823  container = self.factory.createcontainer(reader)
1824  if container:
1825  container.parent = self.parent
1826  contents.append(container)
1827 
1828  def __unicode__(self):
1829  "Return a description"
1830  return self.__class__.__name__ + ' (' + unicode(self.begin) + ')'
1831 
1832 class LoneCommand(Parser):
1833  "A parser for just one command line"
1834 
1835  def parse(self,reader):
1836  "Read nothing"
1837  return []
1838 
1839 class TextParser(Parser):
1840  "A parser for a command and a bit of text"
1841 
1842  stack = []
1843 
1844  def __init__(self, container):
1845  Parser.__init__(self)
1846  self.ending = None
1847  if container.__class__.__name__ in ContainerConfig.endings:
1848  self.ending = ContainerConfig.endings[container.__class__.__name__]
1849  self.endings = []
1850 
1851  def parse(self, reader):
1852  "Parse lines as long as they are text"
1853  TextParser.stack.append(self.ending)
1854  self.endings = TextParser.stack + [ContainerConfig.endings['Layout'],
1855  ContainerConfig.endings['Inset'], self.ending]
1856  contents = []
1857  while not self.isending(reader):
1858  self.parsecontainer(reader, contents)
1859  return contents
1860 
1861  def isending(self, reader):
1862  "Check if text is ending"
1863  current = reader.currentline().split()
1864  if len(current) == 0:
1865  return False
1866  if current[0] in self.endings:
1867  if current[0] in TextParser.stack:
1868  TextParser.stack.remove(current[0])
1869  else:
1870  TextParser.stack = []
1871  return True
1872  return False
1873 
1874 class ExcludingParser(Parser):
1875  "A parser that excludes the final line"
1876 
1877  def parse(self, reader):
1878  "Parse everything up to (and excluding) the final line"
1879  contents = []
1880  self.parseending(reader, lambda: self.parsecontainer(reader, contents))
1881  return contents
1882 
1883 class BoundedParser(ExcludingParser):
1884  "A parser bound by a final line"
1885 
1886  def parse(self, reader):
1887  "Parse everything, including the final line"
1888  contents = ExcludingParser.parse(self, reader)
1889  # skip last line
1890  reader.nextline()
1891  return contents
1892 
1893 class BoundedDummy(Parser):
1894  "A bound parser that ignores everything"
1895 
1896  def parse(self, reader):
1897  "Parse the contents of the container"
1898  self.parseending(reader, lambda: reader.nextline())
1899  # skip last line
1900  reader.nextline()
1901  return []
1902 
1903 class StringParser(Parser):
1904  "Parses just a string"
1905 
1906  def parseheader(self, reader):
1907  "Do nothing, just take note"
1908  self.begin = reader.linenumber + 1
1909  return []
1910 
1911  def parse(self, reader):
1912  "Parse a single line"
1913  contents = reader.currentline()
1914  reader.nextline()
1915  return contents
1916 
1917 class InsetParser(BoundedParser):
1918  "Parses a LyX inset"
1919 
1920  def parse(self, reader):
1921  "Parse inset parameters into a dictionary"
1922  startcommand = ContainerConfig.string['startcommand']
1923  while reader.currentline() != '' and not reader.currentline().startswith(startcommand):
1924  self.parseparameter(reader)
1925  return BoundedParser.parse(self, reader)
1926 
1927 
1928 
1929 
1930 
1931 
1932 class ContainerOutput(object):
1933  "The generic HTML output for a container."
1934 
1935  def gethtml(self, container):
1936  "Show an error."
1937  Trace.error('gethtml() not implemented for ' + unicode(self))
1938 
1939  def isempty(self):
1940  "Decide if the output is empty: by default, not empty."
1941  return False
1942 
1943 class EmptyOutput(ContainerOutput):
1944 
1945  def gethtml(self, container):
1946  "Return empty HTML code."
1947  return []
1948 
1949  def isempty(self):
1950  "This output is particularly empty."
1951  return True
1952 
1953 class FixedOutput(ContainerOutput):
1954  "Fixed output"
1955 
1956  def gethtml(self, container):
1957  "Return constant HTML code"
1958  return container.html
1959 
1960 class ContentsOutput(ContainerOutput):
1961  "Outputs the contents converted to HTML"
1962 
1963  def gethtml(self, container):
1964  "Return the HTML code"
1965  html = []
1966  if container.contents == None:
1967  return html
1968  for element in container.contents:
1969  if not hasattr(element, 'gethtml'):
1970  Trace.error('No html in ' + element.__class__.__name__ + ': ' + unicode(element))
1971  return html
1972  html += element.gethtml()
1973  return html
1974 
1975 class TaggedOutput(ContentsOutput):
1976  "Outputs an HTML tag surrounding the contents."
1977 
1978  tag = None
1979  breaklines = False
1980  empty = False
1981 
1982  def settag(self, tag, breaklines=False, empty=False):
1983  "Set the value for the tag and other attributes."
1984  self.tag = tag
1985  if breaklines:
1986  self.breaklines = breaklines
1987  if empty:
1988  self.empty = empty
1989  return self
1990 
1991  def setbreaklines(self, breaklines):
1992  "Set the value for breaklines."
1993  self.breaklines = breaklines
1994  return self
1995 
1996  def gethtml(self, container):
1997  "Return the HTML code."
1998  if self.empty:
1999  return [self.selfclosing(container)]
2000  html = [self.open(container)]
2001  html += ContentsOutput.gethtml(self, container)
2002  html.append(self.close(container))
2003  return html
2004 
2005  def open(self, container):
2006  "Get opening line."
2007  if not self.checktag():
2008  return ''
2009  open = '<' + self.tag + '>'
2010  if self.breaklines:
2011  return open + '\n'
2012  return open
2013 
2014  def close(self, container):
2015  "Get closing line."
2016  if not self.checktag():
2017  return ''
2018  close = '</' + self.tag.split()[0] + '>'
2019  if self.breaklines:
2020  return '\n' + close + '\n'
2021  return close
2022 
2023  def selfclosing(self, container):
2024  "Get self-closing line."
2025  if not self.checktag():
2026  return ''
2027  selfclosing = '<' + self.tag + '/>'
2028  if self.breaklines:
2029  return selfclosing + '\n'
2030  return selfclosing
2031 
2032  def checktag(self):
2033  "Check that the tag is valid."
2034  if not self.tag:
2035  Trace.error('No tag in ' + unicode(container))
2036  return False
2037  if self.tag == '':
2038  return False
2039  return True
2040 
2041 class FilteredOutput(ContentsOutput):
2042  "Returns the output in the contents, but filtered:"
2043  "some strings are replaced by others."
2044 
2045  def __init__(self):
2046  "Initialize the filters."
2047  self.filters = []
2048 
2049  def addfilter(self, original, replacement):
2050  "Add a new filter: replace the original by the replacement."
2051  self.filters.append((original, replacement))
2052 
2053  def gethtml(self, container):
2054  "Return the HTML code"
2055  result = []
2056  html = ContentsOutput.gethtml(self, container)
2057  for line in html:
2058  result.append(self.filter(line))
2059  return result
2060 
2061  def filter(self, line):
2062  "Filter a single line with all available filters."
2063  for original, replacement in self.filters:
2064  if original in line:
2065  line = line.replace(original, replacement)
2066  return line
2067 
2068 class StringOutput(ContainerOutput):
2069  "Returns a bare string as output"
2070 
2071  def gethtml(self, container):
2072  "Return a bare string"
2073  return [container.string]
2074 
2075 
2076 
2077 
2078 
2079 
2080 
2081 
2082 
2083 class Cloner(object):
2084  "An object used to clone other objects."
2085 
2086  def clone(cls, original):
2087  "Return an exact copy of an object."
2088  "The original object must have an empty constructor."
2089  return cls.create(original.__class__)
2090 
2091  def create(cls, type):
2092  "Create an object of a given class."
2093  clone = type.__new__(type)
2094  clone.__init__()
2095  return clone
2096 
2097  clone = classmethod(clone)
2098  create = classmethod(create)
2099 
2100 class ContainerExtractor(object):
2101  "A class to extract certain containers."
2102 
2103  def __init__(self, config):
2104  "The config parameter is a map containing three lists: allowed, copied and extracted."
2105  "Each of the three is a list of class names for containers."
2106  "Allowed containers are included as is into the result."
2107  "Cloned containers are cloned and placed into the result."
2108  "Extracted containers are looked into."
2109  "All other containers are silently ignored."
2110  self.allowed = config['allowed']
2111  self.cloned = config['cloned']
2112  self.extracted = config['extracted']
2113 
2114  def extract(self, container):
2115  "Extract a group of selected containers from elyxer.a container."
2116  list = []
2117  locate = lambda c: c.__class__.__name__ in self.allowed + self.cloned
2118  recursive = lambda c: c.__class__.__name__ in self.extracted
2119  process = lambda c: self.process(c, list)
2120  container.recursivesearch(locate, recursive, process)
2121  return list
2122 
2123  def process(self, container, list):
2124  "Add allowed containers, clone cloned containers and add the clone."
2125  name = container.__class__.__name__
2126  if name in self.allowed:
2127  list.append(container)
2128  elif name in self.cloned:
2129  list.append(self.safeclone(container))
2130  else:
2131  Trace.error('Unknown container class ' + name)
2132 
2133  def safeclone(self, container):
2134  "Return a new container with contents only in a safe list, recursively."
2135  clone = Cloner.clone(container)
2136  clone.output = container.output
2137  clone.contents = self.extract(container)
2138  return clone
2139 
2140 
2141 
2142 
2143 
2144 
2145 
2146 
2147 
2148 class Globable(object):
2149  """A bit of text which can be globbed (lumped together in bits).
2150  Methods current(), skipcurrent(), checkfor() and isout() have to be
2151  implemented by subclasses."""
2152 
2153  leavepending = False
2154 
2155  def __init__(self):
2156  self.endinglist = EndingList()
2157 
2158  def checkbytemark(self):
2159  "Check for a Unicode byte mark and skip it."
2160  if self.finished():
2161  return
2162  if ord(self.current()) == 0xfeff:
2163  self.skipcurrent()
2164 
2165  def isout(self):
2166  "Find out if we are out of the position yet."
2167  Trace.error('Unimplemented isout()')
2168  return True
2169 
2170  def current(self):
2171  "Return the current character."
2172  Trace.error('Unimplemented current()')
2173  return ''
2174 
2175  def checkfor(self, string):
2176  "Check for the given string in the current position."
2177  Trace.error('Unimplemented checkfor()')
2178  return False
2179 
2180  def finished(self):
2181  "Find out if the current text has finished."
2182  if self.isout():
2183  if not self.leavepending:
2184  self.endinglist.checkpending()
2185  return True
2186  return self.endinglist.checkin(self)
2187 
2188  def skipcurrent(self):
2189  "Return the current character and skip it."
2190  Trace.error('Unimplemented skipcurrent()')
2191  return ''
2192 
2193  def glob(self, currentcheck):
2194  "Glob a bit of text that satisfies a check on the current char."
2195  glob = ''
2196  while not self.finished() and currentcheck():
2197  glob += self.skipcurrent()
2198  return glob
2199 
2200  def globalpha(self):
2201  "Glob a bit of alpha text"
2202  return self.glob(lambda: self.current().isalpha())
2203 
2204  def globnumber(self):
2205  "Glob a row of digits."
2206  return self.glob(lambda: self.current().isdigit())
2207 
2208  def isidentifier(self):
2209  "Return if the current character is alphanumeric or _."
2210  if self.current().isalnum() or self.current() == '_':
2211  return True
2212  return False
2213 
2214  def globidentifier(self):
2215  "Glob alphanumeric and _ symbols."
2216  return self.glob(self.isidentifier)
2217 
2218  def isvalue(self):
2219  "Return if the current character is a value character:"
2220  "not a bracket or a space."
2221  if self.current().isspace():
2222  return False
2223  if self.current() in '{}()':
2224  return False
2225  return True
2226 
2227  def globvalue(self):
2228  "Glob a value: any symbols but brackets."
2229  return self.glob(self.isvalue)
2230 
2231  def skipspace(self):
2232  "Skip all whitespace at current position."
2233  return self.glob(lambda: self.current().isspace())
2234 
2235  def globincluding(self, magicchar):
2236  "Glob a bit of text up to (including) the magic char."
2237  glob = self.glob(lambda: self.current() != magicchar) + magicchar
2238  self.skip(magicchar)
2239  return glob
2240 
2241  def globexcluding(self, excluded):
2242  "Glob a bit of text up until (excluding) any excluded character."
2243  return self.glob(lambda: self.current() not in excluded)
2244 
2245  def pushending(self, ending, optional = False):
2246  "Push a new ending to the bottom"
2247  self.endinglist.add(ending, optional)
2248 
2249  def popending(self, expected = None):
2250  "Pop the ending found at the current position"
2251  if self.isout() and self.leavepending:
2252  return expected
2253  ending = self.endinglist.pop(self)
2254  if expected and expected != ending:
2255  Trace.error('Expected ending ' + expected + ', got ' + ending)
2256  self.skip(ending)
2257  return ending
2258 
2259  def nextending(self):
2260  "Return the next ending in the queue."
2261  nextending = self.endinglist.findending(self)
2262  if not nextending:
2263  return None
2264  return nextending.ending
2265 
2266 class EndingList(object):
2267  "A list of position endings"
2268 
2269  def __init__(self):
2270  self.endings = []
2271 
2272  def add(self, ending, optional = False):
2273  "Add a new ending to the list"
2274  self.endings.append(PositionEnding(ending, optional))
2275 
2276  def pickpending(self, pos):
2277  "Pick any pending endings from a parse position."
2278  self.endings += pos.endinglist.endings
2279 
2280  def checkin(self, pos):
2281  "Search for an ending"
2282  if self.findending(pos):
2283  return True
2284  return False
2285 
2286  def pop(self, pos):
2287  "Remove the ending at the current position"
2288  if pos.isout():
2289  Trace.error('No ending out of bounds')
2290  return ''
2291  ending = self.findending(pos)
2292  if not ending:
2293  Trace.error('No ending at ' + pos.current())
2294  return ''
2295  for each in reversed(self.endings):
2296  self.endings.remove(each)
2297  if each == ending:
2298  return each.ending
2299  elif not each.optional:
2300  Trace.error('Removed non-optional ending ' + each)
2301  Trace.error('No endings left')
2302  return ''
2303 
2304  def findending(self, pos):
2305  "Find the ending at the current position"
2306  if len(self.endings) == 0:
2307  return None
2308  for index, ending in enumerate(reversed(self.endings)):
2309  if ending.checkin(pos):
2310  return ending
2311  if not ending.optional:
2312  return None
2313  return None
2314 
2315  def checkpending(self):
2316  "Check if there are any pending endings"
2317  if len(self.endings) != 0:
2318  Trace.error('Pending ' + unicode(self) + ' left open')
2319 
2320  def __unicode__(self):
2321  "Printable representation"
2322  string = 'endings ['
2323  for ending in self.endings:
2324  string += unicode(ending) + ','
2325  if len(self.endings) > 0:
2326  string = string[:-1]
2327  return string + ']'
2328 
2329 class PositionEnding(object):
2330  "An ending for a parsing position"
2331 
2332  def __init__(self, ending, optional):
2333  self.ending = ending
2334  self.optional = optional
2335 
2336  def checkin(self, pos):
2337  "Check for the ending"
2338  return pos.checkfor(self.ending)
2339 
2340  def __unicode__(self):
2341  "Printable representation"
2342  string = 'Ending ' + self.ending
2343  if self.optional:
2344  string += ' (optional)'
2345  return string
2346 
2347 
2348 
2349 class Position(Globable):
2350  """A position in a text to parse.
2351  Including those in Globable, functions to implement by subclasses are:
2352  skip(), identifier(), extract(), isout() and current()."""
2353 
2354  def __init__(self):
2355  Globable.__init__(self)
2356 
2357  def skip(self, string):
2358  "Skip a string"
2359  Trace.error('Unimplemented skip()')
2360 
2361  def identifier(self):
2362  "Return an identifier for the current position."
2363  Trace.error('Unimplemented identifier()')
2364  return 'Error'
2365 
2366  def extract(self, length):
2367  "Extract the next string of the given length, or None if not enough text,"
2368  "without advancing the parse position."
2369  Trace.error('Unimplemented extract()')
2370  return None
2371 
2372  def checkfor(self, string):
2373  "Check for a string at the given position."
2374  return string == self.extract(len(string))
2375 
2376  def checkforlower(self, string):
2377  "Check for a string in lower case."
2378  extracted = self.extract(len(string))
2379  if not extracted:
2380  return False
2381  return string.lower() == self.extract(len(string)).lower()
2382 
2383  def skipcurrent(self):
2384  "Return the current character and skip it."
2385  current = self.current()
2386  self.skip(current)
2387  return current
2388 
2389  def next(self):
2390  "Advance the position and return the next character."
2391  self.skipcurrent()
2392  return self.current()
2393 
2394  def checkskip(self, string):
2395  "Check for a string at the given position; if there, skip it"
2396  if not self.checkfor(string):
2397  return False
2398  self.skip(string)
2399  return True
2400 
2401  def error(self, message):
2402  "Show an error message and the position identifier."
2403  Trace.error(message + ': ' + self.identifier())
2404 
2405 class TextPosition(Position):
2406  "A parse position based on a raw text."
2407 
2408  def __init__(self, text):
2409  "Create the position from elyxer.some text."
2410  Position.__init__(self)
2411  self.pos = 0
2412  self.text = text
2413  self.checkbytemark()
2414 
2415  def skip(self, string):
2416  "Skip a string of characters."
2417  self.pos += len(string)
2418 
2419  def identifier(self):
2420  "Return a sample of the remaining text."
2421  length = 30
2422  if self.pos + length > len(self.text):
2423  length = len(self.text) - self.pos
2424  return '*' + self.text[self.pos:self.pos + length] + '*'
2425 
2426  def isout(self):
2427  "Find out if we are out of the text yet."
2428  return self.pos >= len(self.text)
2429 
2430  def current(self):
2431  "Return the current character, assuming we are not out."
2432  return self.text[self.pos]
2433 
2434  def extract(self, length):
2435  "Extract the next string of the given length, or None if not enough text."
2436  if self.pos + length > len(self.text):
2437  return None
2438  return self.text[self.pos : self.pos + length]
2439 
2440 class FilePosition(Position):
2441  "A parse position based on an underlying file."
2442 
2443  def __init__(self, filename):
2444  "Create the position from a file."
2445  Position.__init__(self)
2446  self.reader = LineReader(filename)
2447  self.pos = 0
2448  self.checkbytemark()
2449 
2450  def skip(self, string):
2451  "Skip a string of characters."
2452  length = len(string)
2453  while self.pos + length > len(self.reader.currentline()):
2454  length -= len(self.reader.currentline()) - self.pos + 1
2455  self.nextline()
2456  self.pos += length
2457 
2458  def currentline(self):
2459  "Get the current line of the underlying file."
2460  return self.reader.currentline()
2461 
2462  def nextline(self):
2463  "Go to the next line."
2464  self.reader.nextline()
2465  self.pos = 0
2466 
2467  def linenumber(self):
2468  "Return the line number of the file."
2469  return self.reader.linenumber + 1
2470 
2471  def identifier(self):
2472  "Return the current line and line number in the file."
2473  before = self.reader.currentline()[:self.pos - 1]
2474  after = self.reader.currentline()[self.pos:]
2475  return 'line ' + unicode(self.getlinenumber()) + ': ' + before + '*' + after
2476 
2477  def isout(self):
2478  "Find out if we are out of the text yet."
2479  if self.pos > len(self.reader.currentline()):
2480  if self.pos > len(self.reader.currentline()) + 1:
2481  Trace.error('Out of the line ' + self.reader.currentline() + ': ' + unicode(self.pos))
2482  self.nextline()
2483  return self.reader.finished()
2484 
2485  def current(self):
2486  "Return the current character, assuming we are not out."
2487  if self.pos == len(self.reader.currentline()):
2488  return '\n'
2489  if self.pos > len(self.reader.currentline()):
2490  Trace.error('Out of the line ' + self.reader.currentline() + ': ' + unicode(self.pos))
2491  return '*'
2492  return self.reader.currentline()[self.pos]
2493 
2494  def extract(self, length):
2495  "Extract the next string of the given length, or None if not enough text."
2496  if self.pos + length > len(self.reader.currentline()):
2497  return None
2498  return self.reader.currentline()[self.pos : self.pos + length]
2499 
2500 
2501 
2502 class Container(object):
2503  "A container for text and objects in a lyx file"
2504 
2505  partkey = None
2506  parent = None
2507  begin = None
2508 
2509  def __init__(self):
2510  self.contents = list()
2511 
2512  def process(self):
2513  "Process contents"
2514  pass
2515 
2516  def gethtml(self):
2517  "Get the resulting HTML"
2518  html = self.output.gethtml(self)
2519  if isinstance(html, basestring):
2520  Trace.error('Raw string ' + html)
2521  html = [html]
2522  return self.escapeall(html)
2523 
2524  def escapeall(self, lines):
2525  "Escape all lines in an array according to the output options."
2526  result = []
2527  for line in lines:
2528  if Options.html:
2529  line = self.escape(line, EscapeConfig.html)
2530  if Options.iso885915:
2531  line = self.escape(line, EscapeConfig.iso885915)
2532  line = self.escapeentities(line)
2533  elif not Options.unicode:
2534  line = self.escape(line, EscapeConfig.nonunicode)
2535  result.append(line)
2536  return result
2537 
2538  def escape(self, line, replacements = EscapeConfig.entities):
2539  "Escape a line with replacements from elyxer.a map"
2540  pieces = replacements.keys()
2541  # do them in order
2542  pieces.sort()
2543  for piece in pieces:
2544  if piece in line:
2545  line = line.replace(piece, replacements[piece])
2546  return line
2547 
2548  def escapeentities(self, line):
2549  "Escape all Unicode characters to HTML entities."
2550  result = ''
2551  pos = TextPosition(line)
2552  while not pos.finished():
2553  if ord(pos.current()) > 128:
2554  codepoint = hex(ord(pos.current()))
2555  if codepoint == '0xd835':
2556  codepoint = hex(ord(pos.next()) + 0xf800)
2557  result += '&#' + codepoint[1:] + ';'
2558  else:
2559  result += pos.current()
2560  pos.skipcurrent()
2561  return result
2562 
2563  def searchall(self, type):
2564  "Search for all embedded containers of a given type"
2565  list = []
2566  self.searchprocess(type, lambda container: list.append(container))
2567  return list
2568 
2569  def searchremove(self, type):
2570  "Search for all containers of a type and remove them"
2571  list = self.searchall(type)
2572  for container in list:
2573  container.parent.contents.remove(container)
2574  return list
2575 
2576  def searchprocess(self, type, process):
2577  "Search for elements of a given type and process them"
2578  self.locateprocess(lambda container: isinstance(container, type), process)
2579 
2580  def locateprocess(self, locate, process):
2581  "Search for all embedded containers and process them"
2582  for container in self.contents:
2583  container.locateprocess(locate, process)
2584  if locate(container):
2585  process(container)
2586 
2587  def recursivesearch(self, locate, recursive, process):
2588  "Perform a recursive search in the container."
2589  for container in self.contents:
2590  if recursive(container):
2591  container.recursivesearch(locate, recursive, process)
2592  if locate(container):
2593  process(container)
2594 
2595  def extracttext(self):
2596  "Extract all text from elyxer.allowed containers."
2597  result = ''
2598  constants = ContainerExtractor(ContainerConfig.extracttext).extract(self)
2599  for constant in constants:
2600  result += constant.string
2601  return result
2602 
2603  def group(self, index, group, isingroup):
2604  "Group some adjoining elements into a group"
2605  if index >= len(self.contents):
2606  return
2607  if hasattr(self.contents[index], 'grouped'):
2608  return
2609  while index < len(self.contents) and isingroup(self.contents[index]):
2610  self.contents[index].grouped = True
2611  group.contents.append(self.contents[index])
2612  self.contents.pop(index)
2613  self.contents.insert(index, group)
2614 
2615  def remove(self, index):
2616  "Remove a container but leave its contents"
2617  container = self.contents[index]
2618  self.contents.pop(index)
2619  while len(container.contents) > 0:
2620  self.contents.insert(index, container.contents.pop())
2621 
2622  def tree(self, level = 0):
2623  "Show in a tree"
2624  Trace.debug(" " * level + unicode(self))
2625  for container in self.contents:
2626  container.tree(level + 1)
2627 
2628  def getparameter(self, name):
2629  "Get the value of a parameter, if present."
2630  if not name in self.parameters:
2631  return None
2632  return self.parameters[name]
2633 
2634  def getparameterlist(self, name):
2635  "Get the value of a comma-separated parameter as a list."
2636  paramtext = self.getparameter(name)
2637  if not paramtext:
2638  return []
2639  return paramtext.split(',')
2640 
2641  def hasemptyoutput(self):
2642  "Check if the parent's output is empty."
2643  current = self.parent
2644  while current:
2645  if current.output.isempty():
2646  return True
2647  current = current.parent
2648  return False
2649 
2650  def __unicode__(self):
2651  "Get a description"
2652  if not self.begin:
2653  return self.__class__.__name__
2654  return self.__class__.__name__ + '@' + unicode(self.begin)
2655 
2656 class BlackBox(Container):
2657  "A container that does not output anything"
2658 
2659  def __init__(self):
2660  self.parser = LoneCommand()
2661  self.output = EmptyOutput()
2662  self.contents = []
2663 
2664 class LyXFormat(BlackBox):
2665  "Read the lyxformat command"
2666 
2667  def process(self):
2668  "Show warning if version < 276"
2669  version = int(self.header[1])
2670  if version < 276:
2671  Trace.error('Warning: unsupported old format version ' + str(version))
2672  if version > int(GeneralConfig.version['lyxformat']):
2673  Trace.error('Warning: unsupported new format version ' + str(version))
2674 
2675 class StringContainer(Container):
2676  "A container for a single string"
2677 
2678  parsed = None
2679 
2680  def __init__(self):
2681  self.parser = StringParser()
2682  self.output = StringOutput()
2683  self.string = ''
2684 
2685  def process(self):
2686  "Replace special chars from elyxer.the contents."
2687  if self.parsed:
2688  self.string = self.replacespecial(self.parsed)
2689  self.parsed = None
2690 
2691  def replacespecial(self, line):
2692  "Replace all special chars from elyxer.a line"
2693  replaced = self.escape(line, EscapeConfig.entities)
2694  replaced = self.changeline(replaced)
2695  if ContainerConfig.string['startcommand'] in replaced and len(replaced) > 1:
2696  # unprocessed commands
2697  if self.begin:
2698  message = 'Unknown command at ' + unicode(self.begin) + ': '
2699  else:
2700  message = 'Unknown command: '
2701  Trace.error(message + replaced.strip())
2702  return replaced
2703 
2704  def changeline(self, line):
2705  line = self.escape(line, EscapeConfig.chars)
2706  if not ContainerConfig.string['startcommand'] in line:
2707  return line
2708  line = self.escape(line, EscapeConfig.commands)
2709  return line
2710 
2711  def extracttext(self):
2712  "Return all text."
2713  return self.string
2714 
2715  def __unicode__(self):
2716  "Return a printable representation."
2717  result = 'StringContainer'
2718  if self.begin:
2719  result += '@' + unicode(self.begin)
2720  ellipsis = '...'
2721  if len(self.string.strip()) <= 15:
2722  ellipsis = ''
2723  return result + ' (' + self.string.strip()[:15] + ellipsis + ')'
2724 
2725 class Constant(StringContainer):
2726  "A constant string"
2727 
2728  def __init__(self, text):
2729  self.contents = []
2730  self.string = text
2731  self.output = StringOutput()
2732 
2733  def __unicode__(self):
2734  return 'Constant: ' + self.string
2735 
2736 class TaggedText(Container):
2737  "Text inside a tag"
2738 
2739  output = None
2740 
2741  def __init__(self):
2742  self.parser = TextParser(self)
2743  self.output = TaggedOutput()
2744 
2745  def complete(self, contents, tag, breaklines=False):
2746  "Complete the tagged text and return it"
2747  self.contents = contents
2748  self.output.tag = tag
2749  self.output.breaklines = breaklines
2750  return self
2751 
2752  def constant(self, text, tag, breaklines=False):
2753  "Complete the tagged text with a constant"
2754  constant = Constant(text)
2755  return self.complete([constant], tag, breaklines)
2756 
2757  def __unicode__(self):
2758  "Return a printable representation."
2759  if not hasattr(self.output, 'tag'):
2760  return 'Emtpy tagged text'
2761  if not self.output.tag:
2762  return 'Tagged <unknown tag>'
2763  return 'Tagged <' + self.output.tag + '>'
2764 
2765 
2766 
2767 
2768 
2769 
2770 class ContainerSize(object):
2771  "The size of a container."
2772 
2773  width = None
2774  height = None
2775  maxwidth = None
2776  maxheight = None
2777  scale = None
2778 
2779  def set(self, width = None, height = None):
2780  "Set the proper size with width and height."
2781  self.setvalue('width', width)
2782  self.setvalue('height', height)
2783  return self
2784 
2785  def setmax(self, maxwidth = None, maxheight = None):
2786  "Set max width and/or height."
2787  self.setvalue('maxwidth', maxwidth)
2788  self.setvalue('maxheight', maxheight)
2789  return self
2790 
2791  def readparameters(self, container):
2792  "Read some size parameters off a container."
2793  self.setparameter(container, 'width')
2794  self.setparameter(container, 'height')
2795  self.setparameter(container, 'scale')
2796  self.checkvalidheight(container)
2797  return self
2798 
2799  def setparameter(self, container, name):
2800  "Read a size parameter off a container, and set it if present."
2801  value = container.getparameter(name)
2802  self.setvalue(name, value)
2803 
2804  def setvalue(self, name, value):
2805  "Set the value of a parameter name, only if it's valid."
2806  value = self.processparameter(value)
2807  if value:
2808  setattr(self, name, value)
2809 
2810  def checkvalidheight(self, container):
2811  "Check if the height parameter is valid; otherwise erase it."
2812  heightspecial = container.getparameter('height_special')
2813  if self.height and self.extractnumber(self.height) == '1' and heightspecial == 'totalheight':
2814  self.height = None
2815 
2816  def processparameter(self, value):
2817  "Do the full processing on a parameter."
2818  if not value:
2819  return None
2820  if self.extractnumber(value) == '0':
2821  return None
2822  for ignored in StyleConfig.size['ignoredtexts']:
2823  if ignored in value:
2824  value = value.replace(ignored, '')
2825  return value
2826 
2827  def extractnumber(self, text):
2828  "Extract the first number in the given text."
2829  result = ''
2830  decimal = False
2831  for char in text:
2832  if char.isdigit():
2833  result += char
2834  elif char == '.' and not decimal:
2835  result += char
2836  decimal = True
2837  else:
2838  return result
2839  return result
2840 
2841  def checkimage(self, width, height):
2842  "Check image dimensions, set them if possible."
2843  if width:
2844  self.maxwidth = unicode(width) + 'px'
2845  if self.scale and not self.width:
2846  self.width = self.scalevalue(width)
2847  if height:
2848  self.maxheight = unicode(height) + 'px'
2849  if self.scale and not self.height:
2850  self.height = self.scalevalue(height)
2851  if self.width and not self.height:
2852  self.height = 'auto'
2853  if self.height and not self.width:
2854  self.width = 'auto'
2855 
2856  def scalevalue(self, value):
2857  "Scale the value according to the image scale and return it as unicode."
2858  scaled = value * int(self.scale) / 100
2859  return unicode(int(scaled)) + 'px'
2860 
2861  def removepercentwidth(self):
2862  "Remove percent width if present, to set it at the figure level."
2863  if not self.width:
2864  return None
2865  if not '%' in self.width:
2866  return None
2867  width = self.width
2868  self.width = None
2869  if self.height == 'auto':
2870  self.height = None
2871  return width
2872 
2873  def addstyle(self, container):
2874  "Add the proper style attribute to the output tag."
2875  if not isinstance(container.output, TaggedOutput):
2876  Trace.error('No tag to add style, in ' + unicode(container))
2877  if not self.width and not self.height and not self.maxwidth and not self.maxheight:
2878  # nothing to see here; move along
2879  return
2880  tag = ' style="'
2881  tag += self.styleparameter('width')
2882  tag += self.styleparameter('maxwidth')
2883  tag += self.styleparameter('height')
2884  tag += self.styleparameter('maxheight')
2885  if tag[-1] == ' ':
2886  tag = tag[:-1]
2887  tag += '"'
2888  container.output.tag += tag
2889 
2890  def styleparameter(self, name):
2891  "Get the style for a single parameter."
2892  value = getattr(self, name)
2893  if value:
2894  return name.replace('max', 'max-') + ': ' + value + '; '
2895  return ''
2896 
2897 
2898 
2899 class QuoteContainer(Container):
2900  "A container for a pretty quote"
2901 
2902  def __init__(self):
2903  self.parser = BoundedParser()
2904  self.output = FixedOutput()
2905 
2906  def process(self):
2907  "Process contents"
2908  self.type = self.header[2]
2909  if not self.type in StyleConfig.quotes:
2910  Trace.error('Quote type ' + self.type + ' not found')
2911  self.html = ['"']
2912  return
2913  self.html = [StyleConfig.quotes[self.type]]
2914

2920  self.output = FixedOutput()
2921 
2922  def process(self):
2923  self.html = ['<hr class="line" />']
2924

2929  self.output.tag = 'i'
2930 
2931 class ShapedText(TaggedText):
2932  "Text shaped (italic, slanted)"

2935  self.type = self.header[1]
2936  if not self.type in TagConfig.shaped:
2937  Trace.error('Unrecognized shape ' + self.header[1])
2938  self.output.tag = 'span'
2939  return
2940  self.output.tag = TagConfig.shaped[self.type]
2941 
2942 class VersalitasText(TaggedText):

2946  self.output.tag = 'span class="versalitas"'
2947

2953  self.output.tag = 'span class="' + self.color + '"'

2962 class BoldText(TaggedText):

2966  self.output.tag = 'b'
2967 
2968 class TextFamily(TaggedText):
2969  "A bit of text from elyxer.a different family"
2970 
2971  def process(self):
2972  "Parse the type of family"
2973  self.type = self.header[1]
2974  if not self.type in TagConfig.family:
2975  Trace.error('Unrecognized family ' + type)
2976  self.output.tag = 'span'
2977  return
2978  self.output.tag = TagConfig.family[self.type]

2985 
2986 class BarredText(TaggedText):
2987  "Text with a bar somewhere"
2988 
2989  def process(self):
2990  "Parse the type of bar"
2991  self.type = self.header[1]
2992  if not self.type in TagConfig.barred:
2993  Trace.error('Unknown bar type ' + self.type)
2994  self.output.tag = 'span'
2995  return
2996  self.output.tag = TagConfig.barred[self.type]
2997 
2998 class LangLine(TaggedText):
2999  "A line with language information"
3000 
3001  def process(self):
3002  "Only generate a span with lang info when the language is recognized."
3003  lang = self.header[1]
3004  if not lang in TranslationConfig.languages:
3005  self.output = ContentsOutput()
3006  return
3007  isolang = TranslationConfig.languages[lang]
3008  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span lang="' + isolang + '"', False)
3009 
3010 class InsetLength(BlackBox):
3011  "A length measure inside an inset."
3012 
3013  def process(self):
3014  self.length = self.header[1]
3015 
3016 class Space(Container):
3017  "A space of several types"
3018 
3019  def __init__(self):
3020  self.parser = InsetParser()
3021  self.output = FixedOutput()
3022 
3023  def process(self):
3024  self.type = self.header[2]
3025  if self.type not in StyleConfig.hspaces:
3026  Trace.error('Unknown space type ' + self.type)
3027  self.html = [' ']
3028  return
3029  self.html = [StyleConfig.hspaces[self.type]]
3030  length = self.getlength()
3031  if not length:
3032  return
3033  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="hspace"', False)
3034  ContainerSize().set(length).addstyle(self)
3035 
3036  def getlength(self):
3037  "Get the space length from elyxer.the contents or parameters."
3038  if len(self.contents) == 0 or not isinstance(self.contents[0], InsetLength):
3039  return None
3040  return self.contents[0].length
3041 
3042 class VerticalSpace(Container):
3043  "An inset that contains a vertical space."
3044 
3045  def __init__(self):
3046  self.parser = InsetParser()
3047  self.output = FixedOutput()
3048 
3049  def process(self):
3050  "Set the correct tag"
3051  self.type = self.header[2]
3052  if self.type not in StyleConfig.vspaces:
3053  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('div class="vspace" style="height: ' + self.type + ';"', True)
3054  return
3055  self.html = [StyleConfig.vspaces[self.type]]
3056 
3057 class Align(Container):

3061  self.parser = ExcludingParser()
3062  self.output = TaggedOutput().setbreaklines(True)
3063 
3064  def process(self):
3065  self.output.tag = 'div class="' + self.header[1] + '"'
3066

3074  def process(self):
3075  "Process contents"
3076  self.html = ['<br/>\n']
3077

3083  self.html = ['<p><br/>\n</p>\n']

3090  self.contents = []
3091  self.html = [constant]
3092

3100 class StartAppendix(BlackBox):
3101  "Mark to start an appendix here."
3102  "From this point on, all chapters become appendices."
3103 
3104  def process(self):
3105  "Activate the special numbering scheme for appendices, using letters."
3106  NumberGenerator.generator.startappendix()
3107
