3112 
3113 class Link(Container):
3114  "A link to another part of the document"
3115 
3116  anchor = None
3117  url = None
3118  type = None
3119  page = None
3120  target = None
3121  destination = None
3122  title = None
3123 
3124  def __init__(self):
3125  "Initialize the link, add target if configured."
3126  self.contents = []
3127  self.parser = InsetParser()
3128  self.output = LinkOutput()
3129  if Options.target:
3130  self.target = Options.target
3131 
3132  def complete(self, text, anchor = None, url = None, type = None, title = None):
3133  "Complete the link."
3134  self.contents = [Constant(text)]
3135  if anchor:
3136  self.anchor = anchor
3137  if url:
3138  self.url = url
3139  if type:
3140  self.type = type
3141  if title:
3142  self.title = title
3143  return self
3144 
3145  def computedestination(self):
3146  "Use the destination link to fill in the destination URL."
3147  if not self.destination:
3148  return
3149  self.url = ''
3150  if self.destination.anchor:
3151  self.url = '#' + self.destination.anchor
3152  if self.destination.page:
3153  self.url = self.destination.page + self.url
3154 
3155  def setmutualdestination(self, destination):
3156  "Set another link as destination, and set its destination to this one."
3157  self.destination = destination
3158  destination.destination = self
3159 
3160  def __unicode__(self):
3161  "Return a printable representation."
3162  result = 'Link'
3163  if self.anchor:
3164  result += ' #' + self.anchor
3165  if self.url:
3166  result += ' to ' + self.url
3167  return result
3168 
3169 class URL(Link):
3170  "A clickable URL"
3171 
3172  def process(self):
3173  "Read URL from elyxer.parameters"
3174  target = self.escape(self.getparameter('target'))
3175  self.url = target
3176  type = self.getparameter('type')
3177  if type:
3178  self.url = self.escape(type) + target
3179  name = self.getparameter('name')
3180  if not name:
3181  name = target
3182  self.contents = [Constant(name)]
3183 
3184 class FlexURL(URL):
3185  "A flexible URL"
3186 
3187  def process(self):
3188  "Read URL from elyxer.contents"
3189  self.url = self.extracttext()
3190 
3191 class LinkOutput(ContainerOutput):
3192  "A link pointing to some destination"
3193  "Or an anchor (destination)"
3194 
3195  def gethtml(self, link):
3196  "Get the HTML code for the link"
3197  type = link.__class__.__name__
3198  if link.type:
3199  type = link.type
3200  tag = 'a class="' + type + '"'
3201  if link.anchor:
3202  tag += ' name="' + link.anchor + '"'
3203  if link.destination:
3204  link.computedestination()
3205  if link.url:
3206  tag += ' href="' + link.url + '"'
3207  if link.target:
3208  tag += ' target="' + link.target + '"'
3209  if link.title:
3210  tag += ' title="' + link.title + '"'
3211  return TaggedOutput().settag(tag).gethtml(link)
3212 
3213 
3214 
3215 
3216 
3217 
3218 
3219 
3220 class Postprocessor(object):
3221  "Postprocess a container keeping some context"
3222 
3223  stages = []
3224 
3225  def __init__(self):
3226  self.stages = StageDict(Postprocessor.stages, self)
3227  self.current = None
3228  self.last = None
3229 
3230  def postprocess(self, next):
3231  "Postprocess a container and its contents."
3232  self.postrecursive(self.current)
3233  result = self.postcurrent(next)
3234  self.last = self.current
3235  self.current = next
3236  return result
3237 
3238  def postrecursive(self, container):
3239  "Postprocess the container contents recursively"
3240  if not hasattr(container, 'contents'):
3241  return
3242  if len(container.contents) == 0:
3243  return
3244  if hasattr(container, 'postprocess'):
3245  if not container.postprocess:
3246  return
3247  postprocessor = Postprocessor()
3248  contents = []
3249  for element in container.contents:
3250  post = postprocessor.postprocess(element)
3251  if post:
3252  contents.append(post)
3253  # two rounds to empty the pipeline
3254  for i in range(2):
3255  post = postprocessor.postprocess(None)
3256  if post:
3257  contents.append(post)
3258  container.contents = contents
3259 
3260  def postcurrent(self, next):
3261  "Postprocess the current element taking into account next and last."
3262  stage = self.stages.getstage(self.current)
3263  if not stage:
3264  return self.current
3265  return stage.postprocess(self.last, self.current, next)
3266 
3267 class StageDict(object):
3268  "A dictionary of stages corresponding to classes"
3269 
3270  def __init__(self, classes, postprocessor):
3271  "Instantiate an element from elyxer.each class and store as a dictionary"
3272  instances = self.instantiate(classes, postprocessor)
3273  self.stagedict = dict([(x.processedclass, x) for x in instances])
3274 
3275  def instantiate(self, classes, postprocessor):
3276  "Instantiate an element from elyxer.each class"
3277  stages = [x.__new__(x) for x in classes]
3278  for element in stages:
3279  element.__init__()
3280  element.postprocessor = postprocessor
3281  return stages
3282 
3283  def getstage(self, element):
3284  "Get the stage for a given element, if the type is in the dict"
3285  if not element.__class__ in self.stagedict:
3286  return None
3287  return self.stagedict[element.__class__]
3288 
3289 
3290 
3291 class Label(Link):
3292  "A label to be referenced"
3293 
3294  names = dict()
3295  lastlayout = None
3296 
3297  def __init__(self):
3298  Link.__init__(self)
3299  self.lastnumbered = None
3300 
3301  def process(self):
3302  "Process a label container."
3303  key = self.getparameter('name')
3304  self.create(' ', key)
3305  self.lastnumbered = Label.lastlayout
3306 
3307  def create(self, text, key, type = 'Label'):
3308  "Create the label for a given key."
3309  self.key = key
3310  self.complete(text, anchor = key, type = type)
3311  Label.names[key] = self
3312  if key in Reference.references:
3313  for reference in Reference.references[key]:
3314  reference.destination = self
3315  return self
3316 
3317  def findpartkey(self):
3318  "Get the part key for the latest numbered container seen."
3319  numbered = self.numbered(self)
3320  if numbered and numbered.partkey:
3321  return numbered.partkey
3322  return ''
3323 
3324  def numbered(self, container):
3325  "Get the numbered container for the label."
3326  if container.partkey:
3327  return container
3328  if not container.parent:
3329  if self.lastnumbered:
3330  return self.lastnumbered
3331  return None
3332  return self.numbered(container.parent)
3333 
3334  def __unicode__(self):
3335  "Return a printable representation."
3336  if not hasattr(self, 'key'):
3337  return 'Unnamed label'
3338  return 'Label ' + self.key
3339 
3340 class Reference(Link):
3341  "A reference to a label."
3342 
3343  references = dict()
3344  key = 'none'
3345 
3346  def process(self):
3347  "Read the reference and set the arrow."
3348  self.key = self.getparameter('reference')
3349  if self.key in Label.names:
3350  self.direction = u'↑'
3351  label = Label.names[self.key]
3352  else:
3353  self.direction = u'↓'
3354  label = Label().complete(' ', self.key, 'preref')
3355  self.destination = label
3356  self.formatcontents()
3357  if not self.key in Reference.references:
3358  Reference.references[self.key] = []
3359  Reference.references[self.key].append(self)
3360 
3361  def formatcontents(self):
3362  "Format the reference contents."
3363  formatkey = self.getparameter('LatexCommand')
3364  if not formatkey:
3365  formatkey = 'ref'
3366  self.formatted = u'↕'
3367  if formatkey in StyleConfig.referenceformats:
3368  self.formatted = StyleConfig.referenceformats[formatkey]
3369  else:
3370  Trace.error('Unknown reference format ' + formatkey)
3371  self.replace(u'↕', self.direction)
3372  self.replace('#', '1')
3373  self.replace('on-page', Translator.translate('on-page'))
3374  partkey = self.destination.findpartkey()
3375  # only if partkey and partkey.number are not null, send partkey.number
3376  self.replace('@', partkey and partkey.number)
3377  self.replace(u'¶', partkey and partkey.tocentry)
3378  if not '$' in self.formatted or not partkey or not partkey.titlecontents:
3379  # there is a $ left, but it should go away on preprocessing
3380  self.contents = [Constant(self.formatted)]
3381  return
3382  pieces = self.formatted.split('$')
3383  self.contents = [Constant(pieces[0])]
3384  for piece in pieces[1:]:
3385  self.contents += partkey.titlecontents
3386  self.contents.append(Constant(piece))
3387 
3388  def replace(self, key, value):
3389  "Replace a key in the format template with a value."
3390  if not key in self.formatted:
3391  return
3392  if not value:
3393  value = ''
3394  self.formatted = self.formatted.replace(key, value)
3395 
3396  def __unicode__(self):
3397  "Return a printable representation."
3398  return 'Reference ' + self.key
3399 
3400 
3401 
3402 
3403 
3404 
3405 
3406 
3407 
3408 
3409 
3410 
3411 
3412 
3413 
3414 class HeaderParser(Parser):
3415  "Parses the LyX header"
3416 
3417  def parse(self, reader):
3418  "Parse header parameters into a dictionary, return the preamble."
3419  contents = []
3420  self.parseending(reader, lambda: self.parseline(reader, contents))
3421  # skip last line
3422  reader.nextline()
3423  return contents
3424 
3425  def parseline(self, reader, contents):
3426  "Parse a single line as a parameter or as a start"
3427  line = reader.currentline()
3428  if line.startswith(HeaderConfig.parameters['branch']):
3429  self.parsebranch(reader)
3430  return
3431  elif line.startswith(HeaderConfig.parameters['lstset']):
3432  LstParser().parselstset(reader)
3433  return
3434  elif line.startswith(HeaderConfig.parameters['beginpreamble']):
3435  contents.append(self.factory.createcontainer(reader))
3436  return
3437  # no match
3438  self.parseparameter(reader)
3439 
3440  def parsebranch(self, reader):
3441  "Parse all branch definitions."
3442  branch = reader.currentline().split()[1]
3443  reader.nextline()
3444  subparser = HeaderParser().complete(HeaderConfig.parameters['endbranch'])
3445  subparser.parse(reader)
3446  options = BranchOptions(branch)
3447  for key in subparser.parameters:
3448  options.set(key, subparser.parameters[key])
3449  Options.branches[branch] = options
3450 
3451  def complete(self, ending):
3452  "Complete the parser with the given ending."
3453  self.ending = ending
3454  return self
3455 
3456 class PreambleParser(Parser):
3457  "A parser for the LyX preamble."
3458 
3459  preamble = []
3460 
3461  def parse(self, reader):
3462  "Parse the full preamble with all statements."
3463  self.ending = HeaderConfig.parameters['endpreamble']
3464  self.parseending(reader, lambda: self.parsepreambleline(reader))
3465  return []
3466 
3467  def parsepreambleline(self, reader):
3468  "Parse a single preamble line."
3469  PreambleParser.preamble.append(reader.currentline())
3470  reader.nextline()
3471 
3472 class LstParser(object):
3473  "Parse global and local lstparams."
3474 
3475  globalparams = dict()
3476 
3477  def parselstset(self, reader):
3478  "Parse a declaration of lstparams in lstset."
3479  paramtext = self.extractlstset(reader)
3480  if not '{' in paramtext:
3481  Trace.error('Missing opening bracket in lstset: ' + paramtext)
3482  return
3483  lefttext = paramtext.split('{')[1]
3484  croppedtext = lefttext[:-1]
3485  LstParser.globalparams = self.parselstparams(croppedtext)
3486 
3487  def extractlstset(self, reader):
3488  "Extract the global lstset parameters."
3489  paramtext = ''
3490  while not reader.finished():
3491  paramtext += reader.currentline()
3492  reader.nextline()
3493  if paramtext.endswith('}'):
3494  return paramtext
3495  Trace.error('Could not find end of \\lstset settings; aborting')
3496 
3497  def parsecontainer(self, container):
3498  "Parse some lstparams from elyxer.a container."
3499  container.lstparams = LstParser.globalparams.copy()
3500  paramlist = container.getparameterlist('lstparams')
3501  container.lstparams.update(self.parselstparams(paramlist))
3502 
3503  def parselstparams(self, paramlist):
3504  "Process a number of lstparams from elyxer.a list."
3505  paramdict = dict()
3506  for param in paramlist:
3507  if not '=' in param:
3508  if len(param.strip()) > 0:
3509  Trace.error('Invalid listing parameter ' + param)
3510  else:
3511  key, value = param.split('=', 1)
3512  paramdict[key] = value
3513  return paramdict
3514 
3515 
3516 
3517 
3518 
3519 import datetime
3520 
3521 
3522 
3523 import os
3524 import codecs
3525 
3526 
3527 class BulkFile(object):
3528  "A file to treat in bulk"
3529 
3530  encodings = ['utf-8','Cp1252']
3531 
3532  def __init__(self, filename):
3533  self.filename = filename
3534  self.temp = self.filename + '.temp'
3535 
3536  def readall(self):
3537  "Read the whole file"
3538  for encoding in BulkFile.encodings:
3539  try:
3540  return self.readcodec(encoding)
3541  except UnicodeDecodeError:
3542  pass
3543  Trace.error('No suitable encoding for ' + self.filename)
3544  return []
3545 
3546  def readcodec(self, encoding):
3547  "Read the whole file with the given encoding"
3548  filein = codecs.open(self.filename, 'rU', encoding)
3549  lines = filein.readlines()
3550  result = []
3551  for line in lines:
3552  result.append(line.strip('\r\n') + '\n')
3553  filein.close()
3554  return result
3555 
3556  def getfiles(self):
3557  "Get reader and writer for a file name"
3558  reader = LineReader(self.filename)
3559  writer = LineWriter(self.temp)
3560  return reader, writer
3561 
3562  def swaptemp(self):
3563  "Swap the temp file for the original"
3564  os.chmod(self.temp, os.stat(self.filename).st_mode)
3565  os.rename(self.temp, self.filename)
3566 
3567  def __unicode__(self):
3568  "Get the unicode representation"
3569  return 'file ' + self.filename
3570 
3571 
3572 
3573 class HTMLTemplate(object):
3574  "A template for HTML generation."
3575 
3576  current = None
3577 
3578  def getheader(self):
3579  "Get the header (before content) of the template."
3580  return []
3581 
3582  def convertheader(self):
3583  "Convert the header and all variables."
3584  return self.convert(self.getheader())
3585 
3586  def convertfooter(self):
3587  "Convert the footer and all variables."
3588  return self.convert(self.getfooter())
3589 
3590  def convert(self, html):
3591  "Convert a bit of HTML replacing all variables."
3592  varmap = VariableMap()
3593  for index, line in enumerate(html):
3594  if '<!--$' in line:
3595  html[index] = varmap.replace(line)
3596  return html
3597 
3598  def getfooter(self):
3599  "Get the footer (after content) of the template."
3600  return []
3601 
3602  def get(cls):
3603  "Choose the right HTML template."
3604  if not cls.current:
3605  if Options.raw:
3606  cls.current = RawTemplate()
3607  elif Options.template:
3608  cls.current = FileTemplate().read()
3609  else:
3610  cls.current = DefaultTemplate()
3611  return cls.current
3612 
3613  get = classmethod(get)
3614 
3615 class RawTemplate(HTMLTemplate):
3616  "The template for raw output."
3617 
3618  def getheader(self):
3619  "Get the raw header."
3620  return ['<!--starthtml-->\n']
3621 
3622  def getfooter(self):
3623  "Get the raw footer."
3624  return ['\n\n<!--endhtml-->']
3625 
3626 class FileTemplate(HTMLTemplate):
3627  "A template read from elyxer.a file."
3628 
3629  divider = '<!--$content-->'
3630 
3631  def read(self):
3632  "Read the file, separate header and footer."
3633  self.header = []
3634  lines = []
3635  for line in self.templatelines():
3636  if FileTemplate.divider == line:
3637  self.header = lines
3638  lines = []
3639  else:
3640  lines.append(line)
3641  if self.header == []:
3642  Trace.error('No ' + FileTemplate.divider + ' in template')
3643  self.header = lines
3644  lines = []
3645  self.footer = lines
3646  return self
3647 
3648  def templatelines(self):
3649  "Read all lines in the template, separate content into its own line."
3650  template = BulkFile(Options.template).readall()
3651  for line in template:
3652  if not FileTemplate.divider in line:
3653  yield line
3654  else:
3655  split = line.split(FileTemplate.divider)
3656  for part in split[:-1]:
3657  yield part
3658  yield FileTemplate.divider
3659  yield split[-1]
3660 
3661  def getheader(self):
3662  "Return the header (before content)."
3663  return self.header
3664 
3665  def getfooter(self):
3666  "Return the footer (after the content)."
3667  return self.footer
3668 
3669 class DefaultTemplate(HTMLTemplate):
3670  "The default HTML template when not configured."
3671 
3672  def getheader(self):
3673  "Get the default header (before content)."
3674  html = []
3675  if not Options.html:
3676  html.append(u'<?xml version="1.0" encoding="<!--$encoding-->"?>\n')
3677  html.append(u'<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">\n')
3678  html.append(u'<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xml:lang="en" lang="en">\n')
3679  else:
3680  html.append(u'<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">\n')
3681  html.append(u'<html lang="en">\n')
3682  html.append(u'<head>\n')
3683  html.append(u'<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=<!--$encoding-->"/>\n')
3684  html.append(u'<meta name="generator" content="http://www.nongnu.org/elyxer/"/>\n')
3685  html.append(u'<meta name="create-date" content="<!--$date-->"/>\n')
3686  html += self.getcss()
3687  html.append(u'<title><!--$title--></title>\n')
3688  if Options.jsmath:
3689  html.append(u'<script type="text/javascript" src="<!--$jsmath-->/plugins/noImageFonts.js"></script>\n')
3690  html.append(u'<script type="text/javascript" src="<!--$jsmath-->/easy/load.js"></script>\n')
3691  if Options.mathjax:
3692  if Options.mathjax == 'remote':
3693  html.append(u'<script type="text/javascript"\n')
3694  html.append(u' src="http://cdn.mathjax.org/mathjax/latest/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS-MML_HTMLorMML">\n')
3695  html.append(u'</script>\n')
3696  else:
3697  html.append(u'<script type="text/javascript" src="<!--$mathjax-->/MathJax.js">\n')
3698  html.append(u' // Load MathJax and get it running\n')
3699  html.append(u' MathJax.Hub.Config({ jax: ["input/TeX"],\n') # output/HTML-CSS
3700  html.append(u' config: ["MMLorHTML.js"],\n')
3701  html.append(u' extensions: ["TeX/AMSmath.js","TeX/AMSsymbols.js"],\n')
3702  html.append(u' "HTML-CSS": { imageFont: null }\n')
3703  html.append(u' });\n')
3704  html.append(u'</script>\n')
3705  html.append('</head>\n')
3706  html.append('<body>\n')
3707  html.append('<div id="globalWrapper">\n')
3708  if Options.jsmath or Options.mathjax:
3709  if Options.mathjax:
3710  html.append(u'<script type="math/tex">\n')
3711  html.append(u'\\newcommand{\\lyxlock}{}\n')
3712  html.append(u'</script>\n')
3713  html.append(u'<noscript>\n')
3714  html.append(u'<div class="warning">\n')
3715  html.append(Translator.translate('jsmath-warning'))
3716  if Options.jsmath:
3717  html.append(u'<a href="http://www.math.union.edu/locate/jsMath">jsMath</a>')
3718  if Options.mathjax:
3719  html.append(u'<a href="http://www.mathjax.org/">MathJax</a>')
3720  html.append(Translator.translate('jsmath-requires'))
3721  html.append(Translator.translate('jsmath-enable') + '\n')
3722  html.append(u'</div><hr/>\n')
3723  html.append(u'</noscript>\n')
3724  return html
3725 
3726  def getcss(self):
3727  "Get the CSS headers, both linked and embedded."
3728  html = []
3729  for cssdoc in Options.css:
3730  if cssdoc != '':
3731  html.append(u'<link rel="stylesheet" href="' + cssdoc + '" type="text/css" media="all"/>\n')
3732  for cssfile in Options.embedcss:
3733  html.append(u'<style type="text/css">\n')
3734  html += BulkFile(cssfile).readall()
3735  html.append(u'</style>\n')
3736  return html
3737 
3738  def getfooter(self):
3739  "Get the default footer (after content)."
3740  html = []
3741  html.append('\n')
3742  footer = self.createfooter()
3743  if len(footer) > 0:
3744  html.append('<hr class="footer"/>\n')
3745  html += footer
3746  html.append('</div>\n')
3747  html.append('</body>\n')
3748  html.append('</html>\n')
3749  return html
3750 
3751  def createfooter(self):
3752  "Create the footer proper."
3753  html = []
3754  if Options.copyright:
3755  html.append('<div class="footer">\nCopyright (C) <!--$year--> <!--$author-->\n</div>\n')
3756  if Options.nofooter:
3757  return html
3758  html.append('<div class="footer" id="generated-by">\n')
3759  html.append(Translator.translate('generated-by'))
3760  html.append('<a href="http://elyxer.nongnu.org/">eLyXer <!--$version--></a>')
3761  html.append(Translator.translate('generated-on'))
3762  html.append('<span class="create-date"><!--$datetime--></span>\n')
3763  html.append('</div>\n')
3764  return html
3765 
3766 class VariableMap(object):
3767  "A map with all replacement variables."
3768 
3769  def __init__(self):
3770  self.variables = dict()
3771  self.variables['title'] = DocumentTitle().getvalue()
3772  self.variables['author'] = DocumentAuthor().getvalue()
3773  self.variables['version'] = GeneralConfig.version['number'] + ' (' \
3774  + GeneralConfig.version['date'] + ')'
3775  self.variables['year'] = unicode(datetime.date.today().year)
3776  self.variables['date'] = datetime.date.today().isoformat()
3777  self.variables['datetime'] = datetime.datetime.now().isoformat()
3778  self.variables['css'] = Options.css[0]
3779  if Options.iso885915:
3780  self.variables['encoding'] = 'ISO-8859-1'
3781  else:
3782  self.variables['encoding'] = 'UTF-8'
3783  if Options.jsmath:
3784  self.variables['jsmath'] = Options.jsmath
3785  if Options.mathjax:
3786  self.variables['mathjax'] = Options.mathjax
3787 
3788  def replace(self, line):
3789  "Replace all variables in a line."
3790  result = ''
3791  pos = TextPosition(line)
3792  while not pos.finished():
3793  if pos.checkskip('<!--$'):
3794  result += self.getvalue(pos)
3795  else:
3796  result += pos.skipcurrent()
3797  return result
3798 
3799  def getvalue(self, pos):
3800  "Get the value of the variable at the given position."
3801  value = ''
3802  key = pos.globalpha()
3803  if not key in self.variables:
3804  Trace.error('Template variable ' + key + ' not found')
3805  else:
3806  value = self.variables[key]
3807  if not pos.checkskip('-->'):
3808  Trace.error('Weird template format in ' + line)
3809  return value
3810 
3811 class DocumentTitle(object):
3812  "The title of the whole document."
3813 
3814  title = None
3815 
3816  def getvalue(self):
3817  "Return the correct title from elyxer.the option or the PDF title."
3818  if Options.title:
3819  return Options.title
3820  if DocumentTitle.title:
3821  return DocumentTitle.title
3822  if DocumentParameters.pdftitle:
3823  return DocumentParameters.pdftitle
3824  return 'Converted document'
3825 
3826 class DocumentAuthor(object):
3827  "The author of the document."
3828 
3829  author = ''
3830 
3831  def appendauthor(cls, authorline):
3832  "Append a line with author information."
3833  cls.author += authorline
3834 
3835  appendauthor = classmethod(appendauthor)
3836 
3837  def getvalue(self):
3838  "Get the document author."
3839  return DocumentAuthor.author
3840 
3841 class HeaderOutput(ContainerOutput):
3842  "Returns the HTML headers"
3843

3845  "Return a constant header"
3846  return HTMLTemplate.get().convertheader()
3847 
3848 class FooterOutput(ContentsOutput):
3849  "Return the HTML code for the footer"
3850

3852  "Footer HTML"
3853  contents = ContentsOutput.gethtml(self, container)
3854  return contents + HTMLTemplate.get().convertfooter()

3870

3876  self.parser = InsetParser()
3877  self.output = TaggedOutput().setbreaklines(True)
3878 
3879  def process(self):
3880  self.type = self.header[1]
3881  self.output.tag = 'span class="' + self.type + '"'
3882

3900 class Branch(Container):
3901  "A branch within a LyX document"
3902 
3903  def __init__(self):
3904  self.parser = InsetParser()
3905  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="branch"', True)
3906 
3907  def process(self):
3908  "Disable inactive branches"
3909  self.branch = self.header[2]
3910  if not self.isactive():
3911  Trace.debug('Branch ' + self.branch + ' not active')
3912  self.output = EmptyOutput()
3913 
3914  def isactive(self):
3915  "Check if the branch is active"
3916  if not self.branch in Options.branches:
3917  Trace.error('Invalid branch ' + self.branch)
3918  return True
3919  branch = Options.branches[self.branch]
3920  return branch.isselected()
3921

3939  if self.type in TagConfig.flex:
3940  self.output.settag(TagConfig.flex[self.type], False)
3941  else:
3942  self.output.settag('span class="' + self.type + '"', False)

3995 class ScriptInset(Container):
3996  "Sub- or super-script in an inset."
3997 
3998  def __init__(self):
3999  self.parser = InsetParser()
4000  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span', False)
4001

4003  "Set the correct script tag."
4004  self.type = self.header[2]
4005  if not self.type in TagConfig.script:
4006  Trace.error('Unknown script type ' + self.type)
4007  return
4008  self.output.settag(TagConfig.script[self.type], False)
4009 
4010 
4011 
4012 class PartKey(object):
4013  "A key to identify a given document part (chapter, section...)."
4014 
4015  partkey = None
4016  tocentry = None
4017  anchortext = None
4018  number = None
4019  filename = None
4020  titlecontents = None
4021  header = False
4022 
4023  def __init__(self):
4024  self.level = 0
4025 
4026  def createindex(self, partkey):
4027  "Create a part key for an index page."
4028  self.partkey = partkey
4029  self.tocentry = partkey
4030  self.filename = partkey
4031  return self
4032 
4033  def createfloat(self, float):
4034  "Create a part key for a float."
4035  self.number = NumberGenerator.chaptered.generate(float.type)
4036  self.partkey = Translator.translate('float-' + float.type) + self.number
4037  if Options.notoclabels:
4038  self.tocentry = self.number
4039  else:
4040  self.tocentry = self.partkey
4041  self.readtitle(float)
4042  return self
4043 
4044  def createsubfloat(self, number):
4045  "Create the part key for a subfloat."
4046  self.partkey = '(' + number + ')'
4047  self.number = number
4048  return self
4049 
4050  def createformula(self, number):
4051  "Create the part key for a formula."
4052  self.number = number
4053  self.partkey = 'formula-' + number
4054  self.tocentry = '(' + number + ')'
4055  return self
4056 
4057  def createheader(self, headorfooter):
4058  "Create the part key for a header or footer."
4059  self.partkey = headorfooter
4060  self.tocentry = None
4061  self.header = True
4062  return self
4063 
4064  def createanchor(self, partkey):
4065  "Create an anchor for the page."
4066  self.partkey = partkey
4067  self.tocentry = partkey
4068  self.header = True
4069  return self
4070 
4071  def createmain(self):
4072  "Create the part key for the main page."
4073  self.partkey = ''
4074  self.tocentry = DocumentTitle().getvalue()
4075  return self
4076 
4077  def addtoclabel(self, container):
4078  "Create the label for the TOC, and add it to the container."
4079  labeltext = ''
4080  if self.anchortext:
4081  labeltext = self.anchortext
4082  container.contents.insert(0, Separator(u' '))
4083  label = Label().create(labeltext, self.partkey, type='toc')
4084  container.contents.insert(0, label)
4085 
4086  def readtitle(self, container):
4087  "Read the title of the TOC entry."
4088  shorttitles = container.searchall(ShortTitle)
4089  if len(shorttitles) > 0:
4090  self.titlecontents = []
4091  for shorttitle in shorttitles:
4092  self.titlecontents += shorttitle.contents
4093  return
4094  extractor = ContainerExtractor(TOCConfig.extracttitle)
4095  captions = container.searchall(Caption)
4096  if len(captions) == 1:
4097  self.titlecontents = extractor.extract(captions[0])
4098  return
4099  self.titlecontents = extractor.extract(container)
4100 
4101  def __unicode__(self):
4102  "Return a printable representation."
4103  return 'Part key for ' + self.partkey
4104 
4105 class LayoutPartKey(PartKey):
4106  "The part key for a layout."
4107 
4108  generator = NumberGenerator()
4109 
4110  def create(self, layout):
4111  "Set the layout for which we are creating the part key."
4112  self.processtype(layout.type)
4113  self.readtitle(layout)
4114  return self
4115 
4116  def processtype(self, type):
4117  "Process the layout type."
4118  self.level = self.generator.getlevel(type)
4119  self.number = self.generator.generate(type)
4120  anchortype = self.getanchortype(type)
4121  self.partkey = 'toc-' + anchortype + '-' + self.number
4122  self.tocentry = self.gettocentry(type)
4123  self.filename = self.getfilename(type)
4124  if self.generator.isnumbered(type):
4125  if not self.tocentry:
4126  self.tocentry = ''
4127  else:
4128  self.tocentry += ' '
4129  self.tocentry += self.number
4130  self.anchortext = self.getanchortext(type)
4131 
4132  def getanchortype(self, type):
4133  "Get the type for the anchor."
4134  parttype = self.generator.getparttype(type)
4135  if self.generator.isunordered(type):
4136  parttype += '-'
4137  return parttype
4138 
4139  def gettocentry(self, type):
4140  "Get the entry for the TOC: Chapter, Section..."
4141  if Options.notoclabels:
4142  return ''
4143  return Translator.translate(self.generator.getparttype(type))
4144 
4145  def addtotocentry(self, text):
4146  "Add some text to the tocentry; create if None."
4147  if not self.tocentry:
4148  self.tocentry = ''
4149  self.tocentry += text
4150 
4151  def getanchortext(self, type):
4152  "Get the text for the anchor given to a layout type."
4153  if self.generator.isunique(type):
4154  return self.tocentry + '.'
4155  return self.number
4156 
4157  def getfilename(self, type):
4158  "Get the filename to be used if splitpart is active."
4159  if self.level == Options.splitpart and self.generator.isnumbered(type):
4160  return self.number
4161  if self.level <= Options.splitpart:
4162  return self.partkey.replace('toc-', '')
4163  return None
4164 
4165  def needspartkey(self, layout):
4166  "Find out if a layout needs a part key."
4167  if self.generator.isunique(layout.type):
4168  return True
4169  return self.generator.isinordered(layout.type)
4170 
4171  def __unicode__(self):
4172  "Get a printable representation."
4173  return 'Part key for layout ' + self.tocentry
4174 
4175 class PartKeyGenerator(object):
4176  "Number a layout with the relevant attributes."
4177 
4178  partkeyed = []
4179  layoutpartkey = LayoutPartKey()
4180 
4181  def forlayout(cls, layout):
4182  "Get the part key for a layout."
4183  if layout.hasemptyoutput():
4184  return None
4185  if not cls.layoutpartkey.needspartkey(layout):
4186  return None
4187  Label.lastlayout = layout
4188  cls.partkeyed.append(layout)
4189  return LayoutPartKey().create(layout)
4190 
4191  def forindex(cls, index):
4192  "Get the part key for an index or nomenclature."
4193  if index.hasemptyoutput():
4194  return None
4195  cls.partkeyed.append(index)
4196  return PartKey().createindex(index.name)
4197 
4198  forlayout = classmethod(forlayout)
4199  forindex = classmethod(forindex)
4200 
4201 
4202 
4203 
4204 import unicodedata
4205 
4206 
4207 
4208 import urllib
4209 
4210 
4211 
4212 
4213 
4214 class FormulaParser(Parser):
4215  "Parses a formula"
4216 
4217  def parseheader(self, reader):
4218  "See if the formula is inlined"
4219  self.begin = reader.linenumber + 1
4220  type = self.parsetype(reader)
4221  if not type:
4222  reader.nextline()
4223  type = self.parsetype(reader)
4224  if not type:
4225  Trace.error('Unknown formula type in ' + reader.currentline().strip())
4226  return ['unknown']
4227  return [type]
4228 
4229  def parsetype(self, reader):
4230  "Get the formula type from the first line."
4231  if reader.currentline().find(FormulaConfig.starts['simple']) >= 0:
4232  return 'inline'
4233  if reader.currentline().find(FormulaConfig.starts['complex']) >= 0:
4234  return 'block'
4235  if reader.currentline().find(FormulaConfig.starts['unnumbered']) >= 0:
4236  return 'block'
4237  if reader.currentline().find(FormulaConfig.starts['beginbefore']) >= 0:
4238  return 'numbered'
4239  return None
4240 
4241  def parse(self, reader):
4242  "Parse the formula until the end"
4243  formula = self.parseformula(reader)
4244  while not reader.currentline().startswith(self.ending):
4245  stripped = reader.currentline().strip()
4246  if len(stripped) > 0:
4247  Trace.error('Unparsed formula line ' + stripped)
4248  reader.nextline()
4249  reader.nextline()
4250  return formula
4251 
4252  def parseformula(self, reader):
4253  "Parse the formula contents"
4254  simple = FormulaConfig.starts['simple']
4255  if simple in reader.currentline():
4256  rest = reader.currentline().split(simple, 1)[1]
4257  if simple in rest:
4258  # formula is $...$
4259  return self.parsesingleliner(reader, simple, simple)
4260  # formula is multiline $...$
4261  return self.parsemultiliner(reader, simple, simple)
4262  if FormulaConfig.starts['complex'] in reader.currentline():
4263  # formula of the form \[...\]
4264  return self.parsemultiliner(reader, FormulaConfig.starts['complex'],
4265  FormulaConfig.endings['complex'])
4266  beginbefore = FormulaConfig.starts['beginbefore']
4267  beginafter = FormulaConfig.starts['beginafter']
4268  if beginbefore in reader.currentline():
4269  if reader.currentline().strip().endswith(beginafter):
4270  current = reader.currentline().strip()
4271  endsplit = current.split(beginbefore)[1].split(beginafter)
4272  startpiece = beginbefore + endsplit[0] + beginafter
4273  endbefore = FormulaConfig.endings['endbefore']
4274  endafter = FormulaConfig.endings['endafter']
4275  endpiece = endbefore + endsplit[0] + endafter
4276  return startpiece + self.parsemultiliner(reader, startpiece, endpiece) + endpiece
4277  Trace.error('Missing ' + beginafter + ' in ' + reader.currentline())
4278  return ''
4279  begincommand = FormulaConfig.starts['command']
4280  beginbracket = FormulaConfig.starts['bracket']
4281  if begincommand in reader.currentline() and beginbracket in reader.currentline():
4282  endbracket = FormulaConfig.endings['bracket']
4283  return self.parsemultiliner(reader, beginbracket, endbracket)
4284  Trace.error('Formula beginning ' + reader.currentline() + ' is unknown')
4285  return ''
4286 
4287  def parsesingleliner(self, reader, start, ending):
4288  "Parse a formula in one line"
4289  line = reader.currentline().strip()
4290  if not start in line:
4291  Trace.error('Line ' + line + ' does not contain formula start ' + start)
4292  return ''
4293  if not line.endswith(ending):
4294  Trace.error('Formula ' + line + ' does not end with ' + ending)
4295  return ''
4296  index = line.index(start)
4297  rest = line[index + len(start):-len(ending)]
4298  reader.nextline()
4299  return rest
4300 
4301  def parsemultiliner(self, reader, start, ending):
4302  "Parse a formula in multiple lines"
4303  formula = ''
4304  line = reader.currentline()
4305  if not start in line:
4306  Trace.error('Line ' + line.strip() + ' does not contain formula start ' + start)
4307  return ''
4308  index = line.index(start)
4309  line = line[index + len(start):].strip()
4310  while not line.endswith(ending):
4311  formula += line + '\n'
4312  reader.nextline()
4313  line = reader.currentline()
4314  formula += line[:-len(ending)]
4315  reader.nextline()
4316  return formula
4317 
4318 class MacroParser(FormulaParser):
4319  "A parser for a formula macro."
4320 
4321  def parseheader(self, reader):
4322  "See if the formula is inlined"
4323  self.begin = reader.linenumber + 1
4324  return ['inline']
4325 
4326  def parse(self, reader):
4327  "Parse the formula until the end"
4328  formula = self.parsemultiliner(reader, self.parent.start, self.ending)
4329  reader.nextline()
4330  return formula
4331 
4332 
4333 
4334 
4335 
4336 
4337 
4338 
4339 
4340 class FormulaBit(Container):
4341  "A bit of a formula"
4342 
4343  type = None
4344  size = 1
4345  original = ''
4346 
4347  def __init__(self):
4348  "The formula bit type can be 'alpha', 'number', 'font'."
4349  self.contents = []
4350  self.output = ContentsOutput()
4351 
4352  def setfactory(self, factory):
4353  "Set the internal formula factory."
4354  self.factory = factory
4355  return self
4356 
4357  def add(self, bit):
4358  "Add any kind of formula bit already processed"
4359  self.contents.append(bit)
4360  self.original += bit.original
4361  bit.parent = self
4362 
4363  def skiporiginal(self, string, pos):
4364  "Skip a string and add it to the original formula"
4365  self.original += string
4366  if not pos.checkskip(string):
4367  Trace.error('String ' + string + ' not at ' + pos.identifier())
4368 
4369  def computesize(self):
4370  "Compute the size of the bit as the max of the sizes of all contents."
4371  if len(self.contents) == 0:
4372  return 1
4373  self.size = max([element.size for element in self.contents])
4374  return self.size
4375 
4376  def clone(self):
4377  "Return a copy of itself."
4378  return self.factory.parseformula(self.original)
4379 
4380  def __unicode__(self):
4381  "Get a string representation"
4382  return self.__class__.__name__ + ' read in ' + self.original
4383 
4384 class TaggedBit(FormulaBit):
4385  "A tagged string in a formula"
4386 
4387  def constant(self, constant, tag):
4388  "Set the constant and the tag"
4389  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag(tag)
4390  self.add(FormulaConstant(constant))
4391  return self
4392 
4393  def complete(self, contents, tag, breaklines = False):
4394  "Set the constant and the tag"
4395  self.contents = contents
4396  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag(tag, breaklines)
4397  return self
4398 
4399  def selfcomplete(self, tag):
4400  "Set the self-closing tag, no contents (as in <hr/>)."
4401  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag(tag, empty = True)
4402  return self
4403 
4404 class FormulaConstant(Constant):
4405  "A constant string in a formula"
4406 
4407  def __init__(self, string):
4408  "Set the constant string"
4409  Constant.__init__(self, string)
4410  self.original = string
4411  self.size = 1
4412  self.type = None
4413 
4414  def computesize(self):
4415  "Compute the size of the constant: always 1."
4416  return self.size
4417 
4418  def clone(self):
4419  "Return a copy of itself."
4420  return FormulaConstant(self.original)
4421 
4422  def __unicode__(self):
4423  "Return a printable representation."
4424  return 'Formula constant: ' + self.string
4425 
4426 class RawText(FormulaBit):
4427  "A bit of text inside a formula"
4428 
4429  def detect(self, pos):
4430  "Detect a bit of raw text"
4431  return pos.current().isalpha()
4432 
4433  def parsebit(self, pos):
4434  "Parse alphabetic text"
4435  alpha = pos.globalpha()
4436  self.add(FormulaConstant(alpha))
4437  self.type = 'alpha'
4438 
4439 class FormulaSymbol(FormulaBit):
4440  "A symbol inside a formula"
4441 
4442  modified = FormulaConfig.modified
4443  unmodified = FormulaConfig.unmodified['characters']
4444 
4445  def detect(self, pos):
4446  "Detect a symbol"
4447  if pos.current() in FormulaSymbol.unmodified:
4448  return True
4449  if pos.current() in FormulaSymbol.modified:
4450  return True
4451  return False
4452 
4453  def parsebit(self, pos):
4454  "Parse the symbol"
4455  if pos.current() in FormulaSymbol.unmodified:
4456  self.addsymbol(pos.current(), pos)
4457  return
4458  if pos.current() in FormulaSymbol.modified:
4459  self.addsymbol(FormulaSymbol.modified[pos.current()], pos)
4460  return
4461  Trace.error('Symbol ' + pos.current() + ' not found')
4462 
4463  def addsymbol(self, symbol, pos):
4464  "Add a symbol"
4465  self.skiporiginal(pos.current(), pos)
4466  self.contents.append(FormulaConstant(symbol))
4467 
4468 class FormulaNumber(FormulaBit):
4469  "A string of digits in a formula"
4470 
4471  def detect(self, pos):
4472  "Detect a digit"
4473  return pos.current().isdigit()
4474 
4475  def parsebit(self, pos):
4476  "Parse a bunch of digits"
4477  digits = pos.glob(lambda: pos.current().isdigit())
4478  self.add(FormulaConstant(digits))
4479  self.type = 'number'
4480 
4481 class Comment(FormulaBit):
4482  "A LaTeX comment: % to the end of the line."
4483 
4484  start = FormulaConfig.starts['comment']
4485 
4486  def detect(self, pos):
4487  "Detect the %."
4488  return pos.current() == self.start
4489 
4490  def parsebit(self, pos):
4491  "Parse to the end of the line."
4492  self.original += pos.globincluding('\n')
4493 
4494 class WhiteSpace(FormulaBit):
4495  "Some white space inside a formula."
4496 
4497  def detect(self, pos):
4498  "Detect the white space."
4499  return pos.current().isspace()
4500 
4501  def parsebit(self, pos):
4502  "Parse all whitespace."
4503  self.original += pos.skipspace()
4504 
4505  def __unicode__(self):
4506  "Return a printable representation."
4507  return 'Whitespace: *' + self.original + '*'
4508 
4509 class Bracket(FormulaBit):
4510  "A {} bracket inside a formula"
4511 
4512  start = FormulaConfig.starts['bracket']
4513  ending = FormulaConfig.endings['bracket']
4514 
4515  def __init__(self):
4516  "Create a (possibly literal) new bracket"
4517  FormulaBit.__init__(self)
4518  self.inner = None
4519 
4520  def detect(self, pos):
4521  "Detect the start of a bracket"
4522  return pos.checkfor(self.start)
4523 
4524  def parsebit(self, pos):
4525  "Parse the bracket"
4526  self.parsecomplete(pos, self.innerformula)
4527  return self
4528 
4529  def parsetext(self, pos):
4530  "Parse a text bracket"
4531  self.parsecomplete(pos, self.innertext)
4532  return self
4533 
4534  def parseliteral(self, pos):
4535  "Parse a literal bracket"
4536  self.parsecomplete(pos, self.innerliteral)
4537  return self
4538 
4539  def parsecomplete(self, pos, innerparser):
4540  "Parse the start and end marks"
4541  if not pos.checkfor(self.start):
4542  Trace.error('Bracket should start with ' + self.start + ' at ' + pos.identifier())
4543  return None
4544  self.skiporiginal(self.start, pos)
4545  pos.pushending(self.ending)
4546  innerparser(pos)
4547  self.original += pos.popending(self.ending)
4548  self.computesize()
4549 
4550  def innerformula(self, pos):
4551  "Parse a whole formula inside the bracket"
4552  while not pos.finished():
4553  self.add(self.factory.parseany(pos))
4554 
4555  def innertext(self, pos):
4556  "Parse some text inside the bracket, following textual rules."
4557  specialchars = FormulaConfig.symbolfunctions.keys()
4558  specialchars.append(FormulaConfig.starts['command'])
4559  specialchars.append(FormulaConfig.starts['bracket'])
4560  specialchars.append(Comment.start)
4561  while not pos.finished():
4562  if pos.current() in specialchars:
4563  self.add(self.factory.parseany(pos))
4564  if pos.checkskip(' '):
4565  self.original += ' '
4566  else:
4567  self.add(FormulaConstant(pos.skipcurrent()))
4568 
4569  def innerliteral(self, pos):
4570  "Parse a literal inside the bracket, which does not generate HTML."
4571  self.literal = ''
4572  while not pos.finished() and not pos.current() == self.ending:
4573  if pos.current() == self.start:
4574  self.parseliteral(pos)
4575  else:
4576  self.literal += pos.skipcurrent()
4577  self.original += self.literal
4578 
4579 class SquareBracket(Bracket):
4580  "A [] bracket inside a formula"
4581 
4582  start = FormulaConfig.starts['squarebracket']
4583  ending = FormulaConfig.endings['squarebracket']
4584 
4585  def clone(self):
4586  "Return a new square bracket with the same contents."
4587  bracket = SquareBracket()
4588  bracket.contents = self.contents
4589  return bracket
4590 
4591 
4592 
4593 class MathsProcessor(object):
4594  "A processor for a maths construction inside the FormulaProcessor."
4595 
4596  def process(self, contents, index):
4597  "Process an element inside a formula."
4598  Trace.error('Unimplemented process() in ' + unicode(self))
4599 
4600  def __unicode__(self):
4601  "Return a printable description."
4602  return 'Maths processor ' + self.__class__.__name__
4603 
4604 class FormulaProcessor(object):
4605  "A processor specifically for formulas."
4606 
4607  processors = []
4608 
4609  def process(self, bit):
4610  "Process the contents of every formula bit, recursively."
4611  self.processcontents(bit)
4612  self.processinsides(bit)
4613  self.traversewhole(bit)
4614 
4615  def processcontents(self, bit):
4616  "Process the contents of a formula bit."
4617  if not isinstance(bit, FormulaBit):
4618  return
4619  bit.process()
4620  for element in bit.contents:
4621  self.processcontents(element)
4622 
4623  def processinsides(self, bit):
4624  "Process the insides (limits, brackets) in a formula bit."
4625  if not isinstance(bit, FormulaBit):
4626  return
4627  for index, element in enumerate(bit.contents):
4628  for processor in self.processors:
4629  processor.process(bit.contents, index)
4630  # continue with recursive processing
4631  self.processinsides(element)
4632 
4633  def traversewhole(self, formula):
4634  "Traverse over the contents to alter variables and space units."
4635  last = None
4636  for bit, contents in self.traverse(formula):
4637  if bit.type == 'alpha':
4638  self.italicize(bit, contents)
4639  elif bit.type == 'font' and last and last.type == 'number':
4640  bit.contents.insert(0, FormulaConstant(u' '))
4641  last = bit
4642 
4643  def traverse(self, bit):
4644  "Traverse a formula and yield a flattened structure of (bit, list) pairs."
4645  for element in bit.contents:
4646  if hasattr(element, 'type') and element.type:
4647  yield (element, bit.contents)
4648  elif isinstance(element, FormulaBit):
4649  for pair in self.traverse(element):
4650  yield pair
4651 
4652  def italicize(self, bit, contents):
4653  "Italicize the given bit of text."
4654  index = contents.index(bit)
4655  contents[index] = TaggedBit().complete([bit], 'i')
4656 
4657 
4658 
4659 
4660 class Formula(Container):
4661  "A LaTeX formula"
4662 
4663  def __init__(self):
4664  self.parser = FormulaParser()
4665  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="formula"')
4666 
4667  def process(self):
4668  "Convert the formula to tags"
4669  if self.header[0] == 'inline':
4670  DocumentParameters.displaymode = False
4671  else:
4672  DocumentParameters.displaymode = True
4673  self.output.settag('div class="formula"', True)
4674  if Options.jsmath:
4675  self.jsmath()
4676  elif Options.mathjax:
4677  self.mathjax()
4678  elif Options.googlecharts:
4679  self.googlecharts()
4680  else:
4681  self.classic()
4682 
4683  def jsmath(self):
4684  "Make the contents for jsMath."
4685  if self.header[0] != 'inline':
4686  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('div class="math"')
4687  else:
4688  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="math"')
4689  self.contents = [Constant(self.parsed)]
4690 
4691  def mathjax(self):
4692  "Make the contents for MathJax."
4693  self.output.tag = 'span class="MathJax_Preview"'
4694  tag = 'script type="math/tex'
4695  if self.header[0] != 'inline':
4696  tag += ';mode=display'
4697  self.contents = [TaggedText().constant(self.parsed, tag + '"', True)]
4698 
4699  def googlecharts(self):
4700  "Make the contents using Google Charts http://code.google.com/apis/chart/."
4701  url = FormulaConfig.urls['googlecharts'] + urllib.quote_plus(self.parsed)
4702  img = '<img class="chart" src="' + url + '" alt="' + self.parsed + '"/>'
4703  self.contents = [Constant(img)]
4704 
4705  def classic(self):
4706  "Make the contents using classic output generation with XHTML and CSS."
4707  whole = FormulaFactory().parseformula(self.parsed)
4708  FormulaProcessor().process(whole)
4709  whole.parent = self
4710  self.contents = [whole]
4711 
4712  def parse(self, pos):
4713  "Parse using a parse position instead of self.parser."
4714  if pos.checkskip('$$'):
4715  self.parsedollarblock(pos)
4716  elif pos.checkskip('$'):
4717  self.parsedollarinline(pos)
4718  elif pos.checkskip('\\('):
4719  self.parseinlineto(pos, '\\)')
4720  elif pos.checkskip('\\['):
4721  self.parseblockto(pos, '\\]')
4722  else:
4723  pos.error('Unparseable formula')
4724  self.process()
4725  return self
4726 
4727  def parsedollarinline(self, pos):
4728  "Parse a $...$ formula."
4729  self.header = ['inline']
4730  self.parsedollar(pos)
4731 
4732  def parsedollarblock(self, pos):
4733  "Parse a $$...$$ formula."
4734  self.header = ['block']
4735  self.parsedollar(pos)
4736  if not pos.checkskip('$'):
4737  pos.error('Formula should be $$...$$, but last $ is missing.')
4738 
4739  def parsedollar(self, pos):
4740  "Parse to the next $."
4741  pos.pushending('$')
4742  self.parsed = pos.globexcluding('$')
4743  pos.popending('$')
4744 
4745  def parseinlineto(self, pos, limit):
4746  "Parse a \\(...\\) formula."
4747  self.header = ['inline']
4748  self.parseupto(pos, limit)
4749 
4750  def parseblockto(self, pos, limit):
4751  "Parse a \\[...\\] formula."
4752  self.header = ['block']
4753  self.parseupto(pos, limit)
4754 
4755  def parseupto(self, pos, limit):
4756  "Parse a formula that ends with the given command."
4757  pos.pushending(limit)
4758  self.parsed = pos.glob(lambda: True)
4759  pos.popending(limit)
4760 
4761  def __unicode__(self):
4762  "Return a printable representation."
4763  if self.partkey and self.partkey.number:
4764  return 'Formula (' + self.partkey.number + ')'
4765  return 'Unnumbered formula'
4766 
4767 class WholeFormula(FormulaBit):
4768  "Parse a whole formula"
4769 
4770  def detect(self, pos):
4771  "Not outside the formula is enough."
4772  return not pos.finished()
4773 
4774  def parsebit(self, pos):
4775  "Parse with any formula bit"
4776  while not pos.finished():
4777  self.add(self.factory.parseany(pos))
4778 
4779 class FormulaFactory(object):
4780  "Construct bits of formula"
4781 
4782  # bit types will be appended later
4783  types = [FormulaSymbol, RawText, FormulaNumber, Bracket, Comment, WhiteSpace]
4784  skippedtypes = [Comment, WhiteSpace]
4785  defining = False
4786 
4787  def __init__(self):
4788  "Initialize the map of instances."
4789  self.instances = dict()
4790 
4791  def detecttype(self, type, pos):
4792  "Detect a bit of a given type."
4793  if pos.finished():
4794  return False
4795  return self.instance(type).detect(pos)
4796 
4797  def instance(self, type):
4798  "Get an instance of the given type."
4799  if not type in self.instances or not self.instances[type]:
4800  self.instances[type] = self.create(type)
4801  return self.instances[type]
4802 
4803  def create(self, type):
4804  "Create a new formula bit of the given type."
4805  return Cloner.create(type).setfactory(self)
4806 
4807  def clearskipped(self, pos):
4808  "Clear any skipped types."
4809  while not pos.finished():
4810  if not self.skipany(pos):
4811  return
4812  return
4813 
4814  def skipany(self, pos):
4815  "Skip any skipped types."
4816  for type in self.skippedtypes:
4817  if self.instance(type).detect(pos):
4818  return self.parsetype(type, pos)
4819  return None
4820 
4821  def parseany(self, pos):
4822  "Parse any formula bit at the current location."
4823  for type in self.types + self.skippedtypes:
4824  if self.detecttype(type, pos):
4825  return self.parsetype(type, pos)
4826  Trace.error('Unrecognized formula at ' + pos.identifier())
4827  return FormulaConstant(pos.skipcurrent())
4828 
4829  def parsetype(self, type, pos):
4830  "Parse the given type and return it."
4831  bit = self.instance(type)
4832  self.instances[type] = None
4833  returnedbit = bit.parsebit(pos)
4834  if returnedbit:
4835  return returnedbit.setfactory(self)
4836  return bit
4837 
4838  def parseformula(self, formula):
4839  "Parse a string of text that contains a whole formula."
4840  pos = TextPosition(formula)
4841  whole = self.create(WholeFormula)
4842  if whole.detect(pos):
4843  whole.parsebit(pos)
4844  return whole
4845  # no formula found
4846  if not pos.finished():
4847  Trace.error('Unknown formula at: ' + pos.identifier())
4848  whole.add(TaggedBit().constant(formula, 'span class="unknown"'))
4849  return whole
4850 
4851 
4852 
4853 class FormulaCommand(FormulaBit):
4854  "A LaTeX command inside a formula"
4855 
4856  types = []
4857  start = FormulaConfig.starts['command']
4858  commandmap = None
4859 
4860  def detect(self, pos):
4861  "Find the current command."
4862  return pos.checkfor(FormulaCommand.start)
4863 
4864  def parsebit(self, pos):
4865  "Parse the command."
4866  command = self.extractcommand(pos)
4867  bit = self.parsewithcommand(command, pos)
4868  if bit:
4869  return bit
4870  if command.startswith('\\up') or command.startswith('\\Up'):
4871  upgreek = self.parseupgreek(command, pos)
4872  if upgreek:
4873  return upgreek
4874  if not self.factory.defining:
4875  Trace.error('Unknown command ' + command)
4876  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="unknown"')
4877  self.add(FormulaConstant(command))
4878  return None
4879 
4880  def parsewithcommand(self, command, pos):
4881  "Parse the command type once we have the command."
4882  for type in FormulaCommand.types:
4883  if command in type.commandmap:
4884  return self.parsecommandtype(command, type, pos)
4885  return None
4886 
4887  def parsecommandtype(self, command, type, pos):
4888  "Parse a given command type."
4889  bit = self.factory.create(type)
4890  bit.setcommand(command)
4891  returned = bit.parsebit(pos)
4892  if returned:
4893  return returned
4894  return bit
4895 
4896  def extractcommand(self, pos):
4897  "Extract the command from elyxer.the current position."
4898  if not pos.checkskip(FormulaCommand.start):
4899  pos.error('Missing command start ' + FormulaCommand.start)
4900  return
4901  if pos.finished():
4902  return self.emptycommand(pos)
4903  if pos.current().isalpha():
4904  # alpha command
4905  command = FormulaCommand.start + pos.globalpha()
4906  # skip mark of short command
4907  pos.checkskip('*')
4908  return command
4909  # symbol command
4910  return FormulaCommand.start + pos.skipcurrent()
4911 
4912  def emptycommand(self, pos):
4913  """Check for an empty command: look for command disguised as ending.
4914  Special case against '{ \{ \} }' situation."""
4915  command = ''
4916  if not pos.isout():
4917  ending = pos.nextending()
4918  if ending and pos.checkskip(ending):
4919  command = ending
4920  return FormulaCommand.start + command
4921 
4922  def parseupgreek(self, command, pos):
4923  "Parse the Greek \\up command.."
4924  if len(command) < 4:
4925  return None
4926  if command.startswith('\\up'):
4927  upcommand = '\\' + command[3:]
4928  elif pos.checkskip('\\Up'):
4929  upcommand = '\\' + command[3:4].upper() + command[4:]
4930  else:
4931  Trace.error('Impossible upgreek command: ' + command)
4932  return
4933  upgreek = self.parsewithcommand(upcommand, pos)
4934  if upgreek:
4935  upgreek.type = 'font'
4936  return upgreek
4937 
4938 class CommandBit(FormulaCommand):
4939  "A formula bit that includes a command"
4940 
4941  def setcommand(self, command):
4942  "Set the command in the bit"
4943  self.command = command
4944  if self.commandmap:
4945  self.original += command
4946  self.translated = self.commandmap[self.command]
4947 
4948  def parseparameter(self, pos):
4949  "Parse a parameter at the current position"
4950  self.factory.clearskipped(pos)
4951  if pos.finished():
4952  return None
4953  parameter = self.factory.parseany(pos)
4954  self.add(parameter)
4955  return parameter
4956 
4957  def parsesquare(self, pos):
4958  "Parse a square bracket"
4959  self.factory.clearskipped(pos)
4960  if not self.factory.detecttype(SquareBracket, pos):
4961  return None
4962  bracket = self.factory.parsetype(SquareBracket, pos)
4963  self.add(bracket)
4964  return bracket
4965 
4966  def parseliteral(self, pos):
4967  "Parse a literal bracket."
4968  self.factory.clearskipped(pos)
4969  if not self.factory.detecttype(Bracket, pos):
4970  if not pos.isvalue():
4971  Trace.error('No literal parameter found at: ' + pos.identifier())
4972  return None
4973  return pos.globvalue()
4974  bracket = Bracket().setfactory(self.factory)
4975  self.add(bracket.parseliteral(pos))
4976  return bracket.literal
4977 
4978  def parsesquareliteral(self, pos):
4979  "Parse a square bracket literally."
4980  self.factory.clearskipped(pos)
4981  if not self.factory.detecttype(SquareBracket, pos):
4982  return None
4983  bracket = SquareBracket().setfactory(self.factory)
4984  self.add(bracket.parseliteral(pos))
4985  return bracket.literal
4986 
4987  def parsetext(self, pos):
4988  "Parse a text parameter."
4989  self.factory.clearskipped(pos)
4990  if not self.factory.detecttype(Bracket, pos):
4991  Trace.error('No text parameter for ' + self.command)
4992  return None
4993  bracket = Bracket().setfactory(self.factory).parsetext(pos)
4994  self.add(bracket)
4995  return bracket
4996 
4997 class EmptyCommand(CommandBit):
4998  "An empty command (without parameters)"
4999 
5000  commandmap = FormulaConfig.commands
5001 
5002  def parsebit(self, pos):
5003  "Parse a command without parameters"
5004  self.contents = [FormulaConstant(self.translated)]
5005 
5006 class SpacedCommand(CommandBit):
5007  "An empty command which should have math spacing in formulas."
5008 
5009  commandmap = FormulaConfig.spacedcommands
5010 
5011  def parsebit(self, pos):
5012  "Place as contents the command translated and spaced."
5013  self.contents = [FormulaConstant(u' ' + self.translated + u' ')]
5014 
5015 class AlphaCommand(EmptyCommand):
5016  "A command without paramters whose result is alphabetical"
5017 
5018  commandmap = FormulaConfig.alphacommands
5019 
5020  def parsebit(self, pos):
5021  "Parse the command and set type to alpha"
5022  EmptyCommand.parsebit(self, pos)
5023  self.type = 'alpha'
5024 
5025 class OneParamFunction(CommandBit):
5026  "A function of one parameter"
5027 
5028  commandmap = FormulaConfig.onefunctions
5029  simplified = False
5030 
5031  def parsebit(self, pos):
5032  "Parse a function with one parameter"
5033  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag(self.translated)
5034  self.parseparameter(pos)
5035  self.simplifyifpossible()
5036 
5037  def simplifyifpossible(self):
5038  "Try to simplify to a single character."
5039  if self.original in self.commandmap:
5040  self.output = FixedOutput()
5041  self.html = [self.commandmap[self.original]]
5042  self.simplified = True
5043 
5044 class SymbolFunction(CommandBit):
5045  "Find a function which is represented by a symbol (like _ or ^)"
5046 
5047  commandmap = FormulaConfig.symbolfunctions
5048 
5049  def detect(self, pos):
5050  "Find the symbol"
5051  return pos.current() in SymbolFunction.commandmap
5052 
5053  def parsebit(self, pos):
5054  "Parse the symbol"
5055  self.setcommand(pos.current())
5056  pos.skip(self.command)
5057  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag(self.translated)
5058  self.parseparameter(pos)
5059 
5060 class TextFunction(CommandBit):
5061  "A function where parameters are read as text."
5062 
5063  commandmap = FormulaConfig.textfunctions
5064 
5065  def parsebit(self, pos):
5066  "Parse a text parameter"
5067  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag(self.translated)
5068  self.parsetext(pos)
5069 
5070  def process(self):
5071  "Set the type to font"
5072  self.type = 'font'
5073 
5074 class LabelFunction(CommandBit):
5075  "A function that acts as a label"
5076 
5077  commandmap = FormulaConfig.labelfunctions
5078 
5079  def parsebit(self, pos):
5080  "Parse a literal parameter"
5081  self.key = self.parseliteral(pos)
5082 
5083  def process(self):
5084  "Add an anchor with the label contents."
5085  self.type = 'font'
5086  self.label = Label().create(' ', self.key, type = 'eqnumber')
5087  self.contents = [self.label]
5088  # store as a Label so we know it's been seen
5089  Label.names[self.key] = self.label
5090 
5091 class FontFunction(OneParamFunction):
5092  "A function of one parameter that changes the font"
5093 
5094  commandmap = FormulaConfig.fontfunctions
5095 
5096  def process(self):
5097  "Simplify if possible using a single character."
5098  self.type = 'font'
5099  self.simplifyifpossible()
5100 
5101 FormulaFactory.types += [FormulaCommand, SymbolFunction]
5102 FormulaCommand.types = [
5103  AlphaCommand, EmptyCommand, OneParamFunction, FontFunction, LabelFunction,
5104  TextFunction, SpacedCommand,
5105  ]
5106 
5107 
5108 
5109 
5110 
5111 
5112 
5113 
5114 
5115 
5116 
5117 
5118 
5119 
5120 
5121 class BigSymbol(object):
5122  "A big symbol generator."
5123 
5124  symbols = FormulaConfig.bigsymbols
5125 
5126  def __init__(self, symbol):
5127  "Create the big symbol."
5128  self.symbol = symbol
5129 
5130  def getpieces(self):
5131  "Get an array with all pieces."
5132  if not self.symbol in self.symbols:
5133  return [self.symbol]
5134  if self.smalllimit():
5135  return [self.symbol]
5136  return self.symbols[self.symbol]
5137 
5138  def smalllimit(self):
5139  "Decide if the limit should be a small, one-line symbol."
5140  if not DocumentParameters.displaymode:
5141  return True
5142  if len(self.symbols[self.symbol]) == 1:
5143  return True
5144  return Options.simplemath
5145 
5146 class BigBracket(BigSymbol):
5147  "A big bracket generator."
5148 
5149  def __init__(self, size, bracket, alignment='l'):
5150  "Set the size and symbol for the bracket."
5151  self.size = size
5152  self.original = bracket
5153  self.alignment = alignment
5154  self.pieces = None
5155  if bracket in FormulaConfig.bigbrackets:
5156  self.pieces = FormulaConfig.bigbrackets[bracket]
5157 
5158  def getpiece(self, index):
5159  "Return the nth piece for the bracket."
5160  function = getattr(self, 'getpiece' + unicode(len(self.pieces)))
5161  return function(index)
5162 
5163  def getpiece1(self, index):
5164  "Return the only piece for a single-piece bracket."
5165  return self.pieces[0]
5166 
5167  def getpiece3(self, index):
5168  "Get the nth piece for a 3-piece bracket: parenthesis or square bracket."
5169  if index == 0:
5170  return self.pieces[0]
5171  if index == self.size - 1:
5172  return self.pieces[-1]
5173  return self.pieces[1]
5174 
5175  def getpiece4(self, index):
5176  "Get the nth piece for a 4-piece bracket: curly bracket."
5177  if index == 0:
5178  return self.pieces[0]
5179  if index == self.size - 1:
5180  return self.pieces[3]
5181  if index == (self.size - 1)/2:
5182  return self.pieces[2]
5183  return self.pieces[1]
5184 
5185  def getcell(self, index):
5186  "Get the bracket piece as an array cell."
5187  piece = self.getpiece(index)
5188  span = 'span class="bracket align-' + self.alignment + '"'
5189  return TaggedBit().constant(piece, span)
5190 
5191  def getcontents(self):
5192  "Get the bracket as an array or as a single bracket."
5193  if self.size == 1 or not self.pieces:
5194  return self.getsinglebracket()
5195  rows = []
5196  for index in range(self.size):
5197  cell = self.getcell(index)
5198  rows.append(TaggedBit().complete([cell], 'span class="arrayrow"'))
5199  return [TaggedBit().complete(rows, 'span class="array"')]
5200 
5201  def getsinglebracket(self):
5202  "Return the bracket as a single sign."
5203  if self.original == '.':
5204  return [TaggedBit().constant('', 'span class="emptydot"')]
5205  return [TaggedBit().constant(self.original, 'span class="symbol"')]
5206 
5207 
5208 
5209 
5210 
5211 
5212 class FormulaEquation(CommandBit):
5213  "A simple numbered equation."
5214 
5215  piece = 'equation'
5216 
5217  def parsebit(self, pos):
5218  "Parse the matrix"
5219  self.output = ContentsOutput()
5220  self.add(self.factory.parsetype(WholeFormula, pos))
5221 
5222 class FormulaCell(FormulaCommand):
5223  "An array cell inside a row"
5224 
5225  def setalignment(self, alignment):
5226  self.alignment = alignment
5227  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="arraycell align-' + alignment +'"', True)
5228  return self
5229 
5230  def parsebit(self, pos):
5231  self.factory.clearskipped(pos)
5232  if pos.finished():
5233  return
5234  self.add(self.factory.parsetype(WholeFormula, pos))
5235 
5236 class FormulaRow(FormulaCommand):
5237  "An array row inside an array"
5238 
5239  cellseparator = FormulaConfig.array['cellseparator']
5240 
5241  def setalignments(self, alignments):
5242  self.alignments = alignments
5243  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="arrayrow"', True)
5244  return self
5245 
5246  def parsebit(self, pos):
5247  "Parse a whole row"
5248  index = 0
5249  pos.pushending(self.cellseparator, optional=True)
5250  while not pos.finished():
5251  cell = self.createcell(index)
5252  cell.parsebit(pos)
5253  self.add(cell)
5254  index += 1
5255  pos.checkskip(self.cellseparator)
5256  if len(self.contents) == 0:
5257  self.output = EmptyOutput()
5258 
5259  def createcell(self, index):
5260  "Create the cell that corresponds to the given index."
5261  alignment = self.alignments[index % len(self.alignments)]
5262  return self.factory.create(FormulaCell).setalignment(alignment)
5263 
5264 class MultiRowFormula(CommandBit):
5265  "A formula with multiple rows."
5266 
5267  def parserows(self, pos):
5268  "Parse all rows, finish when no more row ends"
5269  self.rows = []
5270  first = True
5271  for row in self.iteraterows(pos):
5272  if first:
5273  first = False
5274  else:
5275  # intersparse empty rows
5276  self.addempty()
5277  row.parsebit(pos)
5278  self.addrow(row)
5279  self.size = len(self.rows)
5280 
5281  def iteraterows(self, pos):
5282  "Iterate over all rows, end when no more row ends"
5283  rowseparator = FormulaConfig.array['rowseparator']
5284  while True:
5285  pos.pushending(rowseparator, True)
5286  row = self.factory.create(FormulaRow)
5287  yield row.setalignments(self.alignments)
5288  if pos.checkfor(rowseparator):
5289  self.original += pos.popending(rowseparator)
5290  else:
5291  return
5292 
5293  def addempty(self):
5294  "Add an empty row."
5295  row = self.factory.create(FormulaRow).setalignments(self.alignments)
5296  for index, originalcell in enumerate(self.rows[-1].contents):
5297  cell = row.createcell(index)
5298  cell.add(FormulaConstant(u' '))
5299  row.add(cell)
5300  self.addrow(row)
5301 
5302  def addrow(self, row):
5303  "Add a row to the contents and to the list of rows."
5304  self.rows.append(row)
5305  self.add(row)
5306 
5307 class FormulaArray(MultiRowFormula):
5308  "An array within a formula"
5309 
5310  piece = 'array'
5311 
5312  def parsebit(self, pos):
5313  "Parse the matrix"
5314  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="array"', False)
5315  self.parsealignments(pos)
5316  self.parserows(pos)
5317 
5318  def parsealignments(self, pos):
5319  "Parse the different alignments"
5320  # vertical
5321  self.valign = 'c'
5322  literal = self.parsesquareliteral(pos)
5323  if literal:
5324  self.valign = literal
5325  # horizontal
5326  literal = self.parseliteral(pos)
5327  self.alignments = []
5328  for l in literal:
5329  self.alignments.append(l)
5330 
5331 class FormulaMatrix(MultiRowFormula):
5332  "A matrix (array with center alignment)."
5333 
5334  piece = 'matrix'
5335 
5336  def parsebit(self, pos):
5337  "Parse the matrix, set alignments to 'c'."
5338  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="array"', False)
5339  self.valign = 'c'
5340  self.alignments = ['c']
5341  self.parserows(pos)
5342 
5343 class FormulaCases(MultiRowFormula):
5344  "A cases statement"
5345 
5346  piece = 'cases'
5347 
5348  def parsebit(self, pos):
5349  "Parse the cases"
5350  self.output = ContentsOutput()
5351  self.alignments = ['l', 'l']
5352  self.parserows(pos)
5353  for row in self.contents:
5354  for cell in row.contents:
5355  cell.output.settag('span class="case align-l"', True)
5356  cell.contents.append(FormulaConstant(u' '))
5357  array = TaggedBit().complete(self.contents, 'span class="bracketcases"', True)
5358  brace = BigBracket(len(self.contents), '{', 'l')
5359  self.contents = brace.getcontents() + [array]
5360 
5361 class EquationEnvironment(MultiRowFormula):
5362  "A \\begin{}...\\end equation environment with rows and cells."
5363 
5364  def parsebit(self, pos):
5365  "Parse the whole environment."
5366  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="environment"', False)
5367  environment = self.piece.replace('*', '')
5368  if environment in FormulaConfig.environments:
5369  self.alignments = FormulaConfig.environments[environment]
5370  else:
5371  Trace.error('Unknown equation environment ' + self.piece)
5372  self.alignments = ['l']
5373  self.parserows(pos)
5374 
5375 class BeginCommand(CommandBit):
5376  "A \\begin{}...\end command and what it entails (array, cases, aligned)"
5377 
5378  commandmap = {FormulaConfig.array['begin']:''}
5379 
5380  types = [FormulaEquation, FormulaArray, FormulaCases, FormulaMatrix]
5381 
5382  def parsebit(self, pos):
5383  "Parse the begin command"
5384  command = self.parseliteral(pos)
5385  bit = self.findbit(command)
5386  ending = FormulaConfig.array['end'] + '{' + command + '}'
5387  pos.pushending(ending)
5388  bit.parsebit(pos)
5389  self.add(bit)
5390  self.original += pos.popending(ending)
5391  self.size = bit.size
5392 
5393  def findbit(self, piece):
5394  "Find the command bit corresponding to the \\begin{piece}"
5395  for type in BeginCommand.types:
5396  if piece.replace('*', '') == type.piece:
5397  return self.factory.create(type)
5398  bit = self.factory.create(EquationEnvironment)
5399  bit.piece = piece
5400  return bit
5401 
5402 FormulaCommand.types += [BeginCommand]
5403 
5404 
5405 import datetime
5406 
5407 
5408 class CombiningFunction(OneParamFunction):
5409 
5410  commandmap = FormulaConfig.combiningfunctions
5411 
5412  def parsebit(self, pos):
5413  "Parse a combining function."
5414  self.type = 'alpha'
5415  combining = self.translated
5416  parameter = self.parsesingleparameter(pos)
5417  if not parameter:
5418  Trace.error('Empty parameter for combining function ' + self.command)
5419  elif len(parameter.extracttext()) != 1:
5420  Trace.error('Applying combining function ' + self.command + ' to invalid string "' + parameter.extracttext() + '"')
5421  self.contents.append(Constant(combining))
5422 
5423  def parsesingleparameter(self, pos):
5424  "Parse a parameter, or a single letter."
5425  self.factory.clearskipped(pos)
5426  if pos.finished():
5427  Trace.error('Error while parsing single parameter at ' + pos.identifier())
5428  return None
5429  if self.factory.detecttype(Bracket, pos) \
5430  or self.factory.detecttype(FormulaCommand, pos):
5431  return self.parseparameter(pos)
5432  letter = FormulaConstant(pos.skipcurrent())
5433  self.add(letter)
5434  return letter
5435 
5436 class DecoratingFunction(OneParamFunction):
5437  "A function that decorates some bit of text"
5438 
5439  commandmap = FormulaConfig.decoratingfunctions
5440 
5441  def parsebit(self, pos):
5442  "Parse a decorating function"
5443  self.type = 'alpha'
5444  symbol = self.translated
5445  self.symbol = TaggedBit().constant(symbol, 'span class="symbolover"')
5446  self.parameter = self.parseparameter(pos)
5447  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="withsymbol"')
5448  self.contents.insert(0, self.symbol)
5449  self.parameter.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="undersymbol"')
5450  self.simplifyifpossible()
5451 
5452 class LimitCommand(EmptyCommand):
5453  "A command which accepts limits above and below, in display mode."
5454 
5455  commandmap = FormulaConfig.limitcommands
5456 
5457  def parsebit(self, pos):
5458  "Parse a limit command."
5459  pieces = BigSymbol(self.translated).getpieces()
5460  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="limits"')
5461  for piece in pieces:
5462  self.contents.append(TaggedBit().constant(piece, 'span class="limit"'))
5463 
5464 class LimitPreviousCommand(LimitCommand):
5465  "A command to limit the previous command."
5466 
5467  commandmap = None
5468 
5469  def parsebit(self, pos):
5470  "Do nothing."
5471  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="limits"')
5472  self.factory.clearskipped(pos)
5473 
5474  def __unicode__(self):
5475  "Return a printable representation."
5476  return 'Limit previous command'
5477 
5478 class LimitsProcessor(MathsProcessor):
5479  "A processor for limits inside an element."
5480 
5481  def process(self, contents, index):
5482  "Process the limits for an element."
5483  if Options.simplemath:
5484  return
5485  if self.checklimits(contents, index):
5486  self.modifylimits(contents, index)
5487  if self.checkscript(contents, index) and self.checkscript(contents, index + 1):
5488  self.modifyscripts(contents, index)
5489 
5490  def checklimits(self, contents, index):
5491  "Check if the current position has a limits command."
5492  if not DocumentParameters.displaymode:
5493  return False
5494  if self.checkcommand(contents, index + 1, LimitPreviousCommand):
5495  self.limitsahead(contents, index)
5496  return False
5497  if not isinstance(contents[index], LimitCommand):
5498  return False
5499  return self.checkscript(contents, index + 1)
5500 
5501  def limitsahead(self, contents, index):
5502  "Limit the current element based on the next."
5503  contents[index + 1].add(contents[index].clone())
5504  contents[index].output = EmptyOutput()
5505 
5506  def modifylimits(self, contents, index):
5507  "Modify a limits commands so that the limits appear above and below."
5508  limited = contents[index]
5509  subscript = self.getlimit(contents, index + 1)
5510  limited.contents.append(subscript)
5511  if self.checkscript(contents, index + 1):
5512  superscript = self.getlimit(contents, index + 1)
5513  else:
5514  superscript = TaggedBit().constant(u' ', 'sup class="limit"')
5515  limited.contents.insert(0, superscript)
5516 
5517  def getlimit(self, contents, index):
5518  "Get the limit for a limits command."
5519  limit = self.getscript(contents, index)
5520  limit.output.tag = limit.output.tag.replace('script', 'limit')
5521  return limit
5522 
5523  def modifyscripts(self, contents, index):
5524  "Modify the super- and subscript to appear vertically aligned."
5525  subscript = self.getscript(contents, index)
5526  # subscript removed so instead of index + 1 we get index again
5527  superscript = self.getscript(contents, index)
5528  scripts = TaggedBit().complete([superscript, subscript], 'span class="scripts"')
5529  contents.insert(index, scripts)
5530 
5531  def checkscript(self, contents, index):
5532  "Check if the current element is a sub- or superscript."
5533  return self.checkcommand(contents, index, SymbolFunction)
5534 
5535  def checkcommand(self, contents, index, type):
5536  "Check for the given type as the current element."
5537  if len(contents) <= index:
5538  return False
5539  return isinstance(contents[index], type)
5540 
5541  def getscript(self, contents, index):
5542  "Get the sub- or superscript."
5543  bit = contents[index]
5544  bit.output.tag += ' class="script"'
5545  del contents[index]
5546  return bit
5547 
5548 class BracketCommand(OneParamFunction):
5549  "A command which defines a bracket."
5550 
5551  commandmap = FormulaConfig.bracketcommands
5552 
5553  def parsebit(self, pos):
5554  "Parse the bracket."
5555  OneParamFunction.parsebit(self, pos)
5556 
5557  def create(self, direction, character):
5558  "Create the bracket for the given character."
5559  self.original = character
5560  self.command = '\\' + direction
5561  self.contents = [FormulaConstant(character)]
5562  return self
5563 
5564 class BracketProcessor(MathsProcessor):
5565  "A processor for bracket commands."
5566 
5567  def process(self, contents, index):
5568  "Convert the bracket using Unicode pieces, if possible."
5569  if Options.simplemath:
5570  return
5571  if self.checkleft(contents, index):
5572  return self.processleft(contents, index)
5573 
5574  def processleft(self, contents, index):
5575  "Process a left bracket."
5576  rightindex = self.findright(contents, index + 1)
5577  if not rightindex:
5578  return
5579  size = self.findmax(contents, index, rightindex)
5580  self.resize(contents[index], size)
5581  self.resize(contents[rightindex], size)
5582 
5583  def checkleft(self, contents, index):
5584  "Check if the command at the given index is left."
5585  return self.checkdirection(contents[index], '\\left')
5586 
5587  def checkright(self, contents, index):
5588  "Check if the command at the given index is right."
5589  return self.checkdirection(contents[index], '\\right')
5590 
5591  def checkdirection(self, bit, command):
5592  "Check if the given bit is the desired bracket command."
5593  if not isinstance(bit, BracketCommand):
5594  return False
5595  return bit.command == command
5596 
5597  def findright(self, contents, index):
5598  "Find the right bracket starting at the given index, or 0."
5599  depth = 1
5600  while index < len(contents):
5601  if self.checkleft(contents, index):
5602  depth += 1
5603  if self.checkright(contents, index):
5604  depth -= 1
5605  if depth == 0:
5606  return index
5607  index += 1
5608  return None
5609 
5610  def findmax(self, contents, leftindex, rightindex):
5611  "Find the max size of the contents between the two given indices."
5612  sliced = contents[leftindex:rightindex]
5613  return max([element.size for element in sliced])
5614 
5615  def resize(self, command, size):
5616  "Resize a bracket command to the given size."
5617  character = command.extracttext()
5618  alignment = command.command.replace('\\', '')
5619  bracket = BigBracket(size, character, alignment)
5620  command.output = ContentsOutput()
5621  command.contents = bracket.getcontents()
5622 
5623 class TodayCommand(EmptyCommand):
5624  "Shows today's date."
5625 
5626  commandmap = None
5627 
5628  def parsebit(self, pos):
5629  "Parse a command without parameters"
5630  self.output = FixedOutput()
5631  self.html = [datetime.date.today().strftime('%b %d, %Y')]
5632 
5633 
5634 FormulaCommand.types += [
5635  DecoratingFunction, CombiningFunction, LimitCommand, BracketCommand,
5636  ]
5637 
5638 FormulaProcessor.processors += [
5639  LimitsProcessor(), BracketProcessor(),
5640  ]
5641 
5642 
5643 
5644 class ParameterDefinition(object):
5645  "The definition of a parameter in a hybrid function."
5646  "[] parameters are optional, {} parameters are mandatory."
5647  "Each parameter has a one-character name, like {$1} or {$p}."
5648  "A parameter that ends in ! like {$p!} is a literal."
5649  "Example: [$1]{$p!} reads an optional parameter $1 and a literal mandatory parameter p."
5650 
5651  parambrackets = [('[', ']'), ('{', '}')]
5652 
5653  def __init__(self):
5654  self.name = None
5655  self.literal = False
5656  self.optional = False
5657  self.value = None
5658  self.literalvalue = None
5659 
5660  def parse(self, pos):
5661  "Parse a parameter definition: [$0], {$x}, {$1!}..."
5662  for (opening, closing) in ParameterDefinition.parambrackets:
5663  if pos.checkskip(opening):
5664  if opening == '[':
5665  self.optional = True
5666  if not pos.checkskip('$'):
5667  Trace.error('Wrong parameter name, did you mean $' + pos.current() + '?')
5668  return None
5669  self.name = pos.skipcurrent()
5670  if pos.checkskip('!'):
5671  self.literal = True
5672  if not pos.checkskip(closing):
5673  Trace.error('Wrong parameter closing ' + pos.skipcurrent())
5674  return None
5675  return self
5676  Trace.error('Wrong character in parameter template: ' + pos.skipcurrent())
5677  return None
5678 
5679  def read(self, pos, function):
5680  "Read the parameter itself using the definition."
5681  if self.literal:
5682  if self.optional:
5683  self.literalvalue = function.parsesquareliteral(pos)
5684  else:
5685  self.literalvalue = function.parseliteral(pos)
5686  if self.literalvalue:
5687  self.value = FormulaConstant(self.literalvalue)
5688  elif self.optional:
5689  self.value = function.parsesquare(pos)
5690  else:
5691  self.value = function.parseparameter(pos)
5692 
5693  def __unicode__(self):
5694  "Return a printable representation."
