5695  result = 'param ' + self.name
5696  if self.value:
5697  result += ': ' + unicode(self.value)
5698  else:
5699  result += ' (empty)'
5700  return result
5701 
5702 class ParameterFunction(CommandBit):
5703  "A function with a variable number of parameters defined in a template."
5704  "The parameters are defined as a parameter definition."
5705 
5706  def readparams(self, readtemplate, pos):
5707  "Read the params according to the template."
5708  self.params = dict()
5709  for paramdef in self.paramdefs(readtemplate):
5710  paramdef.read(pos, self)
5711  self.params['$' + paramdef.name] = paramdef
5712 
5713  def paramdefs(self, readtemplate):
5714  "Read each param definition in the template"
5715  pos = TextPosition(readtemplate)
5716  while not pos.finished():
5717  paramdef = ParameterDefinition().parse(pos)
5718  if paramdef:
5719  yield paramdef
5720 
5721  def getparam(self, name):
5722  "Get a parameter as parsed."
5723  if not name in self.params:
5724  return None
5725  return self.params[name]
5726 
5727  def getvalue(self, name):
5728  "Get the value of a parameter."
5729  return self.getparam(name).value
5730 
5731  def getliteralvalue(self, name):
5732  "Get the literal value of a parameter."
5733  param = self.getparam(name)
5734  if not param or not param.literalvalue:
5735  return None
5736  return param.literalvalue
5737 
5738 class HybridFunction(ParameterFunction):
5739  """
5740  A parameter function where the output is also defined using a template.
5741  The template can use a number of functions; each function has an associated
5742  tag.
5743  Example: [f0{$1},span class="fbox"] defines a function f0 which corresponds
5744  to a span of class fbox, yielding <span class="fbox">$1</span>.
5745  Literal parameters can be used in tags definitions:
5746  [f0{$1},span style="color: $p;"]
5747  yields <span style="color: $p;">$1</span>, where $p is a literal parameter.
5748  Sizes can be specified in hybridsizes, e.g. adding parameter sizes. By
5749  default the resulting size is the max of all arguments. Sizes are used
5750  to generate the right parameters.
5751  A function followed by a single / is output as a self-closing XHTML tag:
5752  [f0/,hr]
5753  will generate <hr/>.
5754  """
5755 
5756  commandmap = FormulaConfig.hybridfunctions
5757 
5758  def parsebit(self, pos):
5759  "Parse a function with [] and {} parameters"
5760  readtemplate = self.translated[0]
5761  writetemplate = self.translated[1]
5762  self.readparams(readtemplate, pos)
5763  self.contents = self.writeparams(writetemplate)
5764  self.computehybridsize()
5765 
5766  def writeparams(self, writetemplate):
5767  "Write all params according to the template"
5768  return self.writepos(TextPosition(writetemplate))
5769 
5770  def writepos(self, pos):
5771  "Write all params as read in the parse position."
5772  result = []
5773  while not pos.finished():
5774  if pos.checkskip('$'):
5775  param = self.writeparam(pos)
5776  if param:
5777  result.append(param)
5778  elif pos.checkskip('f'):
5779  function = self.writefunction(pos)
5780  if function:
5781  function.type = None
5782  result.append(function)
5783  elif pos.checkskip('('):
5784  result.append(self.writebracket('left', '('))
5785  elif pos.checkskip(')'):
5786  result.append(self.writebracket('right', ')'))
5787  else:
5788  result.append(FormulaConstant(pos.skipcurrent()))
5789  return result
5790 
5791  def writeparam(self, pos):
5792  "Write a single param of the form $0, $x..."
5793  name = '$' + pos.skipcurrent()
5794  if not name in self.params:
5795  Trace.error('Unknown parameter ' + name)
5796  return None
5797  if not self.params[name]:
5798  return None
5799  if pos.checkskip('.'):
5800  self.params[name].value.type = pos.globalpha()
5801  return self.params[name].value
5802 
5803  def writefunction(self, pos):
5804  "Write a single function f0,...,fn."
5805  tag = self.readtag(pos)
5806  if not tag:
5807  return None
5808  if pos.checkskip('/'):
5809  # self-closing XHTML tag, such as <hr/>
5810  return TaggedBit().selfcomplete(tag)
5811  if not pos.checkskip('{'):
5812  Trace.error('Function should be defined in {}')
5813  return None
5814  pos.pushending('}')
5815  contents = self.writepos(pos)
5816  pos.popending()
5817  if len(contents) == 0:
5818  return None
5819  return TaggedBit().complete(contents, tag)
5820 
5821  def readtag(self, pos):
5822  "Get the tag corresponding to the given index. Does parameter substitution."
5823  if not pos.current().isdigit():
5824  Trace.error('Function should be f0,...,f9: f' + pos.current())
5825  return None
5826  index = int(pos.skipcurrent())
5827  if 2 + index > len(self.translated):
5828  Trace.error('Function f' + unicode(index) + ' is not defined')
5829  return None
5830  tag = self.translated[2 + index]
5831  if not '$' in tag:
5832  return tag
5833  for variable in self.params:
5834  if variable in tag:
5835  param = self.params[variable]
5836  if not param.literal:
5837  Trace.error('Parameters in tag ' + tag + ' should be literal: {' + variable + '!}')
5838  continue
5839  if param.literalvalue:
5840  value = param.literalvalue
5841  else:
5842  value = ''
5843  tag = tag.replace(variable, value)
5844  return tag
5845 
5846  def writebracket(self, direction, character):
5847  "Return a new bracket looking at the given direction."
5848  return self.factory.create(BracketCommand).create(direction, character)
5849 
5850  def computehybridsize(self):
5851  "Compute the size of the hybrid function."
5852  if not self.command in HybridSize.configsizes:
5853  self.computesize()
5854  return
5855  self.size = HybridSize().getsize(self)
5856  # set the size in all elements at first level
5857  for element in self.contents:
5858  element.size = self.size
5859 
5860 class HybridSize(object):
5861  "The size associated with a hybrid function."
5862 
5863  configsizes = FormulaConfig.hybridsizes
5864 
5865  def getsize(self, function):
5866  "Read the size for a function and parse it."
5867  sizestring = self.configsizes[function.command]
5868  for name in function.params:
5869  if name in sizestring:
5870  size = function.params[name].value.computesize()
5871  sizestring = sizestring.replace(name, unicode(size))
5872  if '$' in sizestring:
5873  Trace.error('Unconverted variable in hybrid size: ' + sizestring)
5874  return 1
5875  return eval(sizestring)
5876 
5877 
5878 FormulaCommand.types += [HybridFunction]
5879 
5880 
5881 
5882 class MacroDefinition(CommandBit):
5883  "A function that defines a new command (a macro)."
5884 
5885  macros = dict()
5886 
5887  def parsebit(self, pos):
5888  "Parse the function that defines the macro."
5889  self.output = EmptyOutput()
5890  self.parameternumber = 0
5891  self.defaults = []
5892  self.factory.defining = True
5893  self.parseparameters(pos)
5894  self.factory.defining = False
5895  Trace.debug('New command ' + self.newcommand + ' (' + \
5896  unicode(self.parameternumber) + ' parameters)')
5897  self.macros[self.newcommand] = self
5898 
5899  def parseparameters(self, pos):
5900  "Parse all optional parameters (number of parameters, default values)"
5901  "and the mandatory definition."
5902  self.newcommand = self.parsenewcommand(pos)
5903  # parse number of parameters
5904  literal = self.parsesquareliteral(pos)
5905  if literal:
5906  self.parameternumber = int(literal)
5907  # parse all default values
5908  bracket = self.parsesquare(pos)
5909  while bracket:
5910  self.defaults.append(bracket)
5911  bracket = self.parsesquare(pos)
5912  # parse mandatory definition
5913  self.definition = self.parseparameter(pos)
5914 
5915  def parsenewcommand(self, pos):
5916  "Parse the name of the new command."
5917  self.factory.clearskipped(pos)
5918  if self.factory.detecttype(Bracket, pos):
5919  return self.parseliteral(pos)
5920  if self.factory.detecttype(FormulaCommand, pos):
5921  return self.factory.create(FormulaCommand).extractcommand(pos)
5922  Trace.error('Unknown formula bit in defining function at ' + pos.identifier())
5923  return 'unknown'
5924 
5925  def instantiate(self):
5926  "Return an instance of the macro."
5927  return self.definition.clone()
5928 
5929 class MacroParameter(FormulaBit):
5930  "A parameter from elyxer.a macro."
5931 
5932  def detect(self, pos):
5933  "Find a macro parameter: #n."
5934  return pos.checkfor('#')
5935 
5936  def parsebit(self, pos):
5937  "Parse the parameter: #n."
5938  if not pos.checkskip('#'):
5939  Trace.error('Missing parameter start #.')
5940  return
5941  self.number = int(pos.skipcurrent())
5942  self.original = '#' + unicode(self.number)
5943  self.contents = [TaggedBit().constant('#' + unicode(self.number), 'span class="unknown"')]
5944 
5945 class MacroFunction(CommandBit):
5946  "A function that was defined using a macro."
5947 
5948  commandmap = MacroDefinition.macros
5949 
5950  def parsebit(self, pos):
5951  "Parse a number of input parameters."
5952  self.output = FilteredOutput()
5953  self.values = []
5954  macro = self.translated
5955  self.parseparameters(pos, macro)
5956  self.completemacro(macro)
5957 
5958  def parseparameters(self, pos, macro):
5959  "Parse as many parameters as are needed."
5960  self.parseoptional(pos, list(macro.defaults))
5961  self.parsemandatory(pos, macro.parameternumber - len(macro.defaults))
5962  if len(self.values) < macro.parameternumber:
5963  Trace.error('Missing parameters in macro ' + unicode(self))
5964 
5965  def parseoptional(self, pos, defaults):
5966  "Parse optional parameters."
5967  optional = []
5968  while self.factory.detecttype(SquareBracket, pos):
5969  optional.append(self.parsesquare(pos))
5970  if len(optional) > len(defaults):
5971  break
5972  for value in optional:
5973  default = defaults.pop()
5974  if len(value.contents) > 0:
5975  self.values.append(value)
5976  else:
5977  self.values.append(default)
5978  self.values += defaults
5979 
5980  def parsemandatory(self, pos, number):
5981  "Parse a number of mandatory parameters."
5982  for index in range(number):
5983  parameter = self.parsemacroparameter(pos, number - index)
5984  if not parameter:
5985  return
5986  self.values.append(parameter)
5987 
5988  def parsemacroparameter(self, pos, remaining):
5989  "Parse a macro parameter. Could be a bracket or a single letter."
5990  "If there are just two values remaining and there is a running number,"
5991  "parse as two separater numbers."
5992  self.factory.clearskipped(pos)
5993  if pos.finished():
5994  return None
5995  if self.factory.detecttype(FormulaNumber, pos):
5996  return self.parsenumbers(pos, remaining)
5997  return self.parseparameter(pos)
5998 
5999  def parsenumbers(self, pos, remaining):
6000  "Parse the remaining parameters as a running number."
6001  "For example, 12 would be {1}{2}."
6002  number = self.factory.parsetype(FormulaNumber, pos)
6003  if not len(number.original) == remaining:
6004  return number
6005  for digit in number.original:
6006  value = self.factory.create(FormulaNumber)
6007  value.add(FormulaConstant(digit))
6008  value.type = number
6009  self.values.append(value)
6010  return None
6011 
6012  def completemacro(self, macro):
6013  "Complete the macro with the parameters read."
6014  self.contents = [macro.instantiate()]
6015  replaced = [False] * len(self.values)
6016  for parameter in self.searchall(MacroParameter):
6017  index = parameter.number - 1
6018  if index >= len(self.values):
6019  Trace.error('Macro parameter index out of bounds: ' + unicode(index))
6020  return
6021  replaced[index] = True
6022  parameter.contents = [self.values[index].clone()]
6023  for index in range(len(self.values)):
6024  if not replaced[index]:
6025  self.addfilter(index, self.values[index])
6026 
6027  def addfilter(self, index, value):
6028  "Add a filter for the given parameter number and parameter value."
6029  original = '#' + unicode(index + 1)
6030  value = ''.join(self.values[0].gethtml())
6031  self.output.addfilter(original, value)
6032 
6033 class FormulaMacro(Formula):
6034  "A math macro defined in an inset."
6035 
6036  def __init__(self):
6037  self.parser = MacroParser()
6038  self.output = EmptyOutput()
6039 
6040  def __unicode__(self):
6041  "Return a printable representation."
6042  return 'Math macro'
6043 
6044 FormulaFactory.types += [ MacroParameter ]
6045 
6046 FormulaCommand.types += [
6047  MacroFunction,
6048  ]
6049 
6050 
6051 
6052 
6053 
6054 
6055 class SideNote(Container):
6056  "A side note that appears at the right."
6057 
6058  def __init__(self):
6059  self.parser = InsetParser()
6060  self.output = TaggedOutput()
6061 
6062  def process(self):
6063  "Enclose everything in a marginal span."
6064  self.output.settag('span class="Marginal"', True)
6065 
6066 class FootnoteMarker(Container):
6067  "A marker for a footnote."
6068 
6069  def __init__(self):
6070  "Set the correct span class."
6071  self.contents = []
6072  span = 'span class="SupFootMarker"'
6073  if Options.alignfoot:
6074  span = 'span class="AlignFootMarker"'
6075  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag(span, False)
6076  mode = 'A'
6077  if Options.numberfoot:
6078  mode = '1'
6079  if Options.symbolfoot:
6080  mode = '*'
6081  NumberGenerator.generator.getcounter('Footnote').setmode(mode)
6082 
6083  def create(self):
6084  "Create the marker for a footnote."
6085  self.order = NumberGenerator.generator.generate('Footnote')
6086  if Options.endfoot:
6087  self.link = Link().complete(self.getmark(), 'footmarker-' + self.order)
6088  self.createcontents()
6089  return self
6090 
6091  def createanchor(self, marker):
6092  "Create the anchor for a footnote. Adds a link for end footnotes."
6093  self.order = marker.order
6094  if Options.endfoot:
6095  self.link = Link().complete(self.getmark(), 'footnote-' + self.order)
6096  self.link.setmutualdestination(marker.link)
6097  self.createcontents()
6098  return self
6099 
6100  def createlabel(self, marker):
6101  "Create the label for a footnote. Used in hoverfoot and marginfoot."
6102  self.order = marker.order
6103  self.contents = [Constant(self.getmark())]
6104  space = Constant(u' ')
6105  self.contents = [space] + self.contents + [space]
6106  return self
6107 
6108  def createcontents(self):
6109  "Create the contents of the marker."
6110  if Options.endfoot:
6111  self.contents = [self.link]
6112  else:
6113  self.contents = [Constant(self.getmark())]
6114  space = Constant(u' ')
6115  self.contents = [space] + self.contents + [space]
6116 
6117  def getmark(self):
6118  "Get the mark to be displayed in the marker based on the order."
6119  if Options.symbolfoot:
6120  return self.order
6121  else:
6122  return '[' + self.order + ']'
6123 
6124 class Footnote(Container):
6125  "A footnote to the main text."
6126 
6127  def __init__(self):
6128  self.parser = InsetParser()
6129  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="FootOuter"', False)
6130 
6131  def process(self):
6132  "Add a counter for the footnote."
6133  "Can be numeric or a letter depending on runtime options."
6134  marker = FootnoteMarker().create()
6135  anchor = FootnoteMarker().createanchor(marker)
6136  label = FootnoteMarker().createlabel(marker)
6137  notecontents = list(self.contents)
6138  self.contents = [marker]
6139  if Options.hoverfoot:
6140  self.contents.append(self.createnote([label] + notecontents, 'span class="HoverFoot"'))
6141  if Options.marginfoot:
6142  self.contents.append(self.createnote([label] + notecontents, 'span class="MarginFoot"'))
6143  if Options.endfoot:
6144  EndFootnotes.footnotes.append(self.createnote([anchor] + notecontents, 'div class="EndFoot"'))
6145 
6146  def createnote(self, contents, tag):
6147  "Create a note with the given contents and HTML tag."
6148  return TaggedText().complete(contents, tag, False)
6149 
6150 class EndFootnotes(Container):
6151  "The collection of footnotes at the document end."
6152 
6153  footnotes = []
6154 
6155  def __init__(self):
6156  "Generate all footnotes and a proper header for them all."
6157  self.output = ContentsOutput()
6158  header = TaggedText().constant(Translator.translate('footnotes'), 'h1 class="index"')
6159  self.contents = [header] + self.footnotes
6160 
6161 class Note(Container):
6162  "A LyX note of several types"
6163 
6164  def __init__(self):
6165  self.parser = InsetParser()
6166  self.output = EmptyOutput()
6167 
6168  def process(self):
6169  "Hide note and comment, dim greyed out"
6170  self.type = self.header[2]
6171  if TagConfig.notes[self.type] == '':
6172  return
6173  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag(TagConfig.notes[self.type], True)
6174 
6175 
6176 
6177 class LyXHeader(Container):
6178  "Reads the header, outputs the HTML header"
6179 
6180  def __init__(self):
6181  self.contents = []
6182  self.parser = HeaderParser()
6183  self.output = HeaderOutput()
6184  self.parameters = dict()
6185  self.partkey = PartKey().createheader('header')
6186 
6187  def process(self):
6188  "Find pdf title"
6189  DocumentParameters.pdftitle = self.getheaderparameter('pdftitle')
6190  documentclass = self.getheaderparameter('documentclass')
6191  if documentclass in HeaderConfig.styles['article']:
6192  DocumentParameters.startinglevel = 1
6193  if documentclass in HeaderConfig.styles['book']:
6194  DocumentParameters.bibliography = 'bibliography'
6195  else:
6196  DocumentParameters.bibliography = 'references'
6197  if self.getheaderparameter('paragraphseparation') == 'indent':
6198  DocumentParameters.indentstandard = True
6199  DocumentParameters.tocdepth = self.getlevel('tocdepth')
6200  DocumentParameters.maxdepth = self.getlevel('secnumdepth')
6201  DocumentParameters.language = self.getheaderparameter('language')
6202  if self.getheaderparameter('outputchanges') == 'true':
6203  DocumentParameters.outputchanges = True
6204  return self
6205 
6206  def getheaderparameter(self, configparam):
6207  "Get a parameter configured in HeaderConfig."
6208  key = HeaderConfig.parameters[configparam]
6209  if not key in self.parameters:
6210  return None
6211  return self.parameters[key]
6212 
6213  def getlevel(self, configparam):
6214  "Get a level read as a parameter from elyxer.HeaderConfig."
6215  paramvalue = self.getheaderparameter(configparam)
6216  if not paramvalue:
6217  return 0
6218  value = int(paramvalue)
6219  if DocumentParameters.startinglevel == 1:
6220  return value
6221  return value + 1
6222 
6223 class LyXPreamble(Container):
6224  "The preamble at the beginning of a LyX file. Parsed for macros."
6225 
6226  def __init__(self):
6227  self.parser = PreambleParser()
6228  self.output = EmptyOutput()
6229  self.factory = FormulaFactory()
6230 
6231  def process(self):
6232  "Parse the LyX preamble, if needed."
6233  if len(PreambleParser.preamble) == 0:
6234  return
6235  pos = TextPosition('\n'.join(PreambleParser.preamble))
6236  while not pos.finished():
6237  if self.detectfunction(pos):
6238  self.parsefunction(pos)
6239  else:
6240  pos.globincluding('\n')
6241  PreambleParser.preamble = []
6242 
6243  def detectfunction(self, pos):
6244  "Detect a macro definition or a preamble function."
6245  for function in FormulaConfig.misccommands:
6246  if pos.checkfor(function):
6247  return True
6248  return False
6249 
6250  def parsefunction(self, pos):
6251  "Parse a single command."
6252  self.factory.parsetype(FormulaCommand, pos)
6253 
6254 class LyXFooter(Container):
6255  "Reads the footer, outputs the HTML footer"
6256 
6257  def __init__(self):
6258  self.contents = []
6259  self.parser = BoundedDummy()
6260  self.output = FooterOutput()
6261  self.partkey = PartKey().createheader('footer')
6262 
6263  def process(self):
6264  "Include any footnotes at the end."
6265  if EndFootnotes.footnotes:
6266  endnotes = EndFootnotes()
6267  self.contents = [endnotes]
6268 
6269 
6270 
6271 class Layout(Container):
6272  "A layout (block of text) inside a lyx file"
6273 
6274  type = 'none'
6275 
6276  def __init__(self):
6277  "Initialize the layout."
6278  self.contents = []
6279  self.parser = BoundedParser()
6280  self.output = TaggedOutput().setbreaklines(True)
6281 
6282  def process(self):
6283  "Get the type and numerate if necessary."
6284  self.type = self.header[1]
6285  if self.type in TagConfig.layouts:
6286  self.output.tag = TagConfig.layouts[self.type] + ' class="' + self.type + '"'
6287  elif self.type.replace('*', '') in TagConfig.layouts:
6288  self.output.tag = TagConfig.layouts[self.type.replace('*', '')]
6289  self.output.tag += ' class="' + self.type.replace('*', '-') + '"'
6290  else:
6291  self.output.tag = 'div class="' + self.type + '"'
6292  self.numerate()
6293 
6294  def numerate(self):
6295  "Numerate if necessary."
6296  partkey = PartKeyGenerator.forlayout(self)
6297  if partkey:
6298  self.partkey = partkey
6299  self.output.tag = self.output.tag.replace('?', unicode(partkey.level))
6300 
6301  def __unicode__(self):
6302  "Return a printable representation."
6303  if self.partkey:
6304  return 'Layout ' + self.type + ' #' + unicode(self.partkey.partkey)
6305  return 'Layout of type ' + self.type
6306 
6307 class StandardLayout(Layout):
6308  "A standard layout -- can be a true div or nothing at all"
6309 
6310  indentation = False
6311 
6312  def process(self):
6313  self.type = 'standard'
6314  self.output = ContentsOutput()
6315 
6316  def complete(self, contents):
6317  "Set the contents and return it."
6318  self.process()
6319  self.contents = contents
6320  return self
6321 
6322 class Title(Layout):
6323  "The title of the whole document"
6324 
6325  def process(self):
6326  self.type = 'title'
6327  self.output.tag = 'h1 class="title"'
6328  title = self.extracttext()
6329  DocumentTitle.title = title
6330  Trace.message('Title: ' + title)
6331 
6332 class Author(Layout):
6333  "The document author"
6334 
6335  def process(self):
6336  self.type = 'author'
6337  self.output.tag = 'h2 class="author"'
6338  author = self.extracttext()
6339  Trace.debug('Author: ' + author)
6340  DocumentAuthor.appendauthor(author)
6341 
6342 class Abstract(Layout):
6343  "A paper abstract"
6344 
6345  done = False
6346 
6347  def process(self):
6348  self.type = 'abstract'
6349  self.output.tag = 'div class="abstract"'
6350  if Abstract.done:
6351  return
6352  message = Translator.translate('abstract')
6353  tagged = TaggedText().constant(message, 'p class="abstract-message"', True)
6354  self.contents.insert(0, tagged)
6355  Abstract.done = True
6356 
6357 class FirstWorder(Layout):
6358  "A layout where the first word is extracted"
6359 
6360  def extractfirstword(self):
6361  "Extract the first word as a list"
6362  return self.extractfromcontents(self.contents)
6363 
6364  def extractfromcontents(self, contents):
6365  "Extract the first word in contents."
6366  firstcontents = []
6367  while len(contents) > 0:
6368  if self.isfirstword(contents[0]):
6369  firstcontents.append(contents[0])
6370  del contents[0]
6371  return firstcontents
6372  if self.spaceincontainer(contents[0]):
6373  extracted = self.extractfromcontainer(contents[0])
6374  firstcontents.append(extracted)
6375  return firstcontents
6376  firstcontents.append(contents[0])
6377  del contents[0]
6378  return firstcontents
6379 
6380  def extractfromcontainer(self, container):
6381  "Extract the first word from a container cloning it including its output."
6382  if isinstance(container, StringContainer):
6383  return self.extractfromstring(container)
6384  result = Cloner.clone(container)
6385  result.output = container.output
6386  result.contents = self.extractfromcontents(container.contents)
6387  return result
6388 
6389  def extractfromstring(self, container):
6390  "Extract the first word from elyxer.a string container."
6391  if not ' ' in container.string:
6392  Trace.error('No space in string ' + container.string)
6393  return container
6394  split = container.string.split(' ', 1)
6395  container.string = split[1]
6396  return Constant(split[0])
6397 
6398  def spaceincontainer(self, container):
6399  "Find out if the container contains a space somewhere."
6400  return ' ' in container.extracttext()
6401 
6402  def isfirstword(self, container):
6403  "Find out if the container is valid as a first word."
6404  if not isinstance(container, FirstWord):
6405  return False
6406  return not container.isempty()
6407 
6408 class FirstWord(Container):
6409  "A container which is in itself a first word, unless it's empty."
6410  "Should be inherited by other containers, e.g. ERT."
6411 
6412  def isempty(self):
6413  "Find out if the first word is empty."
6414  Trace.error('Unimplemented isempty()')
6415  return True
6416 
6417 class Description(FirstWorder):
6418  "A description layout"
6419 
6420  def process(self):
6421  "Set the first word to bold"
6422  self.type = 'Description'
6423  self.output.tag = 'div class="Description"'
6424  firstword = self.extractfirstword()
6425  if not firstword:
6426  return
6427  tag = 'span class="Description-entry"'
6428  self.contents.insert(0, TaggedText().complete(firstword, tag))
6429  self.contents.insert(1, Constant(u' '))
6430 
6431 class List(FirstWorder):
6432  "A list layout"
6433 
6434  def process(self):
6435  "Set the first word to bold"
6436  self.type = 'List'
6437  self.output.tag = 'div class="List"'
6438  firstword = self.extractfirstword()
6439  if not firstword:
6440  return
6441  first = TaggedText().complete(firstword, 'span class="List-entry"')
6442  second = TaggedText().complete(self.contents, 'span class="List-contents"')
6443  self.contents = [first, second]
6444 
6445 class PlainLayout(Layout):
6446  "A plain layout"
6447 
6448  def process(self):
6449  "Output just as contents."
6450  self.output = ContentsOutput()
6451  self.type = 'Plain'
6452 
6453  def makevisible(self):
6454  "Make the layout visible, output as tagged text."
6455  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('div class="PlainVisible"', True)
6456 
6457 class LyXCode(Layout):
6458  "A bit of LyX-Code."
6459 
6460  def process(self):
6461  "Output as pre."
6462  self.output.tag = 'pre class="LyX-Code"'
6463  for newline in self.searchall(Newline):
6464  index = newline.parent.contents.index(newline)
6465  newline.parent.contents[index] = Constant('\n')
6466 
6467 class PostLayout(object):
6468  "Numerate an indexed layout"
6469 
6470  processedclass = Layout
6471 
6472  def postprocess(self, last, layout, next):
6473  "Group layouts and/or number them."
6474  if layout.type in TagConfig.group['layouts']:
6475  return self.group(last, layout)
6476  if layout.partkey:
6477  self.number(layout)
6478  return layout
6479 
6480  def group(self, last, layout):
6481  "Group two layouts if they are the same type."
6482  if not self.isgroupable(layout) or not self.isgroupable(last) or last.type != layout.type:
6483  return layout
6484  layout.contents = last.contents + [Constant('<br/>\n')] + layout.contents
6485  last.contents = []
6486  last.output = EmptyOutput()
6487  return layout
6488 
6489  def isgroupable(self, container):
6490  "Check that the container can be grouped."
6491  if not isinstance(container, Layout):
6492  return False
6493  for element in container.contents:
6494  if not element.__class__.__name__ in LayoutConfig.groupable['allowed']:
6495  return False
6496  return True
6497 
6498  def number(self, layout):
6499  "Generate a number and place it before the text"
6500  layout.partkey.addtoclabel(layout)
6501 
6502 class PostStandard(object):
6503  "Convert any standard spans in root to divs"
6504 
6505  processedclass = StandardLayout
6506 
6507  def postprocess(self, last, standard, next):
6508  "Switch to div, and clear if empty."
6509  type = 'Standard'
6510  if self.isempty(standard):
6511  standard.output = EmptyOutput()
6512  return standard
6513  if DocumentParameters.indentstandard:
6514  if isinstance(last, StandardLayout):
6515  type = 'Indented'
6516  else:
6517  type = 'Unindented'
6518  standard.output = TaggedOutput().settag('div class="' + type + '"', True)
6519  return standard
6520 
6521  def isempty(self, standard):
6522  "Find out if the standard layout is empty."
6523  for element in standard.contents:
6524  if not element.output.isempty():
6525  return False
6526  return True
6527 
6528 class PostPlainLayout(PostLayout):
6529  "Numerate a plain layout"
6530 
6531  processedclass = PlainLayout
6532 
6533  def postprocess(self, last, plain, next):
6534  "Group plain layouts."
6535  if not self.istext(last) or not self.istext(plain):
6536  return plain
6537  plain.makevisible()
6538  return self.group(last, plain)
6539 
6540  def istext(self, container):
6541  "Find out if the container is only text."
6542  if not isinstance(container, PlainLayout):
6543  return False
6544  extractor = ContainerExtractor(TOCConfig.extractplain)
6545  text = extractor.extract(container)
6546  return (len(text) > 0)
6547 
6548 class PostLyXCode(object):
6549  "Coalesce contiguous LyX-Code layouts."
6550 
6551  processedclass = LyXCode
6552 
6553  def postprocess(self, last, lyxcode, next):
6554  "Coalesce if last was also LyXCode"
6555  if not isinstance(last, LyXCode):
6556  return lyxcode
6557  if hasattr(last, 'first'):
6558  lyxcode.first = last.first
6559  else:
6560  lyxcode.first = last
6561  toappend = lyxcode.first.contents
6562  toappend.append(Constant('\n'))
6563  toappend += lyxcode.contents
6564  lyxcode.output = EmptyOutput()
6565  return lyxcode
6566 
6567 Postprocessor.stages += [
6568  PostLayout, PostStandard, PostLyXCode, PostPlainLayout
6569  ]
6570 
6571 
6572 
6573 class BiblioCitation(Container):
6574  "A complete bibliography citation (possibly with many cites)."
6575 
6576  citations = dict()
6577 
6578  def __init__(self):
6579  self.parser = InsetParser()
6580  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="bibcites"')
6581  self.contents = []
6582 
6583  def process(self):
6584  "Process the complete citation and all cites within."
6585  self.contents = [Constant('[')]
6586  keys = self.getparameterlist('key')
6587  for key in keys:
6588  self.contents += [BiblioCite().create(key), Constant(', ')]
6589  if len(keys) > 0:
6590  # remove trailing ,
6591  self.contents.pop()
6592  self.contents.append(Constant(']'))
6593 
6594 class BiblioCite(Link):
6595  "Cite of a bibliography entry"
6596 
6597  cites = dict()
6598 
6599  def create(self, key):
6600  "Create the cite to the given key."
6601  self.key = key
6602  number = NumberGenerator.generator.generate('bibliocite')
6603  ref = BiblioReference().create(key, number)
6604  self.complete(number, 'cite-' + number, type='bibliocite')
6605  self.setmutualdestination(ref)
6606  if not key in BiblioCite.cites:
6607  BiblioCite.cites[key] = []
6608  BiblioCite.cites[key].append(self)
6609  return self
6610 
6611 class Bibliography(Container):
6612  "A bibliography layout containing an entry"
6613 
6614  def __init__(self):
6615  self.parser = BoundedParser()
6616  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('p class="biblio"', True)
6617 
6618 class BiblioHeader(Container):
6619  "The header of the bibliography."
6620 
6621  def __init__(self):
6622  "Create the header for the bibliography section."
6623  self.type = 'biblio'
6624  self.output = ContentsOutput()
6625  self.name = Translator.translate(DocumentParameters.bibliography)
6626  self.contents = [TaggedText().constant(self.name, 'h1 class="biblio"', True)]
6627 
6628  def addtotoc(self, parent):
6629  "Add the bibliography header to the TOC."
6630  self.parent = parent
6631  self.partkey = PartKeyGenerator.forindex(self)
6632  if not self.partkey:
6633  return
6634  self.partkey.addtoclabel(self)
6635  while parent:
6636  parent.partkey = self.partkey
6637  parent = parent.parent
6638 
6639 class PostBiblio(object):
6640  "Insert a Bibliography legend before the first item"
6641 
6642  processedclass = Bibliography
6643 
6644  def postprocess(self, last, element, next):
6645  "If we have the first bibliography insert a tag"
6646  if isinstance(last, Bibliography) or Options.nobib:
6647  return element
6648  layout = StandardLayout()
6649  header = BiblioHeader()
6650  header.addtotoc(layout)
6651  layout.complete([header, element])
6652  return layout
6653 
6654 Postprocessor.stages += [PostBiblio]
6655 
6656 class BiblioReference(Link):
6657  "A reference to a bibliographical entry."
6658 
6659  references = dict()
6660 
6661  def create(self, key, number):
6662  "Create the reference with the given key and number."
6663  self.key = key
6664  self.complete(number, 'biblio-' + number, type='biblioentry')
6665  if not key in BiblioReference.references:
6666  BiblioReference.references[key] = []
6667  BiblioReference.references[key].append(self)
6668  return self
6669 
6670 class BiblioEntry(Container):
6671  "A bibliography entry"
6672 
6673  entries = dict()
6674 
6675  def __init__(self):
6676  self.parser = InsetParser()
6677  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="entry"')
6678  self.contents = []
6679 
6680  def process(self):
6681  "Process the cites for the entry's key"
6682  self.citeref = [Constant(NumberGenerator.generator.generate('biblioentry'))]
6683  self.processcites(self.getparameter('key'))
6684 
6685  def processcites(self, key):
6686  "Get all the cites of the entry"
6687  self.key = key
6688  if not key in BiblioReference.references:
6689  self.contents.append(Constant('[-] '))
6690  return
6691  self.contents = [Constant('[')]
6692  for ref in BiblioReference.references[key]:
6693  self.contents.append(ref)
6694  self.contents.append(Constant(','))
6695  self.contents.pop(-1)
6696  self.contents.append(Constant('] '))
6697 
6698 
6699 
6700 
6701 
6702 
6703 
6704 
6705 
6706 
6707 class Processor(object):
6708  "Process a container and its contents."
6709 
6710  prestages = []
6711  skipfiltered = ['LyXHeader', 'LyXFooter', 'Title', 'Author', 'TableOfContents']
6712 
6713  def __init__(self, filtering):
6714  "Set filtering mode (to skip postprocessing)."
6715  "With filtering on, the classes in skipfiltered are not processed at all."
6716  self.filtering = filtering
6717  self.postprocessor = Postprocessor()
6718 
6719  def process(self, container):
6720  "Do the whole processing on a container."
6721  if self.filtering and container.__class__.__name__ in self.skipfiltered:
6722  return None
6723  container = self.preprocess(container)
6724  self.processcontainer(container)
6725  if not container:
6726  # do not postprocess empty containers from elyxer.here
6727  return container
6728  return self.postprocess(container)
6729 
6730  def preprocess(self, root):
6731  "Preprocess a root container with all prestages."
6732  if not root:
6733  return None
6734  for stage in self.prestages:
6735  root = stage.preprocess(root)
6736  if not root:
6737  return None
6738  return root
6739 
6740  def processcontainer(self, container):
6741  "Process a container and its contents, recursively."
6742  if not container:
6743  return
6744  for element in container.contents:
6745  self.processcontainer(element)
6746  container.process()
6747 
6748  def postprocess(self, container):
6749  "Postprocess a container, unless filtering is on."
6750  if self.filtering:
6751  return container
6752  return self.postprocessor.postprocess(container)
6753 
6754 
6755 
6756 class ListInset(Container):
6757  "An inset with a list, normally made of links."
6758 
6759  def __init__(self):
6760  self.parser = InsetParser()
6761  self.output = ContentsOutput()
6762 
6763  def sortdictionary(self, dictionary):
6764  "Sort all entries in the dictionary"
6765  keys = dictionary.keys()
6766  # sort by name
6767  keys.sort()
6768  return keys
6769 
6770  sortdictionary = classmethod(sortdictionary)
6771 
6772 class ListOf(ListInset):
6773  "A list of entities (figures, tables, algorithms)"
6774 
6775  def process(self):
6776  "Parse the header and get the type"
6777  self.type = self.header[2]
6778  text = Translator.translate('list-' + self.type)
6779  self.contents = [TaggedText().constant(text, 'div class="tocheader"', True)]
6780 
6781 class TableOfContents(ListInset):
6782  "Table of contents"
6783 
6784  def process(self):
6785  "Parse the header and get the type"
6786  self.create(Translator.translate('toc'))
6787 
6788  def create(self, heading):
6789  "Create a table of contents with the given heading text."
6790  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('div class="fulltoc"', True)
6791  self.contents = [TaggedText().constant(heading, 'div class="tocheader"', True)]
6792  return self
6793 
6794  def add(self, entry):
6795  "Add a new entry to the TOC."
6796  if entry:
6797  self.contents.append(entry)
6798 
6799 class IndexReference(Link):
6800  "A reference to an entry in the alphabetical index."
6801 
6802  name = 'none'
6803 
6804  def process(self):
6805  "Put entry in index"
6806  name = self.getparameter('name')
6807  if name:
6808  self.name = name.strip()
6809  else:
6810  self.name = self.extracttext()
6811  IndexEntry.get(self.name).addref(self)
6812 
6813  def __unicode__(self):
6814  "Return a printable representation."
6815  return 'Reference to ' + self.name
6816 
6817 class IndexHeader(Link):
6818  "The header line for an index entry. Keeps all arrows."
6819 
6820  keyescapes = {'!':'', '|':'-', ' ':'-', '--':'-', ',':'', '\\':'', '@':'_', u'°':''}
6821 
6822  def create(self, names):
6823  "Create the header for the given index entry."
6824  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('p class="printindex"', True)
6825  self.name = names[-1]
6826  keys = [self.escape(part, self.keyescapes) for part in names]
6827  self.key = '-'.join(keys)
6828  self.anchor = Link().complete('', 'index-' + self.key, None, 'printindex')
6829  self.contents = [self.anchor, Constant(self.name + ': ')]
6830  self.arrows = []
6831  return self
6832 
6833  def addref(self, reference):
6834  "Create an arrow pointing to a reference."
6835  reference.index = unicode(len(self.arrows))
6836  reference.destination = self.anchor
6837  reference.complete(u'↓', 'entry-' + self.key + '-' + reference.index)
6838  arrow = Link().complete(u'↑', type = 'IndexArrow')
6839  arrow.destination = reference
6840  if len(self.arrows) > 0:
6841  self.contents.append(Constant(u', '))
6842  self.arrows.append(arrow)
6843  self.contents.append(arrow)
6844 
6845  def __unicode__(self):
6846  "Return a printable representation."
6847  return 'Index header for ' + self.name
6848 
6849 class IndexGroup(Container):
6850  "A group of entries in the alphabetical index, for an entry."
6851 
6852  root = None
6853 
6854  def create(self):
6855  "Create an index group."
6856  self.entries = dict()
6857  self.output = EmptyOutput()
6858  return self
6859 
6860  def findentry(self, names):
6861  "Find the entry with the given names."
6862  if self == IndexGroup.root:
6863  self.output = ContentsOutput()
6864  else:
6865  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('div class="indexgroup"', True)
6866  lastname = names[-1]
6867  if not lastname in self.entries:
6868  self.entries[lastname] = IndexEntry().create(names)
6869  return self.entries[lastname]
6870 
6871  def sort(self):
6872  "Sort all entries in the group."
6873  for key in ListInset.sortdictionary(self.entries):
6874  entry = self.entries[key]
6875  entry.group.sort()
6876  self.contents.append(entry)
6877 
6878  def __unicode__(self):
6879  "Return a printable representation."
6880  return 'Index group'
6881 
6882 IndexGroup.root = IndexGroup().create()
6883 
6884 class IndexEntry(Container):
6885  "An entry in the alphabetical index."
6886  "When an index entry is of the form 'part1 ! part2 ...', "
6887  "a hierarchical structure in the form of an IndexGroup is constructed."
6888  "An index entry contains a mandatory header, and an optional group."
6889 
6890  def create(self, names):
6891  "Create an index entry with the given name."
6892  self.output = ContentsOutput()
6893  self.header = IndexHeader().create(names)
6894  self.group = IndexGroup().create()
6895  self.contents = [self.header, self.group]
6896  return self
6897 
6898  def addref(self, reference):
6899  "Add a reference to the entry."
6900  self.header.addref(reference)
6901 
6902  def get(cls, name):
6903  "Get the index entry for the given name."
6904  group = IndexGroup.root
6905  parts = IndexEntry.splitname(name)
6906  readparts = []
6907  for part in parts:
6908  readparts.append(part)
6909  entry = group.findentry(readparts)
6910  group = entry.group
6911  return entry
6912 
6913  def splitname(cls, name):
6914  "Split a name in parts divided by !."
6915  return [part.strip() for part in name.split('!')]
6916 
6917  def __unicode__(self):
6918  "Return a printable representation."
6919  return 'Index entry for ' + self.header.name
6920 
6921  get = classmethod(get)
6922  splitname = classmethod(splitname)
6923 
6924 class PrintIndex(ListInset):
6925  "Command to print an index"
6926 
6927  def process(self):
6928  "Create the alphabetic index"
6929  self.name = Translator.translate('index')
6930  self.partkey = PartKeyGenerator.forindex(self)
6931  if not self.partkey:
6932  return
6933  self.contents = [TaggedText().constant(self.name, 'h1 class="index"')]
6934  self.partkey.addtoclabel(self)
6935  IndexGroup.root.sort()
6936  self.contents.append(IndexGroup.root)
6937 
6938 class NomenclatureEntry(Link):
6939  "An entry of LyX nomenclature"
6940 
6941  entries = dict()
6942 
6943  def process(self):
6944  "Put entry in index"
6945  symbol = self.getparameter('symbol')
6946  description = self.getparameter('description')
6947  key = symbol.replace(' ', '-').lower()
6948  if key in NomenclatureEntry.entries:
6949  Trace.error('Duplicated nomenclature entry ' + key)
6950  self.complete(u'↓', 'noment-' + key)
6951  entry = Link().complete(u'↑', 'nom-' + key)
6952  entry.symbol = symbol
6953  entry.description = description
6954  self.setmutualdestination(entry)
6955  NomenclatureEntry.entries[key] = entry
6956 
6957 class PrintNomenclature(ListInset):
6958  "Print all nomenclature entries"
6959 
6960  def process(self):
6961  "Create the nomenclature."
6962  self.name = Translator.translate('nomenclature')
6963  self.partkey = PartKeyGenerator.forindex(self)
6964  if not self.partkey:
6965  return
6966  self.contents = [TaggedText().constant(self.name, 'h1 class="nomenclature"')]
6967  self.partkey.addtoclabel(self)
6968  for key in self.sortdictionary(NomenclatureEntry.entries):
6969  entry = NomenclatureEntry.entries[key]
6970  contents = [entry, Constant(entry.symbol + u' ' + entry.description)]
6971  text = TaggedText().complete(contents, 'div class="Nomenclated"', True)
6972  self.contents.append(text)
6973 
6974 class PreListInset(object):
6975  "Preprocess any container that contains a list inset."
6976 
6977  def preprocess(self, container):
6978  "Preprocess a container, extract any list inset and return it."
6979  listinsets = container.searchall(ListInset)
6980  if len(listinsets) == 0:
6981  return container
6982  if len(container.contents) > 1:
6983  return container
6984  return listinsets[0]
6985 
6986 Processor.prestages += [PreListInset()]
6987 
6988 
6989 
6990 
6991 
6992 
6993 
6994 
6995 
6996 class TableParser(BoundedParser):
6997  "Parse the whole table"
6998 
6999  headers = ContainerConfig.table['headers']
7000 
7001  def __init__(self):
7002  BoundedParser.__init__(self)
7003  self.columns = list()
7004 
7005  def parseheader(self, reader):
7006  "Parse table headers"
7007  reader.nextline()
7008  while self.startswithheader(reader):
7009  self.parseparameter(reader)
7010  return []
7011 
7012  def startswithheader(self, reader):
7013  "Check if the current line starts with a header line"
7014  for start in TableParser.headers:
7015  if reader.currentline().strip().startswith(start):
7016  return True
7017  return False
7018 
7019 class TablePartParser(BoundedParser):
7020  "Parse a table part (row or cell)"
7021 
7022  def parseheader(self, reader):
7023  "Parse the header"
7024  tablekey, parameters = self.parsexml(reader)
7025  self.parameters = parameters
7026  return list()
7027 
7028 class ColumnParser(LoneCommand):
7029  "Parse column properties"
7030 
7031  def parseheader(self, reader):
7032  "Parse the column definition"
7033  key, parameters = self.parsexml(reader)
7034  self.parameters = parameters
7035  return []
7036 
7037 
7038 
7039 class Table(Container):
7040  "A lyx table"
7041 
7042  def __init__(self):
7043  self.parser = TableParser()
7044  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('table', True)
7045  self.columns = []
7046 
7047  def process(self):
7048  "Set the columns on every row"
7049  index = 0
7050  while index < len(self.contents):
7051  element = self.contents[index]
7052  if isinstance(element, Column):
7053  self.columns.append(element)
7054  del self.contents[index]
7055  elif isinstance(element, BlackBox):
7056  del self.contents[index]
7057  elif isinstance(element, Row):
7058  element.setcolumns(self.columns)
7059  index += 1
7060  else:
7061  Trace.error('Unknown element type ' + element.__class__.__name__ +
7062  ' in table: ' + unicode(element.contents[0]))
7063  index += 1
7064 
7065 class Row(Container):
7066  "A row in a table"
7067 
7068  def __init__(self):
7069  self.parser = TablePartParser()
7070  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('tr', True)
7071  self.columns = list()
7072 
7073  def setcolumns(self, columns):
7074  "Process alignments for every column"
7075  if len(columns) != len(self.contents):
7076  Trace.error('Columns: ' + unicode(len(columns)) + ', cells: ' + unicode(len(self.contents)))
7077  return
7078  for index, cell in enumerate(self.contents):
7079  columns[index].set(cell)
7080 
7081 class Column(Container):
7082  "A column definition in a table"
7083 
7084  def __init__(self):
7085  self.parser = ColumnParser()
7086  self.output = EmptyOutput()
7087 
7088  def process(self):
7089  "Read size parameters if present."
7090  self.size = ContainerSize().readparameters(self)
7091 
7092  def set(self, cell):
7093  "Set alignments in the corresponding cell"
7094  alignment = self.getparameter('alignment')
7095  if alignment == 'block':
7096  alignment = 'justify'
7097  cell.setattribute('align', alignment)
7098  valignment = self.getparameter('valignment')
7099  cell.setattribute('valign', valignment)
7100  self.size.addstyle(cell)
7101 
7102 class Cell(Container):
7103  "A cell in a table"
7104 
7105  def __init__(self):
7106  self.parser = TablePartParser()
7107  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('td', True)
7108 
7109  def setmulticolumn(self, span):
7110  "Set the cell as multicolumn"
7111  self.setattribute('colspan', span)
7112 
7113  def setattribute(self, attribute, value):
7114  "Set a cell attribute in the tag"
7115  self.output.tag += ' ' + attribute + '="' + unicode(value) + '"'
7116 
7117 class PostTable(object):
7118  "Postprocess a table"
7119 
7120  processedclass = Table
7121 
7122  def postprocess(self, last, table, next):
7123  "Postprocess a table: long table, multicolumn rows"
7124  self.longtable(table)
7125  for row in table.contents:
7126  index = 0
7127  while index < len(row.contents):
7128  self.checkforplain(row, index)
7129  self.checkmulticolumn(row, index)
7130  index += 1
7131  return table
7132 
7133  def longtable(self, table):
7134  "Postprocess a long table, removing unwanted rows"
7135  features = table.getparameter('features')
7136  if not features:
7137  return
7138  if not 'islongtable' in features:
7139  return
7140  if features['islongtable'] != 'true':
7141  return
7142  if self.hasrow(table, 'endfirsthead'):
7143  self.removerows(table, 'endhead')
7144  if self.hasrow(table, 'endlastfoot'):
7145  self.removerows(table, 'endfoot')
7146 
7147  def hasrow(self, table, attrname):
7148  "Find out if the table has a row of first heads"
7149  for row in table.contents:
7150  if row.getparameter(attrname):
7151  return True
7152  return False
7153 
7154  def removerows(self, table, attrname):
7155  "Remove the head rows, since the table has first head rows."
7156  for row in table.contents:
7157  if row.getparameter(attrname):
7158  row.output = EmptyOutput()
7159 
7160  def checkforplain(self, row, index):
7161  "Make plain layouts visible if necessary."
7162  cell = row.contents[index]
7163  plainlayouts = cell.searchall(PlainLayout)
7164  if len(plainlayouts) <= 1:
7165  return
7166  for plain in plainlayouts:
7167  plain.makevisible()
7168 
7169  def checkmulticolumn(self, row, index):
7170  "Process a multicolumn attribute"
7171  cell = row.contents[index]
7172  mc = cell.getparameter('multicolumn')
7173  if not mc:
7174  return
7175  if mc != '1':
7176  Trace.error('Unprocessed multicolumn=' + unicode(multicolumn) +
7177  ' cell ' + unicode(cell))
7178  return
7179  total = 1
7180  index += 1
7181  while self.checkbounds(row, index):
7182  del row.contents[index]
7183  total += 1
7184  cell.setmulticolumn(total)
7185 
7186  def checkbounds(self, row, index):
7187  "Check if the index is within bounds for the row"
7188  if index >= len(row.contents):
7189  return False
7190  mc = row.contents[index].getparameter('multicolumn')
7191  if mc != '2':
7192  return False
7193  return True
7194 
7195 Postprocessor.stages.append(PostTable)
7196 
7197 
7198 
7199 
7200 import struct
7201 import sys
7202 import os
7203 import shutil
7204 
7205 
7206 
7207 import os
7208 import os.path
7209 import codecs
7210 
7211 
7212 class Path(object):
7213  "Represents a generic path"
7214 
7215  def exists(self):
7216  "Check if the file exists"
7217  return os.path.exists(self.path)
7218 
7219  def open(self):
7220  "Open the file as readonly binary"
7221  return codecs.open(self.path, 'rb')
7222 
7223  def getmtime(self):
7224  "Return last modification time"
7225  return os.path.getmtime(self.path)
7226 
7227  def hasexts(self, exts):
7228  "Check if the file has one of the given extensions."
7229  for ext in exts:
7230  if self.hasext(ext):
7231  return True
7232  return False
7233 
7234  def hasext(self, ext):
7235  "Check if the file has the given extension"
7236  return self.getext() == ext
7237 
7238  def getext(self):
7239  "Get the current extension of the file."
7240  base, ext = os.path.splitext(self.path)
7241  return ext
7242 
7243  def __unicode__(self):
7244  "Return a unicode string representation"
7245  return self.path
7246 
7247  def __eq__(self, path):
7248  "Compare to another path"
7249  if not hasattr(path, 'path'):
7250  return False
7251  return self.path == path.path
7252 
7253 class InputPath(Path):
7254  "Represents an input file"
7255 
7256  def __init__(self, url):
7257  "Create the input path based on url"
7258  self.url = url
7259  self.path = url
7260  if not os.path.isabs(url):
7261  self.path = os.path.join(Options.directory, url)
7262 
7263 class OutputPath(Path):
7264  "Represents an output file"
7265 
7266  def __init__(self, inputpath):
7267  "Create the output path based on an input path"
7268  self.url = inputpath.url
7269  if os.path.isabs(self.url):
7270  self.url = os.path.basename(self.url)
7271  self.path = os.path.join(Options.destdirectory, self.url)
7272 
7273  def changeext(self, ext):
7274  "Change extension to the given one"
7275  base, oldext = os.path.splitext(self.path)
7276  self.path = base + ext
7277  base, oldext = os.path.splitext(self.url)
7278  self.url = base + ext
7279 
7280  def exists(self):
7281  "Check if the file exists"
7282  return os.path.exists(self.path)
7283 
7284  def createdirs(self):
7285  "Create any intermediate directories that don't exist"
7286  dir = os.path.dirname(self.path)
7287  if len(dir) > 0 and not os.path.exists(dir):
7288  os.makedirs(dir)
7289 
7290  def removebackdirs(self):
7291  "Remove any occurrences of ../ (or ..\ on Windows)"
7292  self.path = os.path.normpath(self.path)
7293  backdir = '..' + os.path.sep
7294  while self.path.startswith(backdir):
7295  self.path = self.path[len(backdir):]
7296  while self.url.startswith('../'):
7297  self.url = self.url[len('../'):]
7298 
7299 
7300 
7301 class Image(Container):
7302  "An embedded image"
7303 
7304  defaultformat = ImageConfig.formats['default']
7305  size = None
7306  copy = None
7307 
7308  def __init__(self):
7309  self.parser = InsetParser()
7310  self.output = TaggedOutput()
7311  self.type = 'embedded'
7312 
7313  def process(self):
7314  "Place the url, convert the image if necessary."
7315  self.origin = InputPath(self.getparameter('filename'))
7316  self.destination = self.getdestination(self.origin)
7317  self.size = ContainerSize().readparameters(self)
7318  if self.origin.exists():
7319  ImageConverter.instance.convert(self)
7320  else:
7321  Trace.error('Image ' + unicode(self.origin) + ' not found')
7322  self.setsize()
7323  self.settag()
7324 
7325  def getdestination(self, origin):
7326  "Convert origin path to destination path."
7327  "Changes extension of destination to output image format."
7328  destination = OutputPath(origin)
7329  if Options.noconvert:
7330  return destination
7331  self.convertformat(destination)
7332  destination.removebackdirs()
7333  return destination
7334 
7335  def convertformat(self, destination):
7336  "Convert the format of the destination image."
7337  if Options.copyimages:
7338  return
7339  imageformat = '.jpg'
7340  forcedest = Image.defaultformat
7341  if Options.imageformat:
7342  imageformat = Options.imageformat
7343  forcedest = Options.imageformat
7344  if not destination.hasext(imageformat):
7345  destination.changeext(forcedest)
7346 
7347  def setsize(self):
7348  "Set the size attributes width and height."
7349  width, height = ImageFile(self.destination).getdimensions()
7350  self.size.checkimage(width, height)
7351 
7352  def scalevalue(self, value):
7353  "Scale the value according to the image scale and return it as unicode."
7354  scaled = value * int(self.size.scale) / 100
7355  return unicode(int(scaled)) + 'px'
7356 
7357  def settag(self):
7358  "Set the output tag for the image."
7359  tag = 'img class="' + self.type + '"'
7360  if self.origin.exists():
7361  url = self.destination.url
7362  else:
7363  url = self.origin.url
7364  alt = Translator.translate('figure') + ' ' + url
7365  tag += ' src="' + url + '" alt="' + alt + '"'
7366  emptytag = True
7367  if self.destination.hasext('.svg'):
7368  self.contents = [Constant(alt)]
7369  tag = 'object class="' + self.type + '" data="' + url + '"'
7370  emptytag = False
7371  self.output.settag(tag, True, empty=emptytag)
7372  self.size.addstyle(self)
7373 
7374 class ImageConverter(object):
7375  "A converter from elyxer.one image file to another."
7376 
7377  vectorformats = ImageConfig.formats['vector']
7378  cropboxformats = ImageConfig.cropboxformats
7379 
7380  active = True
7381  instance = None
7382 
7383  def convert(self, image):
7384  "Convert an image to PNG"
7385  if not ImageConverter.active or Options.noconvert:
7386  return
7387  if image.origin.path == image.destination.path:
7388  return
7389  if image.destination.exists():
7390  if image.origin.getmtime() <= image.destination.getmtime():
7391  # file has not changed; do not convert
7392  return
7393  image.destination.createdirs()
7394  if Options.copyimages:
7395  Trace.debug('Copying ' + image.origin.path + ' to ' + image.destination.path)
7396  shutil.copy2(image.origin.path, image.destination.path)
7397  return
7398  converter, command = self.buildcommand(image)
7399  try:
7400  Trace.debug(converter + ' command: "' + command + '"')
7401  result = os.system(command.encode(sys.getfilesystemencoding()))
7402  if result != 0:
7403  Trace.error(converter + ' not installed; images will not be processed')
7404  ImageConverter.active = False
7405  return
7406  Trace.message('Converted ' + unicode(image.origin) + ' to ' +
7407  unicode(image.destination))
7408  except OSError, exception:
7409  Trace.error('Error while converting image ' + unicode(image.origin)
7410  + ': ' + unicode(exception))
7411 
7412  def buildcommand(self, image):
7413  "Build the command to convert the image."
7414  if Options.converter in ImageConfig.converters:
7415  command = ImageConfig.converters[Options.converter]
7416  else:
7417  command = Options.converter;
7418  params = self.getparams(image)
7419  for param in params:
7420  command = command.replace('$' + param, unicode(params[param]))
7421  # remove unwanted options
7422  while '[' in command and ']' in command:
7423  command = self.removeparam(command)
7424  return Options.converter, command
7425 
7426  def removeparam(self, command):
7427  "Remove an unwanted param."
7428  if command.index('[') > command.index(']'):
7429  Trace.error('Converter command should be [...$...]: ' + command)
7430  exit()
7431  before = command[:command.index('[')]
7432  after = command[command.index(']') + 1:]
7433  between = command[command.index('[') + 1:command.index(']')]
7434  if '$' in between:
7435  return before + after
7436  return before + between + after
7437 
7438  def getparams(self, image):
7439  "Get the parameters for ImageMagick conversion"
7440  params = dict()
7441  params['input'] = image.origin
7442  params['output'] = image.destination
7443  if image.origin.hasexts(self.vectorformats):
7444  scale = 100
7445  if image.size.scale:
7446  scale = image.size.scale
7447  # descale
7448  image.size.scale = None
7449  params['scale'] = scale
7450  if image.origin.getext() in self.cropboxformats:
7451  params['format'] = self.cropboxformats[image.origin.getext()]
7452  return params
7453 
7454 ImageConverter.instance = ImageConverter()
7455 
7456 class ImageFile(object):
7457  "A file corresponding to an image (JPG or PNG)"
7458 
7459  dimensions = dict()
7460 
7461  def __init__(self, path):
7462  "Create the file based on its path"
7463  self.path = path
7464 
7465  def getdimensions(self):
7466  "Get the dimensions of a JPG or PNG image"
7467  if not self.path.exists():
7468  return None, None
7469  if unicode(self.path) in ImageFile.dimensions:
7470  return ImageFile.dimensions[unicode(self.path)]
7471  dimensions = (None, None)
7472  if self.path.hasext('.png'):
7473  dimensions = self.getpngdimensions()
7474  elif self.path.hasext('.jpg'):
7475  dimensions = self.getjpgdimensions()
7476  elif self.path.hasext('.svg'):
7477  dimensions = self.getsvgdimensions()
7478  ImageFile.dimensions[unicode(self.path)] = dimensions
7479  return dimensions
7480 
7481  def getpngdimensions(self):
7482  "Get the dimensions of a PNG image"
7483  pngfile = self.path.open()
7484  pngfile.seek(16)
7485  width = self.readlong(pngfile)
7486  height = self.readlong(pngfile)
7487  pngfile.close()
7488  return (width, height)
7489 
7490  def getjpgdimensions(self):
7491  "Get the dimensions of a JPEG image"
7492  jpgfile = self.path.open()
7493  start = self.readword(jpgfile)
7494  if start != int('ffd8', 16):
7495  Trace.error(unicode(self.path) + ' not a JPEG file')
7496  return (None, None)
7497  self.skipheaders(jpgfile, ['ffc0', 'ffc2'])
7498  self.seek(jpgfile, 3)
7499  height = self.readword(jpgfile)
7500  width = self.readword(jpgfile)
7501  jpgfile.close()
7502  return (width, height)
7503 
7504  def getsvgdimensions(self):
7505  "Get the dimensions of a SVG image."
7506  return (None, None)
7507 
7508  def skipheaders(self, file, hexvalues):
7509  "Skip JPEG headers until one of the parameter headers is found"
7510  headervalues = [int(value, 16) for value in hexvalues]
7511  header = self.readword(file)
7512  safetycounter = 0
7513  while header not in headervalues and safetycounter < 30:
7514  length = self.readword(file)
7515  if length == 0:
7516  Trace.error('End of file ' + file.name)
7517  return
7518  self.seek(file, length - 2)
7519  header = self.readword(file)
7520  safetycounter += 1
7521 
7522  def readlong(self, file):
7523  "Read a long (32-bit) value from elyxer.file"
7524  return self.readformat(file, '>L', 4)
7525 
7526  def readword(self, file):
7527  "Read a 16-bit value from elyxer.file"
7528  return self.readformat(file, '>H', 2)
7529 
7530  def readformat(self, file, format, bytes):
7531  "Read any format from elyxer.file"
7532  read = file.read(bytes)
7533  if read == '' or len(read) < bytes:
7534  Trace.error('EOF reached')
7535  return 0
7536  tuple = struct.unpack(format, read)
7537  return tuple[0]
7538 
7539  def seek(self, file, bytes):
7540  "Seek forward, just by reading the given number of bytes"
7541  file.read(bytes)
7542 
7543 
7544 
7545 
7546 
7547 
7548 class ListItem(Container):
7549  "An element in a list"
7550 
7551  type = 'none'
7552 
7553  def __init__(self):
7554  "Create a list item."
7555  self.parser = BoundedParser()
7556  self.output = ContentsOutput()
7557 
7558  def process(self):
7559  "Set the correct type and contents."
7560  self.type = self.header[1]
7561  tag = TaggedText().complete(self.contents, 'li', True)
7562  self.contents = [tag]
7563 
7564  def __unicode__(self):
7565  return self.type + ' item @ ' + unicode(self.begin)
7566 
7567 class DeeperList(Container):
7568  "A nested list"
7569 
7570  def __init__(self):
7571  "Create a nested list element."
7572  self.parser = BoundedParser()
7573  self.output = ContentsOutput()
7574  self.contents = []
7575 
7576  def process(self):
7577  "Create the deeper list"
7578  if len(self.contents) == 0:
7579  Trace.error('Empty deeper list')
7580  return
7581 
7582  def __unicode__(self):
7583  result = 'deeper list @ ' + unicode(self.begin) + ': ['
7584  for element in self.contents:
7585  result += unicode(element) + ', '
7586  return result[:-2] + ']'
7587 
7588 class PendingList(object):
7589  "A pending list"
7590 
7591  def __init__(self):
7592  self.contents = []
7593  self.type = None
7594 
7595  def additem(self, item):
7596  "Add a list item"
7597  self.contents += item.contents
7598  if not self.type:
7599  self.type = item.type
7600 
7601  def adddeeper(self, deeper):
7602  "Add a deeper list item"
7603  if self.empty():
7604  self.insertfake()
7605  self.contents[-1].contents += deeper.contents
7606 
7607  def generate(self):
7608  "Get the resulting list"
7609  if not self.type:
7610  tag = 'ul'
7611  else:
7612  tag = TagConfig.listitems[self.type]
7613  text = TaggedText().complete(self.contents, tag, True)
7614  self.__init__()
7615  return text
7616 
7617  def isduewithitem(self, item):
7618  "Decide whether the pending list must be generated before the given item"
7619  if not self.type:
7620  return False
7621  if self.type != item.type:
7622  return True
7623  return False
7624 
7625  def isduewithnext(self, next):
7626  "Applies only if the list is finished with next item."
7627  if not next:
7628  return True
7629  if not isinstance(next, ListItem) and not isinstance(next, DeeperList):
7630  return True
7631  return False
7632 
7633  def empty(self):
7634  return len(self.contents) == 0
7635 
7636  def insertfake(self):
7637  "Insert a fake item"
7638  item = TaggedText().constant('', 'li class="nested"', True)
7639  self.contents = [item]
7640  self.type = 'Itemize'
7641 
7642  def __unicode__(self):
7643  result = 'pending ' + unicode(self.type) + ': ['
7644  for element in self.contents:
7645  result += unicode(element) + ', '
7646  if len(self.contents) > 0:
7647  result = result[:-2]
7648  return result + ']'
7649 
7650 class PostListItem(object):
7651  "Postprocess a list item"
7652 
7653  processedclass = ListItem
7654 
7655  def postprocess(self, last, item, next):
7656  "Add the item to pending and return an empty item"
7657  if not hasattr(self.postprocessor, 'list'):
7658  self.postprocessor.list = PendingList()
7659  self.postprocessor.list.additem(item)
7660  if self.postprocessor.list.isduewithnext(next):
7661  return self.postprocessor.list.generate()
7662  if isinstance(next, ListItem) and self.postprocessor.list.isduewithitem(next):
7663  return self.postprocessor.list.generate()
7664  return BlackBox()
7665 
7666 class PostDeeperList(object):
7667  "Postprocess a deeper list"
7668 
7669  processedclass = DeeperList
7670 
7671  def postprocess(self, last, deeper, next):
7672  "Append to the list in the postprocessor"
7673  if not hasattr(self.postprocessor, 'list'):
7674  self.postprocessor.list = PendingList()
7675  self.postprocessor.list.adddeeper(deeper)
7676  if self.postprocessor.list.isduewithnext(next):
7677  return self.postprocessor.list.generate()
7678  return BlackBox()
7679 
7680 Postprocessor.stages += [PostListItem, PostDeeperList]
7681 
7682 
7683 
7684 
7685 
7686 
7687 
7688 
7689 
7690 class Float(Container):
7691  "A floating inset"
7692 
7693  type = 'none'
7694 
7695  def __init__(self):
7696  self.parser = InsetParser()
7697  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('div class="float"', True)
7698 
7699  def process(self):
7700  "Get the float type."
7701  self.type = self.header[2]
7702  self.processnumber()
7703  self.processfloats()
7704  self.processtags()
7705 
7706  def isparent(self):
7707  "Find out whether the float is the parent float or is contained in another float."
7708  current = self.parent
7709  while current:
7710  if isinstance(current, Float):
7711  return False
7712  current = current.parent
7713  return True
7714 
7715  def processnumber(self):
7716  "Number a float if it isn't numbered."
7717  if not self.isparent():
7718  # do nothing; parent will take care of numbering
7719  return
7720  self.partkey = PartKey().createfloat(self)
7721 
7722  def processtags(self):
7723  "Process the HTML tags."
7724  tagged = self.embed()
7725  self.applywideningtag(tagged)
7726 
7727  def embed(self):
7728  "Embed the whole contents in a div."
7729  embeddedtag = self.getembeddedtag()
7730  tagged = TaggedText().complete(self.contents, embeddedtag, True)
7731  self.contents = [tagged]
7732  return tagged
7733 
7734  def processfloats(self):
7735  "Process all floats contained inside."
7736  floats = self.searchall(Float)
7737  counter = NumberCounter('subfloat').setmode('a')
7738  for subfloat in floats:
7739  subfloat.output.tag = subfloat.output.tag.replace('div', 'span')
7740  subfloat.partkey = PartKey().createsubfloat(counter.getnext())
7741 
7742  def getembeddedtag(self):
7743  "Get the tag for the embedded object."
7744  floats = self.searchall(Float)
7745  if len(floats) > 0:
7746  return 'div class="multi' + self.type + '"'
7747  return 'div class="' + self.type + '"'
7748 
7749  def applywideningtag(self, container):
7750  "Apply the tag to set float width, if present."
7751  images = self.searchall(Image)
7752  if len(images) != 1:
7753  return ''
7754  image = images[0]
7755  if not image.size:
7756  return
7757  width = image.size.removepercentwidth()
7758  if not width:
7759  return
7760  image.type = 'figure'
7761  ContainerSize().setmax(width).addstyle(container)
7762  image.settag()
7763 
7764  def searchinside(self, type):
7765  "Search for a given type in the contents"
7766  return self.searchincontents(self.contents, type)
7767 
7768  def searchincontents(self, contents, type):
7769  "Search in the given contents for the required type."
7770  list = []
7771  for element in contents:
7772  list += self.searchinelement(element, type)
7773  return list
7774 
7775  def searchinelement(self, element, type):
7776  "Search for a given type outside floats"
7777  if isinstance(element, Float):
7778  return []
7779  if isinstance(element, type):
7780  return [element]
7781  return self.searchincontents(element.contents, type)
7782 
7783  def __unicode__(self):
7784  "Return a printable representation"
7785  return 'Floating inset of type ' + self.type
7786 
7787 class Wrap(Float):
7788  "A wrapped (floating) float"
7789 
7790  def processtags(self):
7791  "Add the widening tag to the parent tag."
7792  self.embed()
7793  placement = self.getparameter('placement')
7794  if not placement:
7795  placement = 'o'
7796  self.output.tag = 'div class="wrap-' + placement + '"'
7797  self.applywideningtag(self)
7798 
7799 class Listing(Container):
7800  "A code listing"
7801 
7802  processor = None
7803 
7804  def __init__(self):
7805  self.parser = InsetParser()
7806  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('div class="listing"', True)
7807  self.numbered = None
7808 
7809  def process(self):
7810  "Remove all layouts"
7811  self.counter = 0
7812  self.type = 'listing'
7813  self.processparams()
7814  if Listing.processor:
7815  Listing.processor.preprocess(self)
7816  for container in self.extractcontents():
7817  if container:
7818  self.contents.append(container)
7819  if 'caption' in self.lstparams:
7820  text = self.lstparams['caption'][1:-1]
7821  self.contents.insert(0, Caption().create(text))
7822  if Listing.processor:
7823  Listing.processor.postprocess(self)
7824 
7825  def extractcontents(self):
7826  "Extract all contents one container at a time."
7827  oldcontents = self.contents
7828  self.contents = []
7829  inpre = []
7830  for container in oldcontents:
7831  if self.iscaption(container):
7832  yield self.completepre(inpre)
7833  inpre = []
7834  yield container
7835  else:
7836  inpre += self.extract(container)
7837  yield self.completepre(inpre)
7838 
7839  def processparams(self):
7840  "Process listing parameteres."
7841  LstParser().parsecontainer(self)
7842  if 'numbers' in self.lstparams:
7843  self.numbered = self.lstparams['numbers']
7844 
7845  def iscaption(self, container):
7846  "Find out if the container has a caption (which should not be in <pre>)."
7847  return (len(container.searchall(Caption)) > 0)
7848 
7849  def completepre(self, listinpre):
7850  "Complete the <pre> tag with whatever has already been added."
7851  if len(listinpre) == 0:
7852  return None
7853  return TaggedText().complete(listinpre, 'pre class="listing"', False)
7854 
7855  def extract(self, container):
7856  "Extract the container's contents and return them"
7857  if isinstance(container, StringContainer):
7858  return self.modifystring(container)
7859  if isinstance(container, StandardLayout):
7860  return self.modifylayout(container)
7861  if isinstance(container, PlainLayout):
7862  return self.modifylayout(container)
7863  Trace.error('Unexpected container ' + container.__class__.__name__ +
7864  ' in listing')
7865  container.tree()
7866  return []
7867 
7868  def modifystring(self, string):
7869  "Modify a listing string"
7870  if string.string == '':
7871  string.string = u'​'
7872  return self.modifycontainer(string)
7873 
7874  def modifylayout(self, layout):
7875  "Modify a standard layout"
7876  if len(layout.contents) == 0:
7877  layout.contents = [Constant(u'​')]
7878  return self.modifycontainer(layout)
7879 
7880  def modifycontainer(self, container):
7881  "Modify a listing container"
7882  contents = [container, Constant('\n')]
7883  if self.numbered:
7884  self.counter += 1
7885  tag = 'span class="number-' + self.numbered + '"'
7886  contents.insert(0, TaggedText().constant(unicode(self.counter), tag))
7887  return contents
7888 
7889 class FloatNumber(Container):
7890  "Holds the number for a float in the caption."
7891 
7892  def __init__(self):
7893  self.output = ContentsOutput()
7894 
7895  def create(self, float):
7896  "Create the float number."
7897  self.contents = [Constant(float.partkey.partkey)]
7898  return self
7899 
7900 class PostFloat(object):
7901  "Postprocess a float: number it and move the label"
7902 
7903  processedclass = Float
7904 
7905  def postprocess(self, last, float, next):
7906  "Move the label to the top and number the caption"
7907  number = FloatNumber().create(float)
7908  for caption in float.searchinside(Caption):
7909  self.postlabels(float, caption)
7910  caption.contents = [number, Separator(u' ')] + caption.contents
7911  return float
7912 
7913  def postlabels(self, float, caption):
7914  "Search for labels and move them to the top"
7915  labels = caption.searchremove(Label)
7916  if len(labels) == 0 and float.partkey.tocentry:
7917  labels = [Label().create(' ', float.partkey.partkey.replace(' ', '-'))]
7918  float.contents = labels + float.contents
7919 
7920 class PostWrap(PostFloat):
7921  "For a wrap: exactly like a float"
7922 
7923  processedclass = Wrap
7924 
7925 Postprocessor.stages += [PostFloat, PostWrap]
7926 
7927 
7928 
7929 class IncludeInset(Container):
7930  "A child document included within another."
7931 
7932  # the converter factory will be set in converter.py
7933  converterfactory = None
7934  filename = None
7935 
7936  def __init__(self):
7937  self.parser = InsetParser()
7938  self.output = ContentsOutput()
7939 
7940  def process(self):
7941  "Include the provided child document"
7942  self.filename = os.path.join(Options.directory, self.getparameter('filename'))
7943  Trace.debug('Child document: ' + self.filename)
7944  LstParser().parsecontainer(self)
7945  command = self.getparameter('LatexCommand')
7946  if command == 'verbatiminput':
7947  self.readverbatim()
7948  return
7949  elif command == 'lstinputlisting':
7950  self.readlisting()
7951  return
7952  self.processinclude()
7953 
7954  def processinclude(self):
7955  "Process a regular include: standard child document."
7956  self.contents = []
7957  olddir = Options.directory
7958  newdir = os.path.dirname(self.getparameter('filename'))
7959  if newdir != '':
7960  Trace.debug('Child dir: ' + newdir)
7961  Options.directory = os.path.join(Options.directory, newdir)
7962  try:
7963  self.convertinclude()
7964  finally:
7965  Options.directory = olddir
7966 
7967  def convertinclude(self):
7968  "Convert an included document."
7969  try:
7970  converter = IncludeInset.converterfactory.create(self)
7971  except:
7972  Trace.error('Could not read ' + self.filename + ', please check that the file exists and has read permissions.')
7973  return
7974  if self.hasemptyoutput():
7975  return
7976  converter.convert()
7977  self.contents = converter.getcontents()
7978 
7979  def readverbatim(self):
7980  "Read a verbatim document."
7981  self.contents = [TaggedText().complete(self.readcontents(), 'pre', True)]
7982 
7983  def readlisting(self):
7984  "Read a document as a listing."
7985  listing = Listing()
7986  listing.contents = self.readcontents()
7987  listing.parameters = self.parameters
7988  listing.process()
7989  self.contents = [listing]
7990 
7991  def readcontents(self):
7992  "Read the contents of a complete file."
7993  contents = list()
7994  lines = BulkFile(self.filename).readall()
7995  for line in lines:
7996  contents.append(Constant(line))
7997  return contents
7998 
7999  def __unicode__(self):
8000  "Return a printable description."
8001  if not self.filename:
8002  return 'Included unnamed file'
8003  return 'Included "' + self.filename + '"'
8004 
8005 
8006 
8007 
8008 
8009 
8010 class ChangeInserted(Container):
8011  "A change which consists of an insertion."
8012 
8013  def __init__(self):
8014  self.parser = TextParser(self)
8015  if DocumentParameters.outputchanges:
8016  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="inserted"')
8017  else:
8018  self.output = ContentsOutput()
8019 
8020 class ChangeDeleted(TaggedText):
8021  "A change which consists of a deletion."
8022 
8023  def __init__(self):
8024  self.parser = TextParser(self)
8025  if DocumentParameters.outputchanges:
8026  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="deleted"')
8027  else:
8028  self.output = EmptyOutput()
8029 
8030 
8031 
8032 
8033 
8034 
8035 
8036 
8037 
8038 
8039 
8040 
8041 class ERT(FirstWord):
8042  "Evil Red Text: embedded TeX code."
8043  "Considered as a first word for descriptions."
8044 
8045  def __init__(self):
8046  self.parser = InsetParser()
8047  self.output = ContentsOutput()
8048 
8049  def process(self):
8050  "Process all TeX code, formulas, commands."
8051  text = ''
8052  separator = ''
8053  for container in self.contents:
8054  text += separator + container.extracttext()
8055  separator = '\n'
8056  pos = TextPosition(text)
8057  pos.leavepending = True
8058  code = TeXCode()
8059  code.parse(pos)
8060  self.contents = [code]
8061 
8062  def isempty(self):
8063  "Find out if the ERT is empty or not."
8064  if len(self.contents) == 0:
8065  return True
8066  if len(self.contents) > 1:
8067  Trace.error('Unknown ERT length 2')
8068  return False
8069  texcode = self.contents[0]
8070  return len(texcode.contents) == 0
8071 
8072 class TeXCode(Container):
8073  "A parser and processor for TeX code."
8074 
8075  texseparators = ['{', '\\', '}', '$', '%']
8076  replaced = BibTeXConfig.replaced
8077  factory = FormulaFactory()
8078  endinglist = EndingList()
8079 
8080  def __init__(self):
8081  self.contents = []
8082  self.output = ContentsOutput()
8083 
8084  def parse(self, pos):
8085  "Parse some TeX code."
8086  self.parserecursive(pos)
8087  if pos.leavepending:
8088  self.endinglist.pickpending(pos)
8089 
8090  def findlaststring(self):
8091  "Find the last string in the contents."
8092  if len(self.contents) == 0:
8093  return None
8094  string = self.contents[-1]
8095  if not isinstance(string, StringContainer):
8096  return None
8097  return string
8098 
8099  def add(self, piece):
8100  "Add a new piece to the tag."
8101  if isinstance(piece, basestring):
8102  self.addtext(piece)
8103  else:
8104  self.contents.append(piece)
8105 
8106  def addtext(self, piece):
8107  "Add a text string to the tag."
8108  last = self.findlaststring()
8109  if last:
8110  last.string += piece
8111  return
8112  self.contents.append(Constant(piece))
8113 
8114  def parserecursive(self, pos):
8115  "Parse brackets or quotes recursively."
8116  while not pos.finished():
8117  self.parsetext(pos)
8118  if pos.finished():
8119  return
8120  elif pos.checkfor('{'):
8121  self.parseopenbracket(pos)
8122  elif pos.checkfor('}'):
8123  self.parseclosebracket(pos)
8124  elif pos.checkfor('\\'):
8125  self.parseescaped(pos)
8126  elif pos.checkfor('$'):
8127  self.parseformula(pos)
8128  elif pos.checkfor('%'):
8129  self.parsecomment(pos)
8130  else:
8131  pos.error('Unexpected character ' + pos.current())
8132  pos.skipcurrent()
8133 
8134  def parsetext(self, pos):
8135  "Parse a bit of text, excluding separators and compressing spaces."
8136  text = self.parsecompressingspace(pos)
8137  if text == '':
8138  return
8139  for key in self.replaced:
8140  if key in text:
8141  text = text.replace(key, self.replaced[key])
8142  self.add(text)
8143 
8144  def parsecompressingspace(self, pos):
8145  "Parse some text excluding value separators and compressing spaces."
8146  parsed = ''
8147  while not pos.finished():
8148  parsed += pos.glob(lambda: self.excludespaces(pos))
8149  if not pos.finished() and pos.current().isspace():
8150  parsed += ' '
8151  pos.skipspace()
8152  else:
8153  return parsed
8154  return parsed
8155 
8156  def excludespaces(self, pos):
8157  "Exclude value separators and spaces."
8158  current = pos.current()
8159  if current in self.texseparators:
8160  return False
8161  if current.isspace():
8162  return False
8163  return True
8164 
8165  def parseescaped(self, pos):
8166  "Parse an escaped string \\*."
8167  if pos.checkfor('\\(') or pos.checkfor('\\['):
8168  # start of formula commands
8169  self.parseformula(pos)
8170  return
8171  if not self.factory.detecttype(FormulaCommand, pos):
8172  pos.error('Not an escape sequence')
8173  return
8174  self.add(self.factory.parsetype(FormulaCommand, pos))
8175 
8176  def parseopenbracket(self, pos):
8177  "Parse a { bracket."
8178  if not pos.checkskip('{'):
8179  pos.error('Missing opening { bracket')
8180  return
8181  pos.pushending('}')
8182  self.parserecursive(pos)
8183  pos.popending('}')
8184 
8185  def parseclosebracket(self, pos):
8186  "Parse a } bracket."
8187  ending = self.endinglist.findending(pos)
8188  if not ending:
8189  Trace.error('Unexpected closing } bracket')
8190  else:
8191  self.endinglist.pop(pos)
8192  if not pos.checkskip('}'):
8193  pos.error('Missing closing } bracket')
8194  return
8195 
8196  def parseformula(self, pos):
8197  "Parse a whole formula."
8198  formula = Formula().parse(pos)
8199  self.add(formula)
8200 
8201  def parsecomment(self, pos):
