8202  "Parse a TeX comment: % to the end of the line."
8203  pos.globexcluding('\n')
8204 
8205  def __unicode__(self):
8206  "Return a printable representation."
8207  return 'TeX code: ' + self.extracttext()
8208 
8209 
8210 
8211 class BibTagParser(object):
8212  "A parser for BibTeX tags."
8213 
8214  nameseparators = ['{', '=', '"', '#']
8215 
8216  def __init__(self):
8217  self.key = None
8218  tags = BibStylesConfig.defaulttags
8219  self.tags = dict((x, BibTag().constant(tags[x])) for x in tags)
8220 
8221  def parse(self, pos):
8222  "Parse the entry between {}."
8223  self.type = pos.globexcluding(self.nameseparators).strip()
8224  if not pos.checkskip('{'):
8225  pos.error('Entry should start with {')
8226  return
8227  pos.pushending('}')
8228  self.parsetags(pos)
8229  pos.popending('}')
8230  pos.skipspace()
8231 
8232  def parsetags(self, pos):
8233  "Parse all tags in the entry."
8234  pos.skipspace()
8235  while not pos.finished():
8236  if pos.checkskip('{'):
8237  pos.error('Unmatched {')
8238  return
8239  pos.pushending(',', True)
8240  self.parsetag(pos)
8241  if pos.checkfor(','):
8242  pos.popending(',')
8243 
8244  def parsetag(self, pos):
8245  "Parse a single tag."
8246  (key, value) = self.getkeyvalue(pos)
8247  if not key:
8248  return
8249  if not value:
8250  self.key = key
8251  return
8252  name = key.lower()
8253  self.tags[name] = value
8254  if hasattr(self, 'dissect' + name):
8255  dissector = getattr(self, 'dissect' + name)
8256  dissector(value.extracttext())
8257  if not pos.finished():
8258  remainder = pos.globexcluding(',')
8259  pos.error('Ignored ' + remainder + ' before comma')
8260 
8261  def getkeyvalue(self, pos):
8262  "Parse a string of the form key=value."
8263  piece = pos.globexcluding(self.nameseparators).strip()
8264  if pos.finished():
8265  return (piece, None)
8266  if not pos.checkskip('='):
8267  pos.error('Undesired character in tag name ' + piece)
8268  pos.skipcurrent()
8269  return (piece, None)
8270  key = piece.lower()
8271  pos.skipspace()
8272  value = self.parsevalue(pos)
8273  return (key, value)
8274 
8275  def parsevalue(self, pos):
8276  "Parse the value for a tag."
8277  tag = BibTag()
8278  pos.skipspace()
8279  if pos.checkfor(','):
8280  pos.error('Unexpected ,')
8281  return tag.error()
8282  tag.parse(pos)
8283  return tag
8284 
8285  def dissectauthor(self, authortag):
8286  "Dissect the author tag into pieces."
8287  authorsplit = authortag.split(' and ')
8288  if len(authorsplit) == 0:
8289  return
8290  authorlist = []
8291  for authorname in authorsplit:
8292  author = BibAuthor().parse(authorname)
8293  authorlist.append(author)
8294  initials = ''
8295  authors = ''
8296  if len(authorlist) == 1:
8297  initials = authorlist[0].surname[0:3]
8298  authors = unicode(authorlist[0])
8299  else:
8300  for author in authorlist:
8301  initials += author.surname[0:1]
8302  authors += unicode(author) + ', '
8303  authors = authors[:-2]
8304  self.tags['surname'] = BibTag().constant(authorlist[0].surname)
8305  self.tags['Sur'] = BibTag().constant(initials)
8306  self.tags['authors'] = BibTag().constant(authors)
8307 
8308  def dissectyear(self, yeartag):
8309  "Dissect the year tag into pieces, looking for 4 digits in a row."
8310  pos = TextPosition(yeartag)
8311  while not pos.finished():
8312  if pos.current().isdigit():
8313  number = pos.globnumber()
8314  if len(number) == 4:
8315  self.tags['YY'] = BibTag().constant(number[2:])
8316  return
8317  else:
8318  pos.skipcurrent()
8319 
8320  def dissectfile(self, filetag):
8321  "Extract the filename from elyxer.the file tag as ':filename:FORMAT'."
8322  if not filetag.startswith(':'):
8323  return
8324  bits = filetag.split(':')
8325  if len(bits) != 3:
8326  return
8327  self.tags['filename'] = BibTag().constant(bits[1])
8328  self.tags['format'] = BibTag().constant(bits[2])
8329 
8330  def gettag(self, key):
8331  "Get the tag for a given key."
8332  if not key in self.tags:
8333  return None
8334  return self.tags[key]
8335 
8336  def gettagtext(self, key):
8337  "Get the tag for a key as raw text."
8338  return self.gettag(key).extracttext()
8339 
8340 class BibTag(Container):
8341  "A tag in a BibTeX file."
8342 
8343  valueseparators = ['{', '"', '#', '}']
8344  stringdefs = dict()
8345 
8346  def __init__(self):
8347  self.contents = []
8348  self.output = ContentsOutput()
8349 
8350  def constant(self, text):
8351  "Initialize for a single constant."
8352  self.contents = [Constant(text)]
8353  return self
8354 
8355  def error(self):
8356  "To use when parsing resulted in an error."
8357  return self.constant('')
8358 
8359  def parse(self, pos):
8360  "Parse brackets or quotes at the first level."
8361  while not pos.finished():
8362  self.parsetext(pos)
8363  if pos.finished():
8364  return
8365  elif pos.checkfor('{'):
8366  self.parsebracket(pos)
8367  elif pos.checkfor('"'):
8368  self.parsequoted(pos)
8369  elif pos.checkfor('#'):
8370  self.parsehash(pos)
8371  else:
8372  pos.error('Unexpected character ' + pos.current())
8373  pos.skipcurrent()
8374 
8375  def parsetext(self, pos):
8376  "Parse a bit of text, try to substitute strings with string defs."
8377  text = pos.globexcluding(self.valueseparators)
8378  key = text.strip()
8379  if key == '':
8380  return
8381  if key in self.stringdefs:
8382  self.add(self.stringdefs[key])
8383  return
8384  self.add(Constant(key))
8385 
8386  def add(self, piece):
8387  "Add a new piece to the tag."
8388  self.contents.append(piece)
8389 
8390  def parsetex(self, pos):
8391  "Parse some TeX code."
8392  tex = TeXCode()
8393  tex.parse(pos)
8394  self.add(tex)
8395 
8396  def parsebracket(self, pos):
8397  "Parse a {} bracket"
8398  if not pos.checkskip('{'):
8399  pos.error('Missing opening { in bracket')
8400  return
8401  pos.pushending('}')
8402  self.parsetex(pos)
8403  pos.popending('}')
8404 
8405  def parsequoted(self, pos):
8406  "Parse a piece of quoted text"
8407  if not pos.checkskip('"'):
8408  pos.error('Missing opening " in quote')
8409  return
8410  pos.pushending('"')
8411  self.parsetex(pos)
8412  pos.popending('"')
8413  pos.skipspace()
8414 
8415  def parsehash(self, pos):
8416  "Parse a hash mark #."
8417  if not pos.checkskip('#'):
8418  pos.error('Missing # in hash')
8419  return
8420 
8421  def __unicode__(self):
8422  "Return a printable representation."
8423  return 'BibTag: ' + self.extracttext()
8424 
8425 class BibAuthor(object):
8426  "A BibTeX individual author."
8427 
8428  def __init__(self):
8429  self.surname = ''
8430  self.firstnames = []
8431 
8432  def parse(self, tag):
8433  "Parse an individual author tag."
8434  if ',' in tag:
8435  self.parsecomma(tag)
8436  else:
8437  self.parsewithoutcomma(tag)
8438  return self
8439 
8440  def parsecomma(self, tag):
8441  "Parse an author with a comma: Python, M."
8442  bits = tag.split(',')
8443  if len(bits) > 2:
8444  Trace.error('Too many commas in ' + tag)
8445  self.surname = bits[0].strip()
8446  self.parsefirstnames(bits[1].strip())
8447 
8448  def parsewithoutcomma(self, tag):
8449  "Parse an author without a comma: M. Python."
8450  bits = tag.rsplit(None, 1)
8451  if len(bits) == 0:
8452  Trace.error('Empty author')
8453  ppp()
8454  return
8455  self.surname = bits[-1].strip()
8456  if len(bits) == 1:
8457  return
8458  self.parsefirstnames(bits[0].strip())
8459 
8460  def parsefirstnames(self, firstnames):
8461  "Parse the first name."
8462  for firstname in firstnames.split():
8463  self.firstnames.append(firstname)
8464 
8465  def getinitial(self):
8466  "Get the main initial for the author."
8467  if len(self.surname) == 0:
8468  return ''
8469  return self.surname[0].toupper()
8470 
8471  def __unicode__(self):
8472  "Return a printable representation."
8473  result = ''
8474  for firstname in self.firstnames:
8475  result += firstname + ' '
8476  return result + self.surname
8477 
8478 
8479 
8480 class BibTeX(Container):
8481  "Show a BibTeX bibliography and all referenced entries"
8482 
8483  def __init__(self):
8484  self.parser = InsetParser()
8485  self.output = ContentsOutput()
8486 
8487  def process(self):
8488  "Read all bibtex files and process them."
8489  self.entries = []
8490  self.contents = [self.createheader()]
8491  bibliography = Translator.translate('bibliography')
8492  files = self.getparameterlist('bibfiles')
8493  showall = False
8494  if self.getparameter('btprint') == 'btPrintAll':
8495  showall = True
8496  for file in files:
8497  bibfile = BibFile(file, showall)
8498  bibfile.parse()
8499  self.entries += bibfile.entries
8500  Trace.message('Parsed ' + unicode(bibfile))
8501  self.entries.sort(key = unicode)
8502  self.applystyle()
8503 
8504  def createheader(self):
8505  "Create the header for the bibliography."
8506  header = BiblioHeader()
8507  if 'bibtotoc' in self.getparameterlist('options'):
8508  header.addtotoc(self)
8509  return header
8510 
8511  def applystyle(self):
8512  "Read the style and apply it to all entries"
8513  style = self.readstyle()
8514  for entry in self.entries:
8515  entry.template = style['default']
8516  entry.citetemplate = style['cite']
8517  type = entry.type.lower()
8518  if type in style:
8519  entry.template = style[type]
8520  entry.process()
8521  self.contents.append(entry)
8522 
8523  def readstyle(self):
8524  "Read the style from elyxer.the bibliography options"
8525  for option in self.getparameterlist('options'):
8526  if hasattr(BibStylesConfig, option):
8527  return getattr(BibStylesConfig, option)
8528  return BibStylesConfig.default
8529 
8530 class BibFile(object):
8531  "A BibTeX file"
8532 
8533  def __init__(self, filename, showall):
8534  "Create the BibTeX file"
8535  self.filename = filename + '.bib'
8536  self.showall = showall
8537  self.added = 0
8538  self.ignored = 0
8539  self.entries = []
8540 
8541  def parse(self):
8542  "Parse the BibTeX file and extract all entries."
8543  try:
8544  self.parsefile()
8545  except IOError:
8546  Trace.error('Error reading ' + self.filename + '; make sure the file exists and can be read.')
8547 
8548  def parsefile(self):
8549  "Parse the whole file."
8550  bibpath = InputPath(self.filename)
8551  if Options.lowmem:
8552  pos = FilePosition(bibpath.path)
8553  else:
8554  bulkfile = BulkFile(bibpath.path)
8555  text = ''.join(bulkfile.readall())
8556  pos = TextPosition(text)
8557  while not pos.finished():
8558  pos.skipspace()
8559  if pos.checkskip(','):
8560  pos.skipspace()
8561  self.parseentry(pos)
8562 
8563  def parseentry(self, pos):
8564  "Parse a single entry"
8565  for entry in BibEntry.instances:
8566  if entry.detect(pos):
8567  newentry = Cloner.clone(entry)
8568  newentry.parse(pos)
8569  if not newentry.isvisible():
8570  return
8571  if self.showall or newentry.isreferenced():
8572  self.entries.append(newentry)
8573  self.added += 1
8574  else:
8575  Trace.debug('Ignored entry ' + unicode(newentry))
8576  self.ignored += 1
8577  return
8578  # Skip the whole line since it's a comment outside an entry
8579  pos.globincluding('\n').strip()
8580 
8581  def __unicode__(self):
8582  "String representation"
8583  string = self.filename + ': ' + unicode(self.added) + ' entries added, '
8584  string += unicode(self.ignored) + ' entries ignored'
8585  return string
8586 
8587 class BibEntry(Container):
8588  "An entry in a BibTeX file"
8589 
8590  instances = []
8591 
8592  def detect(self, pos):
8593  "Throw an error."
8594  Trace.error('Tried to detect() in ' + unicode(self))
8595 
8596  def parse(self, pos):
8597  "Throw an error."
8598  Trace.error('Tried to parse() in ' + unicode(self))
8599 
8600  def isvisible(self):
8601  "Return if the entry should be visible. Throws an error."
8602  Trace.error('Function isvisible() not implemented for ' + unicode(self))
8603 
8604  def isreferenced(self):
8605  "Return if the entry is referenced. Throws an error."
8606  Trace.error('Function isreferenced() not implemented for ' + unicode(self))
8607 
8608  def __unicode__(self):
8609  "Return a string representation"
8610  return 'BibTeX entry ' + self.__class__.__name__
8611 
8612 class CommentEntry(BibEntry):
8613  "A simple comment."
8614 
8615  def detect(self, pos):
8616  "Detect the special entry"
8617  return pos.checkfor('%')
8618 
8619  def parse(self, pos):
8620  "Parse all consecutive comment lines."
8621  while pos.checkfor('%'):
8622  pos.globincluding('\n')
8623 
8624  def isvisible(self):
8625  "A comment entry is never visible."
8626  return False
8627 
8628  def __unicode__(self):
8629  "Return a string representation"
8630  return 'Comment'
8631 
8632 class SpecialEntry(BibEntry):
8633  "A special entry"
8634 
8635  types = ['@preamble', '@comment']
8636 
8637  def __init__(self):
8638  self.contents = []
8639  self.output = EmptyOutput()
8640 
8641  def detect(self, pos):
8642  "Detect the special entry"
8643  for type in self.types:
8644  if pos.checkforlower(type):
8645  return True
8646  return False
8647 
8648  def parse(self, pos):
8649  "Parse and ignore."
8650  self.type = 'special'
8651  pos.globincluding('{')
8652  pos.pushending('}')
8653  while not pos.finished():
8654  if pos.checkfor('{'):
8655  self.parse(pos)
8656  else:
8657  pos.skipcurrent()
8658  pos.popending()
8659 
8660  def isvisible(self):
8661  "A special entry is never visible."
8662  return False
8663 
8664  def __unicode__(self):
8665  "Return a string representation"
8666  return self.type
8667 
8668 class StringEntry(SpecialEntry):
8669  "A string definition. The definition can later be used in other entries."
8670 
8671  parser = BibTagParser()
8672  start = '@string'
8673  key = None
8674 
8675  def detect(self, pos):
8676  "Detect the string definition."
8677  return pos.checkforlower(self.start)
8678 
8679  def parse(self, pos):
8680  "Parse a single tag, which will define a string."
8681  self.type = self.start
8682  if not self.checkstart(pos):
8683  return
8684  pos.skipspace()
8685  if not pos.checkskip('{'):
8686  Trace.error('Missing opening { in ' + unicode(self))
8687  pos.globincluding('\n')
8688  return
8689  pos.pushending('}')
8690  (self.key, value) = self.parser.getkeyvalue(pos)
8691  BibTag.stringdefs[self.key] = value
8692  pos.popending('}')
8693 
8694  def checkstart(self, pos):
8695  "Check that the entry starts with @string."
8696  if not pos.checkskip('@'):
8697  Trace.error('Missing @ from elyxer.string definition')
8698  return False
8699  name = '@' + pos.globalpha()
8700  if not name.lower() == self.start.lower():
8701  Trace.error('Invalid start @' + name +', missing ' + self.start + ' from elyxer.' + unicode(self))
8702  pos.globincluding('\n')
8703  return False
8704  return True
8705 
8706  def __unicode__(self):
8707  "Return a printable representation."
8708  result = 'string definition'
8709  if self.key:
8710  result += ' for ' + self.key
8711  return result
8712 
8713 
8714 BibEntry.instances += [CommentEntry(), SpecialEntry(), StringEntry()]
8715 
8716 
8717 
8718 
8719 
8720 
8721 class PubEntry(BibEntry):
8722  "A publication entry"
8723 
8724  def __init__(self):
8725  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('p class="biblio"', True)
8726 
8727  def detect(self, pos):
8728  "Detect a publication entry."
8729  return pos.checkfor('@')
8730 
8731  def parse(self, pos):
8732  "Parse the publication entry."
8733  self.parser = BibTagParser()
8734  self.parser.parse(pos)
8735  self.type = self.parser.type
8736 
8737  def isvisible(self):
8738  "A publication entry is always visible."
8739  return True
8740 
8741  def isreferenced(self):
8742  "Check if the entry is referenced."
8743  if not self.parser.key:
8744  return False
8745  return self.parser.key in BiblioReference.references
8746 
8747  def process(self):
8748  "Process the entry."
8749  self.index = NumberGenerator.generator.generate('pubentry')
8750  self.parser.tags['index'] = Constant(self.index)
8751  biblio = BiblioEntry()
8752  biblio.citeref = self.createref()
8753  biblio.processcites(self.parser.key)
8754  self.contents = [biblio, Constant(' ')]
8755  self.contents += self.entrycontents()
8756 
8757  def entrycontents(self):
8758  "Get the contents of the entry."
8759  return self.translatetemplate(self.template)
8760 
8761  def createref(self):
8762  "Create the reference to cite."
8763  return self.translatetemplate(self.citetemplate)
8764 
8765  def translatetemplate(self, template):
8766  "Translate a complete template into a list of contents."
8767  pos = TextPosition(template)
8768  part = BibPart(self.parser.tags).parse(pos)
8769  for variable in part.searchall(BibVariable):
8770  if variable.empty():
8771  Trace.error('Error parsing BibTeX template for ' + unicode(self) + ': '
8772  + unicode(variable) + ' is empty')
8773  return [part]
8774 
8775  def __unicode__(self):
8776  "Return a string representation"
8777  string = ''
8778  if 'author' in self.parser.tags:
8779  string += self.parser.gettagtext('author') + ': '
8780  if 'title' in self.parser.tags:
8781  string += '"' + self.parser.gettagtext('title') + '"'
8782  return string
8783 
8784 class BibPart(Container):
8785  "A part of a BibTeX template."
8786 
8787  def __init__(self, tags):
8788  self.output = ContentsOutput()
8789  self.contents = []
8790  self.tags = tags
8791  self.quotes = 0
8792 
8793  def parse(self, pos):
8794  "Parse a part of a template, return a list of contents."
8795  while not pos.finished():
8796  self.add(self.parsepiece(pos))
8797  return self
8798 
8799  def parsepiece(self, pos):
8800  "Get the next piece of the template, return if it was empty."
8801  if pos.checkfor('{'):
8802  return self.parsebraces(pos)
8803  elif pos.checkfor('$'):
8804  return self.parsevariable(pos)
8805  result = ''
8806  while not pos.finished() and not pos.current() in '{$':
8807  if pos.current() == '"':
8808  self.quotes += 1
8809  result += pos.skipcurrent()
8810  return Constant(result)
8811 
8812  def parsebraces(self, pos):
8813  "Parse a pair of curly braces {}."
8814  if not pos.checkskip('{'):
8815  Trace.error('Missing { in braces.')
8816  return None
8817  pos.pushending('}')
8818  part = BibPart(self.tags).parse(pos)
8819  pos.popending('}')
8820  empty = part.emptyvariables()
8821  if empty:
8822  return None
8823  return part
8824 
8825  def parsevariable(self, pos):
8826  "Parse a variable $name."
8827  var = BibVariable(self.tags).parse(pos)
8828  if self.quotes % 2 == 1:
8829  # odd number of quotes; don't add spans in an attribute
8830  var.removetag()
8831  return var
8832 
8833  def emptyvariables(self):
8834  "Find out if there are only empty variables in the part."
8835  for variable in self.searchall(BibVariable):
8836  if not variable.empty():
8837  return False
8838  return True
8839 
8840  def add(self, piece):
8841  "Add a new piece to the current part."
8842  if not piece:
8843  return
8844  if self.redundantdot(piece):
8845  # remove extra dot
8846  piece.string = piece.string[1:]
8847  self.contents.append(piece)
8848  piece.parent = self
8849 
8850  def redundantdot(self, piece):
8851  "Find out if there is a redundant dot in the next piece."
8852  if not isinstance(piece, Constant):
8853  return False
8854  if not piece.string.startswith('.'):
8855  return False
8856  if len(self.contents) == 0:
8857  return False
8858  if not isinstance(self.contents[-1], BibVariable):
8859  return False
8860  if not self.contents[-1].extracttext().endswith('.'):
8861  return False
8862  return True
8863 
8864 class BibVariable(Container):
8865  "A variable in a BibTeX template."
8866 
8867  def __init__(self, tags):
8868  self.output = TaggedOutput()
8869  self.contents = []
8870  self.tags = tags
8871 
8872  def parse(self, pos):
8873  "Parse the variable name."
8874  if not pos.checkskip('$'):
8875  Trace.error('Missing $ in variable name.')
8876  return self
8877  self.key = pos.globalpha()
8878  self.output.tag = 'span class="bib-' + self.key + '"'
8879  self.processtags()
8880  return self
8881 
8882  def processtags(self):
8883  "Find the tag with the appropriate key in the list of tags."
8884  if not self.key in self.tags:
8885  return
8886  result = self.tags[self.key]
8887  self.contents = [result]
8888 
8889  def empty(self):
8890  "Find out if the variable is empty."
8891  if not self.contents:
8892  return True
8893  if self.extracttext() == '':
8894  return True
8895  return False
8896 
8897  def removetag(self):
8898  "Remove the output tag and leave just the contents."
8899  self.output = ContentsOutput()
8900 
8901  def __unicode__(self):
8902  "Return a printable representation."
8903  result = 'variable ' + self.key
8904  if not self.empty():
8905  result += ':' + self.extracttext()
8906  return result
8907 
8908 BibEntry.instances += [PubEntry()]
8909 
8910 
8911 
8912 
8913 
8914 
8915 class NewfangledChunk(Layout):
8916  "A chunk of literate programming."
8917 
8918  names = dict()
8919  firsttime = True
8920 
8921  def process(self):
8922  "Process the literate chunk."
8923  self.output.tag = 'div class="chunk"'
8924  self.type = 'chunk'
8925  text = self.extracttext()
8926  parts = text.split(',')
8927  if len(parts) < 1:
8928  Trace.error('Not enough parameters in ' + text)
8929  return
8930  self.name = parts[0]
8931  self.number = self.order()
8932  self.createlinks()
8933  self.contents = [self.left, self.declaration(), self.right]
8934  ChunkProcessor.lastchunk = self
8935 
8936  def order(self):
8937  "Create the order number for the chunk."
8938  return NumberGenerator.generator.generate('chunk')
8939 
8940  def createlinks(self):
8941  "Create back and forward links."
8942  self.leftlink = Link().complete(self.number, 'chunk:' + self.number, type='chunk')
8943  self.left = TaggedText().complete([self.leftlink], 'span class="chunkleft"', False)
8944  self.right = TaggedText().constant('', 'span class="chunkright"', False)
8945  if not self.name in NewfangledChunk.names:
8946  NewfangledChunk.names[self.name] = []
8947  else:
8948  last = NewfangledChunk.names[self.name][-1]
8949  forwardlink = Link().complete(self.number + u'→', 'chunkback:' + last.number, type='chunk')
8950  backlink = Link().complete(u'←' + last.number + u' ', 'chunkforward:' + self.number, type='chunk')
8951  forwardlink.setmutualdestination(backlink)
8952  last.right.contents.append(forwardlink)
8953  self.right.contents.append(backlink)
8954  NewfangledChunk.names[self.name].append(self)
8955  self.origin = self.createorigin()
8956  if self.name in NewfangledChunkRef.references:
8957  for ref in NewfangledChunkRef.references[self.name]:
8958  self.linkorigin(ref.origin)
8959 
8960  def createorigin(self):
8961  "Create a link that points to the chunks' origin."
8962  link = Link()
8963  self.linkorigin(link)
8964  return link
8965 
8966  def linkorigin(self, link):
8967  "Create a link to the origin."
8968  start = NewfangledChunk.names[self.name][0]
8969  link.complete(start.number, type='chunk')
8970  link.destination = start.leftlink
8971  link.computedestination()
8972 
8973  def declaration(self):
8974  "Get the chunk declaration."
8975  contents = []
8976  text = u'⟨' + self.name + '[' + unicode(len(NewfangledChunk.names[self.name])) + '] '
8977  contents.append(Constant(text))
8978  contents.append(self.origin)
8979  text = ''
8980  if NewfangledChunk.firsttime:
8981  Listing.processor = ChunkProcessor()
8982  NewfangledChunk.firsttime = False
8983  text += u'⟩'
8984  if len(NewfangledChunk.names[self.name]) > 1:
8985  text += '+'
8986  text += u'≡'
8987  contents.append(Constant(text))
8988  return TaggedText().complete(contents, 'span class="chunkdecl"', True)
8989 
8990 class ChunkProcessor(object):
8991  "A processor for listings that belong to chunks."
8992 
8993  lastchunk = None
8994  counters = dict()
8995  endcommand = '}'
8996  chunkref = 'chunkref'
8997 
8998  def preprocess(self, listing):
8999  "Preprocess a listing: set the starting counter."
9000  if not ChunkProcessor.lastchunk:
9001  return
9002  name = ChunkProcessor.lastchunk.name
9003  if not name in ChunkProcessor.counters:
9004  ChunkProcessor.counters[name] = 0
9005  listing.counter = ChunkProcessor.counters[name]
9006  for command, container, index in self.commandsinlisting(listing):
9007  chunkref = self.getchunkref(command)
9008  if chunkref:
9009  self.insertchunkref(chunkref, container, index)
9010 
9011  def commandsinlisting(self, listing):
9012  "Find all newfangle commands in a listing."
9013  for container in listing.contents:
9014  for index in range(len(container.contents) - 2):
9015  if self.findinelement(container, index):
9016  third = container.contents[index + 2].string
9017  end = third.index(NewfangleConfig.constants['endmark'])
9018  command = third[:end]
9019  lenstart = len(NewfangleConfig.constants['startmark'])
9020  container.contents[index].string = container.contents[index].string[:-lenstart]
9021  del container.contents[index + 1]
9022  container.contents[index + 1].string = third[end + len(NewfangleConfig.constants['endmark']):]
9023  yield command, container, index
9024 
9025  def findinelement(self, container, index):
9026  "Find a newfangle command in an element."
9027  for i in range(2):
9028  if not isinstance(container.contents[index + i], StringContainer):
9029  return False
9030  first = container.contents[index].string
9031  second = container.contents[index + 1].string
9032  third = container.contents[index + 2].string
9033  if not first.endswith(NewfangleConfig.constants['startmark']):
9034  return False
9035  if second != NewfangleConfig.constants['startcommand']:
9036  return False
9037  if not NewfangleConfig.constants['endmark'] in third:
9038  return False
9039  return True
9040 
9041  def getchunkref(self, command):
9042  "Get the contents of a chunkref command, if present."
9043  if not command.startswith(NewfangleConfig.constants['chunkref']):
9044  return None
9045  if not NewfangleConfig.constants['endcommand'] in command:
9046  return None
9047  start = len(NewfangleConfig.constants['chunkref'])
9048  end = command.index(NewfangleConfig.constants['endcommand'])
9049  return command[start:end]
9050 
9051  def insertchunkref(self, ref, container, index):
9052  "Insert a chunkref after the given index at the given container."
9053  chunkref = NewfangledChunkRef().complete(ref)
9054  container.contents.insert(index + 1, chunkref)
9055 
9056  def postprocess(self, listing):
9057  "Postprocess a listing: store the ending counter for next chunk."
9058  if not ChunkProcessor.lastchunk:
9059  return
9060  ChunkProcessor.counters[ChunkProcessor.lastchunk.name] = listing.counter
9061 
9062 class NewfangledChunkRef(Inset):
9063  "A reference to a chunk."
9064 
9065  references = dict()
9066 
9067  def process(self):
9068  "Show the reference."
9069  self.output.tag = 'span class="chunkref"'
9070  self.ref = self.extracttext()
9071  self.addbits()
9072 
9073  def complete(self, ref):
9074  "Complete the reference to the given string."
9075  self.output = ContentsOutput()
9076  self.ref = ref
9077  self.contents = [Constant(self.ref)]
9078  self.addbits()
9079  return self
9080 
9081  def addbits(self):
9082  "Add the bits to the reference."
9083  if not self.ref in NewfangledChunkRef.references:
9084  NewfangledChunkRef.references[self.ref] = []
9085  NewfangledChunkRef.references[self.ref].append(self)
9086  if self.ref in NewfangledChunk.names:
9087  start = NewfangledChunk.names[self.ref][0]
9088  self.origin = start.createorigin()
9089  else:
9090  self.origin = Link()
9091  self.contents.insert(0, Constant(u'⟨'))
9092  self.contents.append(Constant(' '))
9093  self.contents.append(self.origin)
9094  self.contents.append(Constant(u'⟩'))
9095 
9096  def __unicode__(self):
9097  "Return a printable representation."
9098  return 'Reference to chunk ' + self.ref
9099 
9100 
9101 
9102 
9103 
9104 
9105 class SetCounterFunction(CommandBit):
9106  "A function which is used in the preamble to set a counter."
9107 
9108  def parsebit(self, pos):
9109  "Parse a function with [] and {} parameters."
9110  counter = self.parseliteral(pos)
9111  value = self.parseliteral(pos)
9112  try:
9113  self.setcounter(counter, int(value))
9114  except:
9115  Trace.error('Counter ' + counter + ' cannot be set to ' + value)
9116 
9117  def setcounter(self, counter, value):
9118  "Set a global counter."
9119  Trace.debug('Setting counter ' + unicode(counter) + ' to ' + unicode(value))
9120  NumberGenerator.generator.getcounter(counter).init(value)
9121 
9122 class FormulaTag(CommandBit):
9123  "A \\tag command."
9124 
9125  def parsebit(self, pos):
9126  "Parse the tag and apply it."
9127  self.output = EmptyOutput()
9128  self.tag = self.parseliteral(pos)
9129 
9130 class MiscCommand(CommandBit):
9131  "A generic command which maps to a command class."
9132 
9133  commandmap = FormulaConfig.misccommands
9134 
9135  def parsebit(self, pos):
9136  "Find the right command to parse and parse it."
9137  commandtype = globals()[self.translated]
9138  return self.parsecommandtype(self.translated, commandtype, pos)
9139 
9140 FormulaCommand.types += [MiscCommand]
9141 
9142 
9143 
9144 class ContainerFactory(object):
9145  "Creates containers depending on the first line"
9146 
9147  def __init__(self):
9148  "Read table that convert start lines to containers"
9149  types = dict()
9150  for start, typename in ContainerConfig.starts.iteritems():
9151  types[start] = globals()[typename]
9152  self.tree = ParseTree(types)
9153 
9154  def createcontainer(self, reader):
9155  "Parse a single container."
9156  #Trace.debug('processing "' + reader.currentline().strip() + '"')
9157  if reader.currentline() == '':
9158  reader.nextline()
9159  return None
9160  container = Cloner.create(self.tree.find(reader))
9161  container.start = reader.currentline().strip()
9162  self.parse(container, reader)
9163  return container
9164 
9165  def parse(self, container, reader):
9166  "Parse a container"
9167  parser = container.parser
9168  parser.parent = container
9169  parser.ending = self.getending(container)
9170  parser.factory = self
9171  container.header = parser.parseheader(reader)
9172  container.begin = parser.begin
9173  self.parsecontents(container, reader)
9174  container.parameters = parser.parameters
9175  container.parser = None
9176 
9177  def parsecontents(self, container, reader):
9178  "Parse the contents of a container."
9179  contents = container.parser.parse(reader)
9180  if isinstance(contents, basestring):
9181  # read a string, set as parsed
9182  container.parsed = contents
9183  container.contents = []
9184  else:
9185  container.contents = contents
9186 
9187  def getending(self, container):
9188  "Get the ending for a container"
9189  split = container.start.split()
9190  if len(split) == 0:
9191  return None
9192  start = split[0]
9193  if start in ContainerConfig.startendings:
9194  return ContainerConfig.startendings[start]
9195  classname = container.__class__.__name__
9196  if classname in ContainerConfig.endings:
9197  return ContainerConfig.endings[classname]
9198  if hasattr(container, 'ending'):
9199  Trace.error('Pending ending in ' + container.__class__.__name__)
9200  return container.ending
9201  return None
9202 
9203 class ParseTree(object):
9204  "A parsing tree"
9205 
9206  default = '~~default~~'
9207 
9208  def __init__(self, types):
9209  "Create the parse tree"
9210  self.root = dict()
9211  for start, type in types.iteritems():
9212  self.addstart(type, start)
9213 
9214  def addstart(self, type, start):
9215  "Add a start piece to the tree"
9216  tree = self.root
9217  for piece in start.split():
9218  if not piece in tree:
9219  tree[piece] = dict()
9220  tree = tree[piece]
9221  if ParseTree.default in tree:
9222  Trace.error('Start ' + start + ' duplicated')
9223  tree[ParseTree.default] = type
9224 
9225  def find(self, reader):
9226  "Find the current sentence in the tree"
9227  branches = self.matchline(reader.currentline())
9228  while not ParseTree.default in branches[-1]:
9229  branches.pop()
9230  last = branches[-1]
9231  return last[ParseTree.default]
9232 
9233  def matchline(self, line):
9234  "Match a given line against the tree, as deep as possible."
9235  branches = [self.root]
9236  for piece in line.split(' '):
9237  current = branches[-1]
9238  piece = piece.rstrip('>')
9239  if piece in current:
9240  branches.append(current[piece])
9241  else:
9242  return branches
9243  return branches
9244 
9245 
9246 
9247 
9248 
9249 
9250 
9251 class TOCEntry(Container):
9252  "A container for a TOC entry."
9253 
9254  def __init__(self):
9255  Container.__init__(self)
9256  self.branches = []
9257 
9258  def create(self, container):
9259  "Create the TOC entry for a container, consisting of a single link."
9260  if container.partkey.header:
9261  return self.header(container)
9262  self.contents = [self.createlink(container)]
9263  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('div class="toc"', True)
9264  self.partkey = container.partkey
9265  return self
9266 
9267  def header(self, container):
9268  "Create a TOC entry for header and footer (0 depth)."
9269  self.partkey = container.partkey
9270  self.output = EmptyOutput()
9271  return self
9272 
9273  def createlink(self, container):
9274  "Create the link that will make the whole TOC entry."
9275  labels = container.searchall(Label)
9276  link = Link()
9277  if self.isanchor(labels):
9278  link.url = '#' + container.partkey.partkey
9279  if Options.tocfor:
9280  link.url = Options.tocfor + link.url
9281  else:
9282  label = labels[0]
9283  link.destination = label
9284  if container.partkey.tocentry:
9285  link.complete(container.partkey.tocentry)
9286  if container.partkey.titlecontents:
9287  if Options.notoclabels:
9288  separator = u' '
9289  else:
9290  separator = u': '
9291  if container.partkey.tocentry:
9292  link.contents.append(Constant(separator))
9293  link.contents += container.partkey.titlecontents
9294  return link
9295 
9296  def isanchor(self, labels):
9297  "Decide if the link is an anchor based on a set of labels."
9298  if len(labels) == 0:
9299  return True
9300  if not Options.tocfor:
9301  return False
9302  if Options.splitpart:
9303  return False
9304  return True
9305 
9306  def __unicode__(self):
9307  "Return a printable representation."
9308  if not self.partkey.tocentry:
9309  return 'Unnamed TOC entry'
9310  return 'TOC entry: ' + self.partkey.tocentry
9311 
9312 class Indenter(object):
9313  "Manages and writes indentation for the TOC."
9314 
9315  def __init__(self):
9316  self.depth = 0
9317 
9318  def getindent(self, depth):
9319  indent = ''
9320  if depth > self.depth:
9321  indent = self.openindent(depth - self.depth)
9322  elif depth < self.depth:
9323  indent = self.closeindent(self.depth - depth)
9324  self.depth = depth
9325  return Constant(indent)
9326 
9327  def openindent(self, times):
9328  "Open the indenting div a few times."
9329  indent = ''
9330  for i in range(times):
9331  indent += '<div class="tocindent">\n'
9332  return indent
9333 
9334  def closeindent(self, times):
9335  "Close the indenting div a few times."
9336  indent = ''
9337  for i in range(times):
9338  indent += '</div>\n'
9339  return indent
9340 
9341 class IndentedEntry(Container):
9342  "An entry with an indentation."
9343 
9344  def __init__(self):
9345  self.output = ContentsOutput()
9346 
9347  def create(self, indent, entry):
9348  "Create the indented entry."
9349  self.entry = entry
9350  self.contents = [indent, entry]
9351  return self
9352 
9353  def __unicode__(self):
9354  "Return a printable documentation."
9355  return 'Indented ' + unicode(self.entry)
9356 
9357 class TOCTree(object):
9358  "A tree that contains the full TOC."
9359 
9360  def __init__(self):
9361  self.tree = []
9362  self.branches = []
9363 
9364  def store(self, entry):
9365  "Place the entry in a tree of entries."
9366  while len(self.tree) < entry.partkey.level:
9367  self.tree.append(None)
9368  if len(self.tree) > entry.partkey.level:
9369  self.tree = self.tree[:entry.partkey.level]
9370  stem = self.findstem()
9371  if len(self.tree) == 0:
9372  self.branches.append(entry)
9373  self.tree.append(entry)
9374  if stem:
9375  entry.stem = stem
9376  stem.branches.append(entry)
9377 
9378  def findstem(self):
9379  "Find the stem where our next element will be inserted."
9380  for element in reversed(self.tree):
9381  if element:
9382  return element
9383  return None
9384 
9385 class TOCConverter(object):
9386  "A converter from elyxer.containers to TOC entries."
9387 
9388  cache = dict()
9389  tree = TOCTree()
9390 
9391  def __init__(self):
9392  self.indenter = Indenter()
9393 
9394  def convertindented(self, container):
9395  "Convert a container into an indented TOC entry."
9396  entry = self.convert(container)
9397  if not entry:
9398  return None
9399  return self.indent(entry)
9400 
9401  def indent(self, entry):
9402  "Indent a TOC entry."
9403  indent = self.indenter.getindent(entry.partkey.level)
9404  return IndentedEntry().create(indent, entry)
9405 
9406  def convert(self, container):
9407  "Convert a container to a TOC entry."
9408  if not container.partkey:
9409  return None
9410  if container.partkey.partkey in self.cache:
9411  return TOCConverter.cache[container.partkey.partkey]
9412  if container.partkey.level > DocumentParameters.tocdepth:
9413  return None
9414  entry = TOCEntry().create(container)
9415  TOCConverter.cache[container.partkey.partkey] = entry
9416  TOCConverter.tree.store(entry)
9417  return entry
9418 
9419 
9420 
9421 
9422 
9423 
9424 
9425 class Basket(object):
9426  "A basket to place a set of containers. Can write them, store them..."
9427 
9428  def setwriter(self, writer):
9429  self.writer = writer
9430  return self
9431 
9432 class WriterBasket(Basket):
9433  "A writer of containers. Just writes them out to a writer."
9434 
9435  def write(self, container):
9436  "Write a container to the line writer."
9437  self.writer.write(container.gethtml())
9438 
9439  def finish(self):
9440  "Mark as finished."
9441  self.writer.close()
9442 
9443 class KeeperBasket(Basket):
9444  "Keeps all containers stored."
9445 
9446  def __init__(self):
9447  self.contents = []
9448 
9449  def write(self, container):
9450  "Keep the container."
9451  self.contents.append(container)
9452 
9453  def finish(self):
9454  "Finish the basket by flushing to disk."
9455  self.flush()
9456 
9457  def flush(self):
9458  "Flush the contents to the writer."
9459  for container in self.contents:
9460  self.writer.write(container.gethtml())
9461  self.writer.close()
9462 
9463 class TOCBasket(Basket):
9464  "A basket to place the TOC of a document."
9465 
9466  def __init__(self):
9467  self.converter = TOCConverter()
9468 
9469  def setwriter(self, writer):
9470  Basket.setwriter(self, writer)
9471  Options.nocopy = True
9472  self.writer.write(LyXHeader().gethtml())
9473  return self
9474 
9475  def write(self, container):
9476  "Write the table of contents for a container."
9477  entry = self.converter.convertindented(container)
9478  if entry:
9479  self.writer.write(entry.gethtml())
9480 
9481  def finish(self):
9482  "Mark as finished."
9483  self.writer.write(LyXFooter().gethtml())
9484  self.writer.close()
9485 
9486 
9487 
9488 
9489 
9490 
9491 class IntegralProcessor(object):
9492  "A processor for an integral document."
9493 
9494  def __init__(self):
9495  "Create the processor for the integral contents."
9496  self.storage = []
9497 
9498  def locate(self, container):
9499  "Locate only containers of the processed type."
9500  return isinstance(container, self.processedtype)
9501 
9502  def store(self, container):
9503  "Store a new container."
9504  self.storage.append(container)
9505 
9506  def process(self):
9507  "Process the whole storage."
9508  for container in self.storage:
9509  self.processeach(container)
9510 
9511 class IntegralTOC(IntegralProcessor):
9512  "A processor for an integral TOC."
9513 
9514  processedtype = TableOfContents
9515  tocentries = []
9516 
9517  def processeach(self, toc):
9518  "Fill in a Table of Contents."
9519  converter = TOCConverter()
9520  for container in PartKeyGenerator.partkeyed:
9521  toc.add(converter.convertindented(container))
9522  # finish off with the footer to align indents
9523  toc.add(converter.convertindented(LyXFooter()))
9524 
9525  def writetotoc(self, entries, toc):
9526  "Write some entries to the TOC."
9527  for entry in entries:
9528  toc.contents.append(entry)
9529 
9530 class IntegralBiblioEntry(IntegralProcessor):
9531  "A processor for an integral bibliography entry."
9532 
9533  processedtype = BiblioEntry
9534 
9535  def processeach(self, entry):
9536  "Process each entry."
9537  number = NumberGenerator.generator.generate('integralbib')
9538  link = Link().complete('cite', 'biblio-' + number, type='biblioentry')
9539  link.contents = entry.citeref
9540  entry.contents = [Constant('['), link, Constant('] ')]
9541  if entry.key in BiblioCite.cites:
9542  for cite in BiblioCite.cites[entry.key]:
9543  cite.contents = entry.citeref
9544  cite.anchor = 'cite-' + number
9545  cite.destination = link
9546 
9547 class IntegralFloat(IntegralProcessor):
9548  "Store all floats in the document by type."
9549 
9550  processedtype = Float
9551  bytype = dict()
9552 
9553  def processeach(self, float):
9554  "Store each float by type."
9555  if not float.type in IntegralFloat.bytype:
9556  IntegralFloat.bytype[float.type] = []
9557  IntegralFloat.bytype[float.type].append(float)
9558 
9559 class IntegralListOf(IntegralProcessor):
9560  "A processor for an integral list of floats."
9561 
9562  processedtype = ListOf
9563 
9564  def processeach(self, listof):
9565  "Fill in a list of floats."
9566  listof.output = TaggedOutput().settag('div class="fulltoc"', True)
9567  if not listof.type in IntegralFloat.bytype:
9568  Trace.message('No floats of type ' + listof.type)
9569  return
9570  for float in IntegralFloat.bytype[listof.type]:
9571  entry = self.processfloat(float)
9572  if entry:
9573  listof.contents.append(entry)
9574 
9575  def processfloat(self, float):
9576  "Get an entry for the list of floats."
9577  if not float.isparent():
9578  return None
9579  return TOCEntry().create(float)
9580 
9581 class IntegralReference(IntegralProcessor):
9582  "A processor for a reference to a label."
9583 
9584  processedtype = Reference
9585 
9586  def processeach(self, reference):
9587  "Extract the text of the original label."
9588  reference.formatcontents()
9589 
9590 class MemoryBasket(KeeperBasket):
9591  "A basket which stores everything in memory, processes it and writes it."
9592 
9593  def __init__(self):
9594  "Create all processors in one go."
9595  KeeperBasket.__init__(self)
9596  self.processors = [
9597  IntegralTOC(), IntegralBiblioEntry(),
9598  IntegralFloat(), IntegralListOf(), IntegralReference(),
9599  ]
9600 
9601  def finish(self):
9602  "Process everything which cannot be done in one pass and write to disk."
9603  self.process()
9604  self.flush()
9605 
9606  def process(self):
9607  "Process everything with the integral processors."
9608  self.searchintegral()
9609  for processor in self.processors:
9610  processor.process()
9611 
9612  def searchintegral(self):
9613  "Search for all containers for all integral processors."
9614  for container in self.contents:
9615  # container.tree()
9616  if self.integrallocate(container):
9617  self.integralstore(container)
9618  container.locateprocess(self.integrallocate, self.integralstore)
9619 
9620  def integrallocate(self, container):
9621  "Locate all integrals."
9622  for processor in self.processors:
9623  if processor.locate(container):
9624  return True
9625  return False
9626 
9627  def integralstore(self, container):
9628  "Store a container in one or more processors."
9629  for processor in self.processors:
9630  if processor.locate(container):
9631  processor.store(container)
9632 
9633 
9634 
9635 
9636 
9637 
9638 
9639 class SplitPartLink(IntegralProcessor):
9640  "A link processor for multi-page output."
9641 
9642  processedtype = Link
9643 
9644  def processeach(self, link):
9645  "Process each link and add the current page."
9646  link.page = self.page
9647 
9648 class NavigationLink(Container):
9649  "A link in the navigation header."
9650 
9651  def __init__(self, name):
9652  "Create the link for a given name (prev, next...)."
9653  self.name = name
9654  self.link = Link().complete(u' ', name, type=name)
9655  self.output = TaggedOutput().settag('span class="' + name + '"')
9656  self.contents = [self.link]
9657 
9658  def complete(self, container, after = False):
9659  "Complete the navigation link with destination container."
9660  "The 'after' parameter decides if the link goes after the part title."
9661  if not container.partkey:
9662  Trace.error('No part key for link name ' + unicode(container))
9663  return
9664  self.link.contents = [Constant(Translator.translate(self.name))]
9665  partname = self.getpartname(container)
9666  separator = Constant(u' ')
9667  if after:
9668  self.contents = partname + [separator, self.link]
9669  else:
9670  self.contents = [self.link, separator] + partname
9671 
9672  def getpartname(self, container):
9673  "Get the part name for a container, title optional."
9674  partname = [Constant(container.partkey.tocentry)]
9675  if not container.partkey.titlecontents:
9676  return partname
9677  if Options.notoclabels:
9678  return container.partkey.titlecontents
9679  return partname + [Constant(': ')] + container.partkey.titlecontents
9680 
9681  def setdestination(self, destination):
9682  "Set the destination for this link."
9683  self.link.destination = destination
9684 
9685  def setmutualdestination(self, destination):
9686  "Set the destination for this link, and vice versa."
9687  self.link.setmutualdestination(destination.link)
9688 
9689 class UpAnchor(Link):
9690  "An anchor to the top of the page for the up links."
9691 
9692  def create(self, container):
9693  "Create the up anchor based on the first container."
9694  if not container.partkey:
9695  Trace.error('No part key for ' + unicode(container))
9696  return None
9697  self.createliteral(container.partkey.tocentry)
9698  self.partkey.titlecontents = container.partkey.titlecontents
9699  return self
9700 
9701  def createmain(self):
9702  "Create the up anchor for the main page."
9703  return self.createliteral(Translator.translate('main-page'))
9704 
9705  def createliteral(self, literal):
9706  "Create the up anchor based on a literal string."
9707  self.complete('', '')
9708  self.output = EmptyOutput()
9709  self.partkey = PartKey().createanchor(literal)
9710  return self
9711 
9712 class SplitPartNavigation(object):
9713  "Used to create the navigation links for a new split page."
9714 
9715  def __init__(self):
9716  self.upanchors = []
9717  self.lastcontainer = None
9718  self.nextlink = None
9719  self.lastnavigation = None
9720 
9721  def writefirstheader(self, basket):
9722  "Write the first header to the basket."
9723  anchor = self.createmainanchor()
9724  basket.write(anchor)
9725  basket.write(self.createnavigation(anchor))
9726 
9727  def writeheader(self, basket, container):
9728  "Write the header to the basket."
9729  basket.write(LyXHeader())
9730  basket.write(self.currentupanchor(container))
9731  basket.write(self.createnavigation(container))
9732 
9733  def writefooter(self, basket):
9734  "Write the footer to the basket."
9735  if self.lastnavigation:
9736  basket.write(self.lastnavigation)
9737  basket.write(LyXFooter())
9738 
9739  def createnavigation(self, container):
9740  "Create the navigation bar with all links."
9741  prevlink = NavigationLink('prev')
9742  uplink = NavigationLink('up')
9743  if self.nextlink:
9744  prevlink.complete(self.lastcontainer)
9745  self.nextlink.complete(container, after=True)
9746  prevlink.setmutualdestination(self.nextlink)
9747  uplink.complete(self.getupdestination(container))
9748  uplink.setdestination(self.getupdestination(container))
9749  self.nextlink = NavigationLink('next')
9750  contents = [prevlink, Constant('\n'), uplink, Constant('\n'), self.nextlink]
9751  header = TaggedText().complete(contents, 'div class="splitheader"', True)
9752  self.lastcontainer = container
9753  self.lastnavigation = header
9754  return header
9755 
9756  def currentupanchor(self, container):
9757  "Update the internal list of up anchors, and return the current one."
9758  level = self.getlevel(container)
9759  while len(self.upanchors) > level:
9760  del self.upanchors[-1]
9761  while len(self.upanchors) < level:
9762  self.upanchors.append(self.upanchors[-1])
9763  upanchor = UpAnchor().create(container)
9764  self.upanchors.append(upanchor)
9765  return upanchor
9766 
9767  def createmainanchor(self):
9768  "Create the up anchor to the main page."
9769  mainanchor = UpAnchor().createmain()
9770  self.upanchors.append(mainanchor)
9771  return mainanchor
9772 
9773  def getupdestination(self, container):
9774  "Get the name of the up page."
9775  level = self.getlevel(container)
9776  if len(self.upanchors) < level:
9777  uppage = self.upanchors[-1]
9778  else:
9779  uppage = self.upanchors[level - 1]
9780  return uppage
9781 
9782  def getlevel(self, container):
9783  "Get the level of the container."
9784  if not container.partkey:
9785  return 1
9786  else:
9787  return container.partkey.level + 1
9788 
9789 class SplitFileBasket(MemoryBasket):
9790  "A memory basket which contains a part split into a file, possibly with a TOC."
9791 
9792  def __init__(self):
9793  MemoryBasket.__init__(self)
9794  self.entrycount = 0
9795  self.root = None
9796  self.converter = TOCConverter()
9797 
9798  def write(self, container):
9799  "Keep track of numbered layouts."
9800  MemoryBasket.write(self, container)
9801  if not container.partkey:
9802  return
9803  if container.partkey.header:
9804  return
9805  entry = self.converter.convert(container)
9806  if not entry:
9807  return
9808  self.entrycount += 1
9809  self.root = entry
9810 
9811  def addtoc(self):
9812  "Add the table of contents if necessary."
9813  if self.entrycount != 1:
9814  return
9815  if self.root.branches == []:
9816  return
9817  text = Translator.translate('toc-for') + self.root.partkey.tocentry
9818  toc = TableOfContents().create(text)
9819  self.addbranches(self.root, toc)
9820  toc.add(self.converter.convertindented(LyXFooter()))
9821  self.write(toc)
9822 
9823  def addbranches(self, entry, toc):
9824  "Add an entry and all of its branches to the table of contents."
9825  for branch in entry.branches:
9826  toc.add(self.converter.indent(branch))
9827  self.addbranches(branch, toc)
9828 
9829 class SplitPartBasket(Basket):
9830  "A basket used to split the output in different files."
9831 
9832  baskets = []
9833 
9834  def setwriter(self, writer):
9835  if not hasattr(writer, 'filename') or not writer.filename:
9836  Trace.error('Cannot use standard output for split output; ' +
9837  'please supply an output filename.')
9838  exit()
9839  self.writer = writer
9840  self.filename = writer.filename
9841  self.converter = TOCConverter()
9842  self.basket = MemoryBasket()
9843  self.basket.page = writer.filename
9844  return self
9845 
9846  def write(self, container):
9847  "Write a container, possibly splitting the file."
9848  self.basket.write(container)
9849 
9850  def splitbaskets(self):
9851  "Process the whole basket and create all baskets for split part pages."
9852  self.basket.process()
9853  basket = self.firstbasket()
9854  navigation = SplitPartNavigation()
9855  for container in self.basket.contents:
9856  if self.mustsplit(container):
9857  filename = self.getfilename(container)
9858  Trace.debug('New page ' + filename)
9859  basket.addtoc()
9860  navigation.writefooter(basket)
9861  basket = self.addbasket(filename)
9862  navigation.writeheader(basket, container)
9863  basket.write(container)
9864  if self.afterheader(container):
9865  navigation.writefirstheader(basket)
9866  self.mainanchor = navigation.upanchors[0]
9867  for basket in self.baskets:
9868  basket.process()
9869 
9870  def finish(self):
9871  "Process the whole basket, split into page baskets and flush all of them."
9872  self.splitbaskets()
9873  for basket in self.baskets:
9874  basket.flush()
9875 
9876  def afterheader(self, container):
9877  "Find out if this is the header on the file."
9878  return isinstance(container, LyXHeader)
9879 
9880  def firstbasket(self):
9881  "Create the first basket."
9882  return self.addbasket(self.filename, self.writer)
9883 
9884  def addbasket(self, filename, writer = None):
9885  "Add a new basket."
9886  if not writer:
9887  writer = LineWriter(filename)
9888  basket = SplitFileBasket()
9889  basket.setwriter(writer)
9890  self.baskets.append(basket)
9891  # set the page name everywhere
9892  basket.page = filename
9893  splitpartlink = SplitPartLink()
9894  splitpartlink.page = os.path.basename(basket.page)
9895  basket.processors = [splitpartlink]
9896  return basket
9897 
9898  def mustsplit(self, container):
9899  "Find out if the oputput file has to be split at this entry."
9900  if not container.partkey:
9901  return False
9902  if not container.partkey.filename:
9903  return False
9904  return True
9905 
9906  def getfilename(self, container):
9907  "Get the new file name for a given container."
9908  partname = container.partkey.filename
9909  basename = self.filename
9910  if Options.tocfor:
9911  basename = Options.tocfor
9912  base, extension = os.path.splitext(basename)
9913  return base + '-' + partname + extension
9914 
9915 class SplitTOCBasket(SplitPartBasket):
9916  "A basket which contains the TOC for a split part document."
9917 
9918  def finish(self):
9919  "Process the whole basket, split into page baskets and flush all of them."
9920  self.splitbaskets()
9921  tocbasket = TOCBasket().setwriter(self.writer)
9922  self.mainanchor.partkey = PartKey().createmain()
9923  tocbasket.write(self.mainanchor)
9924  for container in self.basket.contents:
9925  tocbasket.write(container)
9926  tocbasket.finish()
9927 
9928 
9929 
9930 
9931 
9932 
9933 class PostFormula(object):
9934  "Postprocess a formula"
9935 
9936  processedclass = Formula
9937 
9938  def postprocess(self, last, formula, next):
9939  "Postprocess any formulae"
9940  if Options.jsmath or Options.mathjax:
9941  return formula
9942  self.postnumbering(formula)
9943  return formula
9944 
9945  def postnumbering(self, formula):
9946  "Check if it's a numbered equation, insert number."
9947  if formula.header[0] != 'numbered':
9948  return
9949  functions = formula.searchremove(LabelFunction)
9950  if len(functions) == 0:
9951  label = self.createlabel(formula)
9952  elif len(functions) == 1:
9953  label = self.createlabel(formula, functions[0])
9954  if len(functions) <= 1:
9955  label.parent = formula
9956  formula.contents.insert(0, label)
9957  return
9958  for function in functions:
9959  label = self.createlabel(formula, function)
9960  row = self.searchrow(function)
9961  label.parent = row
9962  row.contents.insert(0, label)
9963 
9964  def createlabel(self, formula, function = None):
9965  "Create a new label for a formula."
9966  "Add a label to a formula."
9967  tag = self.createtag(formula)
9968  partkey = PartKey().createformula(tag)
9969  if not formula.partkey:
9970  formula.partkey = partkey
9971  if not function:
9972  label = Label()
9973  label.create(partkey.tocentry + ' ', 'eq-' + tag, type="eqnumber")
9974  else:
9975  label = function.label
9976  label.complete(partkey.tocentry + ' ')
9977  return label
9978 
9979  def createtag(self, formula):
9980  "Create the label tag."
9981  tags = formula.searchall(FormulaTag)
9982  if len(tags) == 0:
9983  return NumberGenerator.chaptered.generate('formula')
9984  if len(tags) > 1:
9985  Trace.error('More than one tag in formula: ' + unicode(formula))
9986  return tags[0].tag
9987 
9988  def searchrow(self, function):
9989  "Search for the row that contains the label function."
9990  if isinstance(function.parent, Formula) or isinstance(function.parent, FormulaRow):
9991  return function.parent
9992  return self.searchrow(function.parent)
9993 
9994 Postprocessor.stages.append(PostFormula)
9995 
9996 
9997 
9998 class eLyXerConverter(object):
9999  "Converter for a document in a lyx file. Places all output in a given basket."
10000 
10001  def __init__(self):
10002  self.filtering = False
10003 
10004  def setio(self, ioparser):
10005  "Set the InOutParser"
10006  self.reader = ioparser.getreader()
10007  self.basket = self.getbasket()
10008  self.basket.setwriter(ioparser.getwriter())
10009  return self
10010 
10011  def getbasket(self):
10012  "Get the appropriate basket for the current options."
10013  if Options.tocfor:
10014  if Options.splitpart:
10015  return SplitTOCBasket()
10016  return TOCBasket()
10017  if Options.splitpart:
10018  return SplitPartBasket()
10019  if Options.memory:
10020  return MemoryBasket()
10021  return WriterBasket()
10022 
10023  def embed(self, reader):
10024  "Embed the results from elyxer.a reader into a memory basket."
10025  "Header and footer are ignored. Useful for embedding one document inside another."
10026  self.filtering = True
10027  self.reader = reader
10028  self.basket = MemoryBasket()
10029  return self
10030 
10031  def convert(self):
10032  "Perform the conversion for the document"
10033  try:
10034  self.processcontents()
10035  except (Exception):
10036  version = '[eLyXer version ' + GeneralConfig.version['number']
10037  version += ' (' + GeneralConfig.version['date'] + ') in '
10038  version += Options.location + '] '
10039  Trace.error(version)
10040  Trace.error('Conversion failed at ' + self.reader.currentline())
10041  raise
10042 
10043  def processcontents(self):
10044  "Parse the contents and write it by containers"
10045  factory = ContainerFactory()
10046  processor = Processor(self.filtering)
10047  while not self.reader.finished():
10048  container = factory.createcontainer(self.reader)
10049  result = processor.process(container)
10050  self.writecontainer(result)
10051  result = processor.postprocess(None)
10052  self.writecontainer(result)
10053  if not self.filtering:
10054  self.basket.finish()
10055 
10056  def writecontainer(self, container):
10057  "Write each container to the correct basket."
10058  if not container:
10059  return
10060  includes = container.searchremove(IncludeInset)
10061  self.basket.write(container)
10062  # recursive processing for IncludeInset
10063  for include in includes:
10064  for element in include.contents:
10065  self.basket.write(element)
10066 
10067  def getcontents(self):
10068  "Return the contents of the basket."
10069  return self.basket.contents
10070 
10071  def __unicode__(self):
10072  "Printable representation."
10073  string = 'Converter with filtering ' + unicode(self.filtering)
10074  string += ' and basket ' + unicode(self.basket)
10075  return string
10076 
10077 class InOutParser(object):
10078  "Parse in and out arguments"
10079 
10080  def __init__(self):
10081  self.filein = sys.stdin
10082  self.fileout = sys.stdout
10083 
10084  def parse(self, args):
10085  "Parse command line arguments"
10086  self.filein = sys.stdin
10087  self.fileout = sys.stdout
10088  if len(args) < 2:
10089  Trace.quietmode = True
10090  if len(args) > 0:
10091  self.filein = args[0]
10092  del args[0]
10093  self.readdir(self.filein, 'directory')
10094  else:
10095  Options.directory = '.'
10096  if len(args) > 0:
10097  self.fileout = args[0]
10098  del args[0]
10099  self.readdir(self.fileout, 'destdirectory')
10100  else:
10101  Options.destdirectory = '.'
10102  if len(args) > 0:
10103  raise Exception('Unused arguments: ' + unicode(args))
10104  return self
10105 
10106  def getreader(self):
10107  "Get the resulting reader."
10108  return LineReader(self.filein)
10109 
10110  def getwriter(self):
10111  "Get the resulting writer."
10112  return LineWriter(self.fileout)
10113 
10114  def readdir(self, filename, diroption):
10115  "Read the current directory if needed"
10116  if getattr(Options, diroption) != None:
10117  return
10118  setattr(Options, diroption, os.path.dirname(filename))
10119  if getattr(Options, diroption) == '':
10120  setattr(Options, diroption, '.')
10121 
10122 class NullWriter(object):
10123  "A writer that goes nowhere."
10124 
10125  def write(self, list):
10126  "Do nothing."
10127  pass
10128 
10129 class ConverterFactory(object):
10130  "Create a converter fit for converting a filename and embedding the result."
10131 
10132  def create(self, container):
10133  "Create a converter for a given container, with filename"
10134  " and possibly other parameters."
10135  fullname = os.path.join(Options.directory, container.filename)
10136  reader = LineReader(container.filename)
10137  if 'firstline' in container.lstparams:
10138  reader.setstart(int(container.lstparams['firstline']))
10139  if 'lastline' in container.lstparams:
10140  reader.setend(int(container.lstparams['lastline']))
10141  return eLyXerConverter().embed(reader)
10142 
10143 IncludeInset.converterfactory = ConverterFactory()
10144 
10145 def convertdoc(args):
10146  "Read a whole document from the command line and write it."
10147  Options().parseoptions(args)
10148  ioparser = InOutParser().parse(args)
10149  converter = eLyXerConverter().setio(ioparser)
10150  converter.convert()
10151 
10152 def main():
10153  "Main function, called if invoked from the command line"
10154  convertdoc(list(sys.argv))
10155 
10156 
10157 
10158 if __name__ == '__main__':
10159  main()
